position: Intern to support Children and Youth and Make a Difference!
description:
Full Job Description

Nonprofit Internships and Volunteer Opportunities

Cause: Children and Youth

Manhattan OR Remote / Virtual / Work from Home

Many students, recent graduates, and professionals have lost (or been unable to find) internships or jobs due to COVID-19. We feel so bad for all those who have been impacted in that way.

While we cannot pay, our nonprofit does offer an outstanding opportunity to use your skills, gain experience, enhance your resume, and make a tremendous positive social impact on the causes or communities you care about, including Children and Youth.

Greatest Impact

This may be the single best opportunity for you to make the greatest possible positive impact in the world.

Who Is It For?

We have many roles to fill here, so we need high-achieving interns and volunteers with a range of experience. We therefore welcome:

· Professionals who want to volunteer part-time

· "Dependent Spouses" of H1-B, F1, and L1 visa holders

· Recent graduates, including international students on OPT

· Undergraduate and graduate school students, including international students on CPT, who want to intern or to join us as a school ambassador

· Outstanding high school students, who want to intern or to join us as a school ambassador

Credit for Students

Internships with ChangingThePresent are eligible for credit from many schools, and we are happy to do our part to meet the school's requirements.

When

We are always hiring: school year or summer; full-time or part-time.

About Us

ChangingThePresent.org is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit. The New York Times called us an “Amazon.com of the nonprofit world.”

We make the experience of a donation, which you can give in a friend’s name, feel like a rewarding present and an appealing alternative to buying and giving yet more unwanted "stuff." In this way, we are starting to channel to nonprofits some of the $450 billion Americans spend each year buying birthday, wedding, holiday, and corporate presents. Imagine how much good we could all do together as more of that money goes to making a difference.

· Our visitors can contribute to provide school children with their first book, preserve an acre of the wilderness, fund an hour of cancer research, etc.

· Wish lists and registries let them share their dreams for a better world.

· Personalized greeting cards make a charitable gift especially memorable. Gift cards let friends support the things they care about.

We already work with hundreds of the most prestigious nonprofits in the country, and we are now opening the site to all nonprofits so they can all attract additional funding for their important missions.

Unprecedented Opportunities for Responsibility and Leadership

Our interns and volunteers get more responsibility than they would anywhere else. You can take a leadership role.

Focus on Children and Youth Nonprofits

We seek high-achieving interns and volunteers who want to take a leadership role and make a difference for the cause of Children and Youth.

You can also choose to focus on your favorite causes (including education, hunger, women, children, cancer, human rights, environment, women, veterans, etc.) or the charitable needs of any ethnic group, religious group, city, or country. Please see the growing list of causes, countries, cities, ethnic groups, and religious groups on which we focus at https://changingthepresent.org/collections/gifts

For the Children and Youth and Every Cause, Interns and Volunteers Will do the Following:

· Identify, research, prioritize, and invite potential Advisors and Experts.

· Identify, research, prioritize, and invite nonprofits, who can register and list their charitable gifts at no cost. The opportunity for them is discussed in the slideshow on this page: https://changingthepresent.org/pages/for-nonprofits

· Identify, research, prioritize, and pitch magazines, websites, blogs, professional organizations, social media channels, online communities, and other ways to reach people who care about each specific cause.

· Identify, research, and pitch strategic partners for the cause.

· Identify, research, prioritize, and pitch sources of growth funding (philanthropists, corporations, or foundations)

· Conceive of and create cause marketing sponsorship proposals.

· Identify and invite the promotional support of celebrities who support the cause/community.

Focus on Ethnic, Religious, City, or Country Communities

We also have opportunities to focus on the charitable needs of any ethnic, religious, city, or country communities.

Opportunities for Most Areas of Academic / Professional Focus

We also have positions that align with a wide range of academic and professional fields, including business development, analytics, finance, accounting, technology, web development, Salesforce, database, computer science, science, STEM education, marketing, digital marketing, communications, social media, publishing, Human Resources, organizational psychology, research, education, and graphics.

Specific Markets

Some interns focus on specific markets, such as the high school market, college market, wedding market, or corporate gift market.

You Benefit

We want all our interns to get the following from their experience here:

· Make a tremendous positive impact in the world.

· Use your skills, experience, knowledge, creativity and talent.

· Assume responsibility and take a leadership role.

· Learn a tremendous amount.

· Work with people from around the world in a diverse and supportive community, and have a great time.

· Enhance your resume with a record of professional achievement and community service.

· Receive a great letter of recommendation.

When

We welcome full-time and part-time interns during the school year and/or the summer. We are entrepreneurial and flexible, and we are always hiring.

Where

Our office is conveniently located at 7th Avenue and 33 Streets in Manhattan. We also have interns who work remotely (as are all of us during the pandemic).

Please Share

We hope you will also share this opportunity with anyone who might be interested.

* *Learn More and Apply Now

Read more about our internships at:

https://ChangingThePresent.org/pages/interns-and-volunteers.

Then, please send a resume and short cover letter about your specific interests and your available dates/days/hours to: join [AT] ChangingThePresent [DOT] org.

Thank you very much!

Full Job Description
This position can combine both software engineering and building dashboards along with project/program management where the intern will assist with tracking deliverables with internal stakeholders, creating status reports, and quality control among deliverables..

Position Purpose:
Learn various job functions within the Managed Care industry and explore various career opportunities
Apply academic knowledge and learn new skills by contributing to various projects
Research various legal, regulatory, and other topics within functional area and industry
Attend training and development presentations to enhance professional competencies

Learn about various processes and functions within the Managed Care industry and develop professionally by contributing to projects that support the business.

Experience/Experience:
High school diploma or equivalent. Must be enrolled in an undergraduate program at an accredited university or college, preferably in a field related to the hiring department through the internship period.

Preferred Majors - Software Engineering, Computer Science

Skills - Basic SQL, Java Programming, Tableau, Python; Any Cloud Technology experience or AWS certification

Centene is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Full Job Description

Vanguard National Trailer is a premier manufacturer of dry and refrigerated semi-trailers for North America. Our subsidiary CIMC Vehicle Group is the world’s leading manufacturer of commercial transport, dry and refrigerated container and trailer equipment with subsidiaries across the globe.

We are GROWING!!! We are currently looking for an amazing person to join our IT Team.

The IT Intern will have an amazing experience in a manufacturing environment assisting the IT Department. This position will report directly to the Director of IT.

Job Responsibilities include:

TITLE: Information Technology Intern

This is a full time paid internship with a flexible schedule to accommodate class schedules.

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Basic understanding of hardware (PC, printers, etc.) and troubleshooting skills
  • Work with vendors for IT related equipment
  • Improve customer satisfaction
  • Create and update documentation as needed

RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:

  • Provide infrastructure operations support including support for network equipment and local area IT site support (PCs, printers, mobile devices and phones)
  • Pursuing undergraduate or graduate degree in CS related field
  • Proficient in Microsoft applications / SQL - Office
  • Understanding of computer networks and infrastructure
  • Proficient in mobile devices and applications
  • Excellent people-skills (outgoing, approachable, motivated to help), including the ability to train end users on security and other aspects
  • May be required to lift and carry equipment up to 50 pounds

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Internship

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Work Location:

  • One location

Internship Compensation:

  • Pay

Full Job Description

LOOKING FOR A GREAT, HANDS-ON INTERNSHIP IN A UNIQUE REAL ESTATE COMPANY?

We currently have an outstanding opportunity for an energetic individual to play a significant role in a fast-growing business.

TruDream Properties, LLC is a rapidly growing, A-rated real estate business specializing in the acquisition and sale of vacant land throughout the United States. We buy and sell hundreds of parcels every year and are dedicated to bringing a piece of the American dream to everyday people by allowing them to buy land at affordable prices! We offer a unique environment that fosters individual growth and rewards performance.

As a Data Analyst Intern, you will be responsible for interpreting data, using statistical techniques, writing and delivering reports, maintaining databases, and providing assistance to management.

What You Will Be Doing:

  • Performing data research to help find the best locations to target for buying and selling land using relevant metrics such as sale prices, days on market, total sales, total available properties, properties on market, etc.
  • Performing data collection, data analysis, digital analysis and reporting of key measurements.
  • Reviewing and analyzing internal stats and produce reports on key performance indicators inside the company.
  • Managing data through various reporting tools for data analysis to support ongoing operations.

What Skills & Traits Will You Need:

  • Prefer second year or third year students, studying undergraduate Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics, Business Management, Information Systems or related programs of study. Master’s degree candidates will also be considered
  • Advanced Excel skills
  • Ability to draw insights from data set that are actionable for the business.

What You Can Expect from Us:

  • Exposure to corporate environments
  • Critical thinking / problem solving skills
  • Possible performance bonuses
  • Free parking
  • Workplace perks such as free food/water/coffee
  • Flexible work schedules
  • The joy of coming to work each day and leaving knowing you have made a difference in someone’s life.

You will have the potential to gain experience, enhanced skill sets, and competencies that will make you more prepared for future roles.

Come join our team bringing joy to people on a daily basis! To be part of something new and exciting, follow the instructions below.

HOW TO APPLY

IMPORTANT: If you fit our ideal profile, please follow these application instructions carefully. Failure to do so will result in immediate disqualification:

To apply for this position, reply to this post with your resume and cover letter in confidence explaining why you are an ideal candidate for this position.

To learn more about us, visit us at www.TruDreamProperties.com.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Internship

Pay: $15.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule

Supplemental Pay:

  • Bonus pay

  • One location

  • College Credit

Company's website:

  • www.TruDreamProperties.com

Company's Facebook page:

Work Remotely:

COVID-19 Precaution(s):

  • Personal protective equipment provided or required
  • Plastic shield at work stations
  • Temperature screenings
  • Social distancing guidelines in place
  • Virtual meetings
  • Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

position: Data Science Intern - Search and Information Retrieval
description:
Full Job Description
At Grainger, we’re committed to our purpose – We Keep the World Working. Grainger is a leading global supplier of maintenance, repair, and operational supplies, providing services and solutions for every industry. Our 25,000 employees are driven to serve customers and the community in exceptional ways, focusing on delivering the highest level of service leveraging the most innovative solutions. As part of a high-performing team, you’ll be able to develop your talents and make a difference. Grainger is a Fortune 500 company and a perennial member of Fortune magazine's Most Admired Companies list.

Grainger is a leader in data driven culture and decision making. Our Analytics & Data team operates as a center of excellence helping leaders and teams across all areas of the business make decisions based on informed insights that enhance our customer experience and improve business performance.

At Grainger, you will be working with analysts, data scientists and AI experts with very diverse backgrounds and strong technical expertise. Our team's mission is to use multiple different technology platforms to build data-driven cutting-edge solutions and capabilities using machine learning and big data with a focus on Predictive Analytics, Deep Learning, Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing, as well as other relevant areas.

\As a Data Science Intern in the Search Team, you will apply these techniques using a wealth of internal and external data to develop insights in the areas of e-commerce search and to help customer searching on Grainger.com to find products faster. Your work would directly impact end users and would influence how customers find and buy products on Grainger.com. The work that the intern does will go towards contributing to the suite of search solutions that power e-commerce search and transactions on Grainger.com

The ideal candidate for this position is someone with strong programming experience, someone with problem-solving skills and someone who is willing to research approaches to tackle new problems. The candidate should be able to work independently and be comfortable reaching out to colleagues in the larger team.

Responsibilities

Explore, analyze and interpret data both structured and unstructured, predominantly text
Perform high-impact exploratory analyses and investigations to enrich our understanding of how people interact with grainger.com over time
Research and develop solutions to new and challenging business problems
Collaborate with team members and business partners to understand their goals
Present and provide insights both to internal teams and stakeholders

Requirements

Preferably pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics or any Engineering discipline
Master’s degree is preferred
Expected graduation with a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree between Winter 2021 – Spring 2022
Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher
Significant experience with the Python programming language, In particular:
Familiarity with data analysis tools in Python
Exposure to web applications in Python
Experience with utilizing Machine Learning libraries in Python
Knowledge of relational databases and SQL
Passion for data analysis and excited to build data/ML solutions
Completing a degree, or pursuing an advanced degree in a quantitative discipline
Interest in ML for NLP, Search and Information Retrieval

Preferred Qualifications

Coursework in Algorithms, NLP, Information Retrieval, Search Engines
Familiarity with Web Applications, REST APIs

Grainger is an Equal Opportunity Workplace and an Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

Full Job Description
About our group:
The Consumer Solutions Group’s Product Line Manager Team carefully reviews market trends and user interaction for storage devices and value-added software. The team includes Product Managers, UX Designers, Documentation Writers/Editors and a Data Scientist. The telemetry we receive from our software is critical to all members of the team since it is highly leveraged for decision-making with current and future products.

About the role - you will:
The Data Analyst Intern will help maintain and build out the analytics capabilities for the Consumer Solutions Group. The position will collaborate with internal teams to ensure the accuracy and integrity of the data in Amazon Web Services Redshift, Oracle and other databases. The position will also help produce reports and analyses using Looker, our business intelligence and data analytics platform. The ideal candidate will have the basic understanding of gathering data, clean up, aggregation, analysis and insights. They should have experience with data storage, cleanup and manipulation technologies like SQL or Excel. Responsibilities could include one or more of the following:

  • Work with internal teams to modify existing or create new telemetry for our software products
  • Verify and validate the data collected from our software products using SQL
  • Create data visualizations or modify existing reports using Looker
  • Help maintain our existing data infrastructure and assist in performance improvement initiatives
  • Assist in improving our data collection infrastructure using Boomi – our iPaas Platform (Integration Platform as a Service)
  • Analyze Drive Health with Machine Learning to allow Predictive Analysis to anticipate Drive Failure
Interns typically work Monday thru Friday 8am to 5pm. The hours are subject to change with or without notice at the sole discretion of Seagate.

About you:
  • Current student pursuing a BS degree in Computer Science or Data Science and returning to school in Fall 2021
  • Analytical and data driven mindset
  • Attention to detail and documented, repeatable processes
  • Knowledgeable in data storage, data cleanup and data manipulation techniques
  • Direct experience with SQL
  • Proficiency in some programming language (C, C++, Python)
  • Familiarity with Machine Learning / AI and Predictive Analysis
  • Experience with Looker, Alteryx or KNIME are a plus
Location:
In response to COVID-19, this position may temporarily begin and be performed remotely. Seagate is actively evaluating the virus and our employees' health and safety are our top priority. In the future, this position will report to and be performed at our Fremont, CA

Location: Fremont, CA

Our Gold LEED-certified Fremont product-design campus drives innovation, bringing together a diverse set of engineering, design, operations, support and administrative teams. The site is equipped with state-of-the-art clean room and lab space. On-site social activities are popular, including our annual BBQ, ice cream social, and holiday events. Wellness programs, gaming rooms and the on-site fitness center help round out and balance your Seagate work-life experience, along with opportunities to give back to our local community.

description:

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Internship

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekends

Work Location:

  • Fully Remote

Internship Compensation:

  • College Credit

COVID-19 Precaution(s):

  • Remote interview process
  • Virtual meetings

Full Job Description
Program Overview:
Our Summer Intern program offers hardworking college students an opportunity to go beyond the classroom to develop leadership skills and gain relevant hands on experience working as part of a global support team with professionals across the enterprise. Additionally, interns will participate in scheduled activities throughout the summer, including sessions with Senior Leaders, site tours, volunteer opportunities, and other social events. Fiserv interns are in session from June 2, 2021 – August 13, 2021 and work approximately 40 hours per week.

Do you want to work on leveraging the latest cloud technologies in solving business problems? Do you want to work with colleagues who are establishing the next generation application platform for Fiserv? You will gain an insight into real world systems, the challenges associated with such systems and best practices in solving the challenges.

Card Services from Fiserv enables financial institutions of any size to maximize their payments business, improve acquisition and retention, reduce expenses, minimize risk and grow share of wallet. We provide services for payments, processing services, Risk and Compliance, and gaining insights into spending habits

Candidate Qualifications & Education Requirements

What we are looking for…

Currently pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Analytics and more
GPA 3.0+ preferred
Knowledge of cloud architecture like Azure, AWS etc.
Knowledge of a programming language like Java, Python, Go, C, C+ etc.
Ability to diagnose and fix issues Passion for technology and automation
Military-Affiliated candidates encouraged to apply (Veterans, Military Spouses, and Guard/Reservists)
Must possess unrestricted work authorization and not require future sponsorship

Majors:
A wide range of bachelor’s degree programs considered, based upon specific department needs, such as: Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Data Analytics, Finance, Economics, Accounting, Business Administration, Mathematics, Supply Chain, Human Resources, Purchasing, Sales and Communications

Learn more about Fiserv:
To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that provides flexibility and affordability with a variety of medical, dental, vision, life insurance and disability options.

We are #FISVProud of our benefits and well-being programs. Our commitment to wellness, wellness education, preventive services and fitness activities are designed to meet you where you are.

Life moves fast. And as it does, we know most people aren’t thinking about “financial services”. But we are.

We help people and businesses move money and information every minute of every day. Our solutions connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another, millions of times a day, behind the scenes, reliably and securely.

We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments enabling innovative financial services experiences that are in step with the way people live and work today. The company’s approximately 44,000 associates proudly serve clients in more than 100 countries, so their customers, members and consumers can move money when and where they need it, at the point of thought.

Our Aspiration is to move money and information in a way that moves the world. As a FORTUNE™ 500 company and one of FORTUNE Magazine World’s Most Admired Companies for the seventh consecutive year, we are committed to excellence and purposeful innovation.

We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran

Explore the possibilities of a career with Fiserv and Find Your Forward with us.

Full Job Description

TourMega (http://tourmega.com) is an exciting new travel startup that’s looking to disrupt the tours and activities space. We are using AI to assist the users easily plan then enjoy their trip with only a few clicks. We are also collecting data from various travel sites from all over the world to build a platform that generate trip itineraries that include point of interests & attractions, tours and activities, as well as restaurants for our users based on their travel interests and behaviors.
We have the largest tours, activities, points of interest inventory in the world of over 300,000 tours, 200,000 points of interests and landmarks in a 190 countries and 5000 cities. In addition, we are also building and a chatbot to assist our users with any travel questions on-the-go.

We’re looking for a computer science graduate intern who wants to help us with the following things:

  • Web scraping – How to collect data from different websites, process them, and turn them into your data
  • Collecting data via API
  • Integrate search data into your search servers like elasticsearch
  • Build a recommendation system using machine learning algorithms like NLP, data entity extra extractions, etc
  • Build and add many features to our web app that runs on Ruby on Rails.

Qualifications:

  • You’re pursuing a degree in Computer Science or related fields
  • You have some basic programming background and experience
  • Knowledge of Web scraping - Ruby / Python
  • Knowledge Regular expression, javascript skills is a plus
  • Knowledge or experience with Ruby on Rails is a plus

Bonus:

  • You love to travel
  • Willing to learn new skills, tech stacks
  • Strong communication skills, adaptable and work under pressure

Interested candidates please send your resume to jobs @ tourmega.com with a link to your portfolio or github profile. We are looking forward to hearing from you!

Full Job Description

Job Description

Skyline Security Consulting Inc. is seeking a talented Cyber Compliance Intern to join one of the region's fastest-growing companies. This internship will consist of a combination of some on-site (headquarters office), some virtual (remote) work , and training. This is an UNPAID INTERNSHIP, however there will be expenses paid monthly totaling $500. These expenses incurred by the intern will be paid on the 1st and 15th of the month, $250 for each cycle.

As a Skyline Security intern, you will be learning how to detect, mitigate and exploit risks and vulnerabilities in information systems, as well as help, develop and test custom cybersecurity tools in support of internal operations and client projects. You will learn how to properly identify, implement, document, and validate NIST SP 800-53 security controls in accordance with various cybersecurity frameworks such as NIST RMF, CSF, and others. You will also learn how to maintain compliance with requirements such as PCI DSS, ISO 27001, FISMA, HIPAA/HITECH, and more under the direction of highly experienced and certified industry professionals.

As a Skyline Security intern, you will support IT Compliance within the Information Technology framework, collaborating with a broad team of technical and business resources and delivering customer-focused support to Skyline Security Consulting Inc.’s operational and compliance needs.

The responsibilities of the position include, but are not limited to, the following:

  • Evaluating system projects for IT controls compliance requirements
  • Defining IT controls compliance requirements
  • Coordinating IT controls design and implementation
  • Validating IT controls have been effectively designed and executed

In order to be qualified for this role, you must possess the following:

  • Be enrolled in a Computer Science, Information Systems or related four-year degree program as a Junior or Senior (graduate students are also welcome to apply)
  • Have a strong interest in Cyber Security, especially for networks, systems, and software
  • Have technical ability to understand networking, systems administration, and other facets of information technology
  • A background in software development using any mainstream programming language (e.g. Python, Java, etc.) is preferred, but not required
  • Basic knowledge of Security, Cyber Risk, IT general controls
  • Basic knowledge of FFIEC, NIST Cybersecurity Framework, and other auditing standards.
  • Basic knowledge of CISSP and CISA Certifications and requirements.
  • Ability to research and write technical assessments of various aspects of Cybersecurity Controls
  • Ability to document large volumes of electronic files involved in an Audit or Risk Assessment
  • Ability to manage time and prioritize projects and tasks
  • Ability to work well with internal customers, understand needs and support appropriately
  • Ability to communicate effectively, represent technical topic in business terms
  • Able to communicate clearly via email, telephone, or in-person with staff, clients, leadership, and industry partners
  • Be able to meet monthly in-person, in Bridgewater NJ for monthly Staff meetings
  • Enrolled in an IT Major E.g. Computer Science, Computer Info. Systems, or Management Info. Systems or equivalent
  • Ability to pass a background and drug screening
  • Minimum 3.0 GPA required

position: Exciting Data Analytics & BM Internship at Sports AI Start-Up Summer '21
description:
Full Job Description

Sparrow is an early-stage startup that uses artificial intelligence (AI) to help athletes improve.

We are offering a valuable Business Marketing Spring internship for a bright, motivated, resourceful college student or recent college graduate looking to learn the ins and outs of the startup, A.I., and sports worlds.

You’ll work closely with the company’s serial-entrepreneur CEO & core business marketing team to strategize and execute the 2021 agenda, including:

  • Sparrow's app store launch
  • Email marketing campaigns
  • User feedback communication
  • Data analytics system
  • Social media presence (including content creation)
  • Public relations
  • Influencer outreach
  • And much more!

Person sought must:

  • Be a student at or a recent graduate of a reputable 4-year college, with either a business, communications or marketing related degree and/or experience
  • Be able to work an 8 hour work day (-40 hours per week) end of May through end of August 2021 or longer
  • Be uber-productive, able to switch between different kinds of tasks, and comfortable taking on all jobs complex or mundane.
  • Be experienced and comfortable using online tools like G Suite, email marketing platforms and social media outlets like Youtube, Instagram, and Twitter.
  • Be very detail-oriented and thoughtful when executing a task or initiative
  • Be able to figure out how things work, or how to get things done when a solution isn’t obvious or involves multiple steps or tools

This position represents a unique opportunity to:

  • Work closely with the company founders, successful serial entrepreneurs who have started numerous companies, raised over $20 million in venture capital for them, and have 2 successful exits. (check out our founders here: https://youtu.be/r82gufgzltg)
  • Learn the ins-and-outs of running a startup with tremendous potential that is just getting started
  • Receive a $50 weekly stipend, college credit and potentially earn an equity bonus (stock options), and more importantly gain relationships in the tech, AI, and sports industry

Testimonials from Sparrow’s Intern Classes

* My time at Sparrow has been great! I’ve learned the ins and outs of what it takes to successfully run a business + gained valuable insight from the founders. -Gabriel R., Yale University (Men’s Varsity Golf, Econ)

* I was given real responsibilities while working alongside people who really exemplified what it means to be a part of a team. - Georgia L., Williams College (Women’s Varsity Soccer, Psych Major)

*I definitely feel as though I’m honing important skills and experience for when I enter the job market.” said the rising senior. - Abby E., Pomona College in CA (Women’s Varsity Golf, Psych Major)

*At Sparrow I assisted with fundraising rounds, analyzing consumer/user data & conceptualizing macro marketing schemes - experiences that will help me for years to come. - Nick S., USC (Business Major)

* I loved getting exposure into the fast paced start-up world - my internship with Sparrow was awesome!

- Rebecca R., Brown University (Women’s Varsity Soccer, Applied Math major)

* Interning at Sparrow was so valuable! I got to work with the founders and see first hand how a successful company is made! - Annie M, Lehigh (Womens’ Varsity Lacrosse, Business Major)

* My internship with Sparrow was great! I worked on an investment and PR project that contributed to the launch of the company. - Colette M., Columbia University (Women's Varsity Soccer)

** My internship with Sparrow was a valuable one. I worked closely with the co-founders & gained valuable insight into the inner workings of a great startup. - Adam X., Harvard University (Men’s Varsity Golf)

* I worked with an expert machine learning advisor, got my name on a patent and had an all around amazing experience with Sparrow! Trevor J., University of Michigan (Computer Science Major)

position: Intern to support Dental Care and Make a Difference!
description:
Full Job Description

Nonprofit Internships and Volunteer Opportunities

Cause: Dental Care

Manhattan OR Remote / Virtual / Work from Home

Many students, recent graduates, and professionals have lost (or been unable to find) internships or jobs due to COVID-19. We feel so bad for all those who have been impacted in that way.

While we cannot pay, our nonprofit does offer an outstanding opportunity to use your skills, gain experience, enhance your resume, and make a tremendous positive social impact on the causes or communities you care about, including Dental Care.

Greatest Impact

This may be the single best opportunity for you to make the greatest possible positive impact in the world.

Who Is It For?

We have many roles to fill here, so we need high-achieving interns and volunteers with a range of experience. We therefore welcome:

· Professionals who want to volunteer part-time

· "Dependent Spouses" of H1-B, F1, and L1 visa holders

· Recent graduates, including international students on OPT

· Undergraduate and graduate school students, including international students on CPT, who want to intern or to join us as a school ambassador

· Outstanding high school students, who want to intern or to join us as a school ambassador

Credit for Students

Internships with ChangingThePresent are eligible for credit from many schools, and we are happy to do our part to meet the school's requirements.

When

We are always hiring: school year or summer; full-time or part-time.

About Us

ChangingThePresent.org is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit. The New York Times called us an “Amazon.com of the nonprofit world.”

We make the experience of a donation, which you can give in a friend’s name, feel like a rewarding present and an appealing alternative to buying and giving yet more unwanted "stuff." In this way, we are starting to channel to nonprofits some of the $450 billion Americans spend each year buying birthday, wedding, holiday, and corporate presents. Imagine how much good we could all do together as more of that money goes to making a difference.

· Our visitors can contribute to provide school children with their first book, preserve an acre of the wilderness, fund an hour of cancer research, etc.

· Wish lists and registries let them share their dreams for a better world.

· Personalized greeting cards make a charitable gift especially memorable. Gift cards let friends support the things they care about.

We already work with hundreds of the most prestigious nonprofits in the country, and we are now opening the site to all nonprofits so they can all attract additional funding for their important missions.

Unprecedented Opportunities for Responsibility and Leadership

Our interns and volunteers get more responsibility than they would anywhere else. You can take a leadership role.

Focus on Dental Care Nonprofits

We seek high-achieving interns and volunteers who want to take a leadership role and make a difference for the cause of Dental Care.

You can also choose to focus on your favorite causes (including education, hunger, women, children, cancer, human rights, environment, women, veterans, etc.) or the charitable needs of any ethnic group, religious group, city, or country. Please see the growing list of causes, countries, cities, ethnic groups, and religious groups on which we focus at https://changingthepresent.org/collections/gifts

For the Dental Care and Every Cause, Interns and Volunteers Will do the Following:

· Identify, research, prioritize, and invite potential Advisors and Experts.

· Identify, research, prioritize, and invite nonprofits, who can register and list their charitable gifts at no cost. The opportunity for them is discussed in the slideshow on this page: https://changingthepresent.org/pages/for-nonprofits

· Identify, research, prioritize, and pitch magazines, websites, blogs, professional organizations, social media channels, online communities, and other ways to reach people who care about each specific cause.

· Identify, research, and pitch strategic partners for the cause.

· Identify, research, prioritize, and pitch sources of growth funding (philanthropists, corporations, or foundations)

· Conceive of and create cause marketing sponsorship proposals.

· Identify and invite the promotional support of celebrities who support the cause/community.

Focus on Ethnic, Religious, City, or Country Communities

We also have opportunities to focus on the charitable needs of any ethnic, religious, city, or country communities.

Opportunities for Most Areas of Academic / Professional Focus

We also have positions that align with a wide range of academic and professional fields, including business development, analytics, finance, accounting, technology, web development, Salesforce, database, computer science, science, STEM education, marketing, digital marketing, communications, social media, publishing, Human Resources, organizational psychology, research, education, and graphics.

Specific Markets

Some interns focus on specific markets, such as the high school market, college market, wedding market, or corporate gift market.

You Benefit

We want all our interns to get the following from their experience here:

· Make a tremendous positive impact in the world.

· Use your skills, experience, knowledge, creativity and talent.

· Assume responsibility and take a leadership role.

· Learn a tremendous amount.

· Work with people from around the world in a diverse and supportive community, and have a great time.

· Enhance your resume with a record of professional achievement and community service.

· Receive a great letter of recommendation.

When

We welcome full-time and part-time interns during the school year and/or the summer. We are entrepreneurial and flexible, and we are always hiring.

Where

Our office is conveniently located at 7th Avenue and 33 Streets in Manhattan. We also have interns who work remotely (as are all of us during the pandemic).

Please Share

We hope you will also share this opportunity with anyone who might be interested.

* *Learn More and Apply Now

Read more about our internships at:

https://ChangingThePresent.org/pages/interns-and-volunteers.

Then, please send a resume and short cover letter about your specific interests and your available dates/days/hours to: join [AT] ChangingThePresent [DOT] org.

Thank you very much!

Full Job Description
EnerSys is the global leader in stored energy solutions for industrial applications. We have over thirty manufacturing and assembly plants worldwide servicing over 10,000 customers in more than 100 countries. Worldwide headquarters are located in Reading, PA, USA with regional headquarters in Europe and Asia. We complement our extensive line of Motive Power and Energy Systems with a full range of integrated services and systems. With sales and service locations throughout the world, and over 100 years of battery experience, EnerSys is the power/full solution for stored DC power products. We continue to grow in our industry by ensuring all employees possess the following core competencies: customer focused, team player, engaged, ethical, strong communication skills, and works safely.

Job Purpose

Provides embedded engineering support to systems engineering department to gain exposure and experience in desired field of study.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Develop and debug code for ARM micocontrollers
Develop applications for embedded Linux systems
Develop IoT based technologies for wired and wireless protocols (802.11 and 802.15.4)
Soldering and hands-on hardware debugging using tools such as oscilloscopes, multi-meters, DC power supplies, etc.
Devising controller peripherals and architecture layouts

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications

Candidate should be a graduate student or enrolled in undergraduate program related to computer science, electrical engineering, etc.
The candidate should have an outstanding academic record, excellent organizational, interpersonal communication and written skills, strong quantitative and computer skills.
General Job Requirements
This position will work in an office setting, expect minimal physical demands.

EnerSys provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. EEO/M/F/Vets/Disabled

EEO is the Law

EEO is the Law Supplement

Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination

The intern will work with applications and analysis related to meteorological towers, anemometers and other weather sensors, SoDAR units, and operating wind turbines, and on other assignments as needed.

Full Job Description
Program Overview:
Fiserv’s Summer Internship Program offers talented college students an opportunity to go beyond the classroom to develop leadership skills and gain meaningful hands on experience working as part of a global support team with professionals across the enterprise. Additionally, interns will participate in scheduled activities throughout the summer, including sessions with Senior Leaders, team projects, and other networking opportunities. Fiserv summer interns are in session from June 2, 2021 – August 13, 2021 and work approximately 40 hours per week.

Job Description

Fiserv Summer Interns will perform duties such as gathering and organizing data to provide information for departmental projects or reports; offering innovative suggestions; accompany professional level employees on assignments; request or give information and other related duties as assigned. Assignments serve to offer practical experience and broad exposure to the organization. Specific activities vary by assignment.

Qualifications:
Actively pursuing a bachelor’s degree and will graduate between December 2021 and June 2023.
3.5+ GPA preferred
Must have advanced Excel and PowerPoint knowledge and technical aptitude to learn new applications quickly
Able to handle multiple assignments simultaneously and effectively meet deadlines
Strategic and creative thinking; distinguished written and verbal communications skills
Strong initiative; a self-starter with analytical skills, attention to detail, problem-solving and decision-making abilities
Experience working in a fast-paced environment and flexible to changing priorities
Military-Affiliated candidates encouraged to apply (Veterans, Military Spouses, and Guard/Reservists)
Must possess unrestricted work authorization and not require future sponsorship

Majors:
A wide range of bachelor’s degree programs considered, based upon specific department needs, such as: Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Data Analytics, Finance, Economics, Accounting, Business Administration, Mathematics, Supply Chain, Human Resources, Purchasing, Sales and Communications

Please Note: Where we encourage you to apply now, our 2021 summer internship interview process begins in December and will continue through March. You can expect to hear from one of our recruiters if your qualifications

align.

Learn more about Fiserv:
To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that provides flexibility and affordability with a variety of medical, dental, vision, life insurance and disability options.

We are #FISVProud of our benefits and well-being programs. Our commitment to wellness, wellness education, preventive services and fitness activities are designed to meet you where you are.

Life moves fast. And as it does, we know most people aren’t thinking about “financial services”. But we are.

We help people and businesses move money and information every minute of every day. Our solutions connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another, millions of times a day, behind the scenes, reliably and securely.

We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments enabling innovative financial services experiences that are in step with the way people live and work today. The company’s approximately 44,000 associates proudly serve clients in more than 100 countries, so their customers, members and consumers can move money when and where they need it, at the point of thought.

Our Aspiration is to move money and information in a way that moves the world. As a FORTUNE™ 500 company and one of FORTUNE Magazine World’s Most Admired Companies for the seventh consecutive year, we are committed to excellence and purposeful innovation.

We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

  • Be very detail-oriented and thoughtful when executing a task or initiative
  • Be able to figure out how things work, or how to get things done when a solution isn’t obvious or involves multiple steps or tools

This position represents a unique opportunity to:

  • Work closely with the company founders, successful serial entrepreneurs who have started numerous companies, raised over $20 million in venture capital for them, and have 2 successful exits. (check out our founders here: https://youtu.be/r82gufgzltg)
  • Gain Experience in the PR and Business Marketing Fields
  • Learn the ins-and-outs of running a startup with tremendous potential that is just getting started
  • Receive a $50 weekly stipend, college credit and potentially earn an equity bonus (stock options), and more importantly gain relationships in the tech, AI, and sports industry

Testimonials from Sparrow’s Intern Classes

* My time at Sparrow has been great! I’ve learned the ins and outs of what it takes to successfully run a business + gained valuable insight from the founders. -Gabriel R., Yale University (Men’s Varsity Golf, Econ)

* I was given real responsibilities while working alongside people who really exemplified what it means to be a part of a team. - Georgia L., Williams College (Women’s Varsity Soccer, Psych Major)

*I definitely feel as though I’m honing important skills and experience for when I enter the job market.” said the rising senior. - Abby E., Pomona College in CA (Women’s Varsity Golf, Psych Major)

*At Sparrow I assisted with fundraising rounds, analyzing consumer/user data & conceptualizing macro marketing schemes - experiences that will help me for years to come. - Nick S., USC (Business Major)

* I loved getting exposure into the fast paced start-up world - my internship with Sparrow was awesome!

- Rebecca R., Brown University (Women’s Varsity Soccer, Applied Math major)

* Interning at Sparrow was so valuable! I got to work with the founders and see first hand how a successful company is made! - Annie M, Lehigh (Womens’ Varsity Lacrosse, Business Major)

* My internship with Sparrow was great! I worked on an investment and PR project that contributed to the launch of the company. - Colette M., Columbia University (Women's Varsity Soccer)

** My internship with Sparrow was a valuable one. I worked closely with the co-founders & gained valuable insight into the inner workings of a great startup. - Adam X., Harvard University (Men’s Varsity Golf)

* I worked with an expert machine learning advisor, got my name on a patent and had an all around amazing experience with Sparrow! Trevor J., University of Michigan (Computer Science Major)

position: Teacher, Assistant, Internship STEM Camps ==Coding, Minecraft, Robotics==
description:
Full Job Description

Summer STEM Teachers, Assistants, Internship (Minecraft, Coding & Robotics)
Hello, and thank you for your interest in our Summer Technology Teacher and Assistant Positions! Below is an overview of the program and positions as well as a few questions to help us determine if you are a good fit for our company.

============== APPLY ONLINE http://bit.ly/3e4ONvU =====================

************************
**JOB DESCRIPTION**
************************

You must be available for 8 weeks this summer from June 8 to August 7. Classes typically run Monday-Thursday with occasional Fridays, and you will need to be available from 8 am to 5 pm. Some classes run in only the morning or just the afternoon, and sometimes both.

As a Teacher or Assistant, you will be driving to your site, typically a school or community education building. You will typically be responsible for bringing 2-3 plastic bins of equipment per class, which you will then be set up in a classroom before students arrive. You will need vehicle to transport class equipment. Our headquarter location is in Roseville, Minnesota. You will need to go every 1 to 3 weeks to our headquarters for training and equipment pick up and drop off.

Rochester and St. Cloud teachers will only need to go twice in one summer

You will be delivering our curriculum to classes of up to 18 students. Teachers must be comfortable with managing up to 12 students alone. Grade level will vary between K-8th grades depending on the class.

************************
ABOUT PROGRAM:
************************
Tech Academy teaches week-long technology classes throughout the US. We offer classes in Minecraft, Movie Making, Video Game Design, Legos, and Robotics for students ages 6-14. We are seeking enthusiastic applicants for our Summer Camp Technology Teacher and Assistant positions.

Ideal applicants for Teacher positions are college students/graduates with experience with elementary-age children or licensed teachers.

Ideal applicants for Assistant positions are tech-savvy high school or college students, or those qualified for the Lead Teacher position looking for a more relaxed role in the classroom.

Many of our past employees were able to use positions to satisfy an internship requirement from school.

************************
Training and Equipment:
************************
Before teaching or assisting, teachers must complete 12 hours of online training on basic camp management and leadership skills. You must also complete an in-house 12-hour employee orientation.

The curriculum will be provided to each teacher for each class. You are required to go over the curriculum, and submit projects to us prior to teaching. We will available during business hours via phone and email to help you. You will be provided all of the equipment needed to teach a class each week.

************************************
Pay:
************************************
Teachers: $15-$20 an hour
Assistants $12-$16 an hour
Prep and training: $8.25 an hour

************************************
Requirements:
************************************
-College Student/Graduate majoring in Engineering, Computer Science, Graphic or Visual Arts, Video Game Design or Education
-Experience with Elementary age children
-Have a valid driver’s license
-You will be required to complete a local and national background check
-Be very comfortable with technology and using computers
-Your own reliable vehicle that can transport up to 4 large plastic totes
-Able to lift equipment totes weighing up to 40 pounds
-You must be very punctual and reliable. Students must always be supervised.
-You must be organized and efficient to run an effective class
-You must be self-confident, energetic, creative, and assertive enough to control a class of high energy elementary-age kids
-You need to be able to work independently and communicate via email and phone with us on a regular basis
Reliable access to the Internet and a cell phone.

Plusses:
Knowledge of Legos, Minecraft, or both Programming or Robotics experience of any kind

============== APPLY ONLINE http://bit.ly/3e4ONvU =====================

Full Job Description

We are looking for an AI/ML software intern to participate in building industry-leading AI computing accelerating engines and platforms, developing the most cutting–edge artificial intelligence and applied machine learning systems and infrastructures which combine inference and training software and hardware to apply in the AI data centers and clusters.
We focus on managing and optimizing artificial intelligence and machine learning algorithms and workloads (for Cloud Computing, Search, Ads, News Feed, Autonomous Driving, Photos, Computer Vision, Speech, NLP, etc), improving computing efficiency and utilization, optimizing performance, and identifying next generation AI computing-systems and platform design.
Responsibilities:

  • Participate in large-scale heterogeneous computing cluster/platform design and heterogeneous resources scheduling development
  • Participate in GPU virtualization solutions development for GPU utilization optimization
  • Participate in software and hardware co-design to optimize ML algorithm performance on heterogenous hardware accelerators
  • Research on compiler systems, communication libraries, and accelerations for AI/ML algorithms and workloads

Qualifications:

  • Currently pursuing a MS or PhD Degree in Computer Science/Electrical Engineering or related Machine Learning field
  • Good understanding of Computer System and Architecture, Operating System, Parallel Computing, and Distributed Computing
  • Familiar with at least one of the AI/ML algorithms and major frameworks (Tensorflow, Caffe, MXNet, PaddlePaddle, etc.)
  • Familiarity with performance profiling tools, system, framework, hardware, and kernel layers
  • Experience with DL workload programming & optimization on various hardware accelerators
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with different AI hardware GPU/ASIC/FPGA/ ARM-GPU architectures
  • Experience with GPU virtualization, heterogeneous cluster scheduling, heterogeneous computing acceleration
  • Experience with LLVM/TVM, CUDA/OpenCL

Culture Fit:

  • Mission alignment: If you want to be part of a team to accomplish this great mission, we will provide you the best possible platform to do that.
  • Self-directed: We work best with people that are driven, motivated, and aspire to greatness. Are you the sort of person that, if you had time on your hands, will independently find interesting and useful things to do?
  • Hungry to learn: We are eager to see you learn new skills and grow. But learning is hard work and this is something we hope you want to do.
  • Team orientation: We work in small, fast-moving teams. We don't believe in lone wolves. We watch out for each other and go after big goals together as a team

Full Job Description
Summary of Internship

The Project Management job family forms part of the Project Management track within the IT function. Members of this family lead work teams, consisting of colleagues from a wide variety of functions inside and outside of IT, and assume responsibility for project initiatives. As project management professionals, incumbents contribute to the achievement of business objectives by ensuring that customer solutions are delivered on time, on budget, to the agreed upon specification, and to the customer’s overall satisfaction. The position starts in June, paid working 40 hours per week through August. Opportunity exists for this position to continue through the academic year on a part-time basis to allow for class schedules.

Essential Functions

All Project Manager coordinates activity for projects. Incumbents act as a liaison to the end customer and various stakeholders to communicate project activities. As the main customer contact, they support day to day delivery and direction on projects, setting and controlling customer expectations and maintaining the overall customer relationship. Under the direction of a more senior project manager, incumbents co-manage the functional and technical track leads of the project and project priorities.
They communicate regularly with internal and external customers, as appropriate, to ensure the delivery of high-quality service and support.
Project Manager has emerging project management skills. They provide day to day support on one or more small projects. Incumbents develop and maintain fully integrated project plans which specify project goals, deliverables, staffing, scheduling, risk assessment, contingency planning, resource allocation and cost analysis. They are responsible for monitoring and reporting to management on the status of project efforts and possibly accountable for controlling project plans and costs.
They primarily coordinate project-related tasks with internal and external customers and ensure proper implementation and completion of projects.

Skills and Abilities

Basic project management skills
Ability to work independently and as a member of a cross-functional team
Willingness to learn, be mentored, and improve
Ability to lead and effectively participate in teams.
Good verbal and written communication skills, with an ability to express technical concepts in audience appropriate terms
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks
Good organizational skills, very detail oriented
Analytical skills for identifying and solving problems

Qualifications

A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Technical or Project Management related discipline, or equivalent work experience
Previous Internship Experience

To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States, and should not require, now or in the future, sponsorship for employment visa status.

position: Intern to support the Environment and Make a Difference!
description:
Full Job Description

Nonprofit Internships and Volunteer Opportunities

Cause: Environment

Manhattan OR Remote / Virtual / Work from Home

Many students, recent graduates, and professionals have lost (or been unable to find) internships or jobs due to COVID-19. We feel so bad for all those who have been impacted in that way.

While we cannot pay, our nonprofit does offer an outstanding opportunity to use your skills, gain experience, enhance your resume, and make a tremendous positive social impact on the causes or communities you care about, including Environment.

Greatest Impact

This may be the single best opportunity for you to make the greatest possible positive impact in the world.

Who Is It For?

We have many roles to fill here, so we need high-achieving interns and volunteers with a range of experience. We therefore welcome:

· Professionals who want to volunteer part-time

· "Dependent Spouses" of H1-B, F1, and L1 visa holders

· Recent graduates, including international students on OPT

· Undergraduate and graduate school students, including international students on CPT, who want to intern or to join us as a school ambassador

· Outstanding high school students, who want to intern or to join us as a school ambassador

Credit for Students

Internships with ChangingThePresent are eligible for credit from many schools, and we are happy to do our part to meet the school's requirements.

When

We are always hiring: school year or summer; full-time or part-time.

About Us

ChangingThePresent.org is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit. The New York Times called us an “Amazon.com of the nonprofit world.”

We make the experience of a donation, which you can give in a friend’s name, feel like a rewarding present and an appealing alternative to buying and giving yet more unwanted "stuff." In this way, we are starting to channel to nonprofits some of the $450 billion Americans spend each year buying birthday, wedding, holiday, and corporate presents. Imagine how much good we could all do together as more of that money goes to making a difference.

· Our visitors can contribute to provide school children with their first book, preserve an acre of the wilderness, fund an hour of cancer research, etc.

· Wish lists and registries let them share their dreams for a better world.

· Personalized greeting cards make a charitable gift especially memorable. Gift cards let friends support the things they care about.

We already work with hundreds of the most prestigious nonprofits in the country, and we are now opening the site to all nonprofits so they can all attract additional funding for their important missions.

Unprecedented Opportunities for Responsibility and Leadership

Our interns and volunteers get more responsibility than they would anywhere else. You can take a leadership role.

Focus on Environment Nonprofits

We seek high-achieving interns and volunteers who want to take a leadership role and make a difference for the cause of Environment.

You can also choose to focus on your favorite causes (including education, hunger, women, children, cancer, human rights, environment, women, veterans, etc.) or the charitable needs of any ethnic group, religious group, city, or country. Please see the growing list of causes, countries, cities, ethnic groups, and religious groups on which we focus at https://changingthepresent.org/collections/gifts

For the Environment and Every Cause, Interns and Volunteers Will do the Following:

· Identify, research, prioritize, and invite potential Advisors and Experts.

· Identify, research, prioritize, and invite nonprofits, who can register and list their charitable gifts at no cost. The opportunity for them is discussed in the slideshow on this page: https://changingthepresent.org/pages/for-nonprofits

· Identify, research, prioritize, and pitch magazines, websites, blogs, professional organizations, social media channels, online communities, and other ways to reach people who care about each specific cause.

· Identify, research, and pitch strategic partners for the cause.

· Identify, research, prioritize, and pitch sources of growth funding (philanthropists, corporations, or foundations)

· Conceive of and create cause marketing sponsorship proposals.

· Identify and invite the promotional support of celebrities who support the cause/community.

Focus on Ethnic, Religious, City, or Country Communities

We also have opportunities to focus on the charitable needs of any ethnic, religious, city, or country communities.

Opportunities for Most Areas of Academic / Professional Focus

We also have positions that align with a wide range of academic and professional fields, including business development, analytics, finance, accounting, technology, web development, Salesforce, database, computer science, science, STEM education, marketing, digital marketing, communications, social media, publishing, Human Resources, organizational psychology, research, education, and graphics.

Specific Markets

Some interns focus on specific markets, such as the high school market, college market, wedding market, or corporate gift market.

You Benefit

We want all our interns to get the following from their experience here:

· Make a tremendous positive impact in the world.

· Use your skills, experience, knowledge, creativity and talent.

· Assume responsibility and take a leadership role.

· Learn a tremendous amount.

· Work with people from around the world in a diverse and supportive community, and have a great time.

· Enhance your resume with a record of professional achievement and community service.

· Receive a great letter of recommendation.

When

We welcome full-time and part-time interns during the school year and/or the summer. We are entrepreneurial and flexible, and we are always hiring.

Where

Our office is conveniently located at 7th Avenue and 33 Streets in Manhattan. We also have interns who work remotely (as are all of us during the pandemic).

Please Share

We hope you will also share this opportunity with anyone who might be interested.

* *Learn More and Apply Now

Read more about our internships at:

https://ChangingThePresent.org/pages/interns-and-volunteers.

Then, please send a resume and short cover letter about your specific interests and your available dates/days/hours to: join [AT] ChangingThePresent [DOT] org.

Thank you very much!

Full Job Description
2021 Summer Intern – UX Design

Program Overview:
Our Summer Intern program offers hardworking college students an opportunity to go beyond the classroom to develop leadership skills and gain relevant hands on experience working as part of a global support team with professionals across the enterprise. Additionally, interns will participate in scheduled activities throughout the summer, including sessions with Senior Leaders, site tours, volunteer opportunities, and other social events. Fiserv interns are in session from June 2, 2021 – August 13, 2021 and work approximately 40 hours per week.

Job Description:
Fiserv is currently looking for innovative and motivated Technology and Product Interns to participate in the 10 week 2020 Summer Internship Program. Technology areas such as Application Development, Global & Cyber Security, Mobile Solutions, Network Engineering and Quality Assurance are offering internships; each will provide training curriculum, mentoring, and on the job experiential learning.

As a User Experience Designer Intern with Fiserv, you will work directly and collaboratively with the Account Processing Development and User Experience Research teams to design software that is both usable and appealing.

Qualifications:
Progress towards completion of bachelor's degree by December 2021 / May 2023 with demonstrated academic achievement
Minimum GPA of 3.0 (3.5 or above preferred)
Understanding of UX Design processes focused on outcomes
Ability to collaborate and communicate closely with teams and other partners in a distributed model.
Strong intuition and a natural ability to empathize with different people.
Outstanding communication skills with the ability to persuade others of your good ideas.

Majors:
A wide range of college majors are considered based on specific needs of department such as: Computer Science/Network Engineering, Graphic Design, UX Design, Psychology, but willing to train the right candidate.

Learn more about Fiserv:
To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that provides flexibility and affordability with a variety of medical, dental, vision, life insurance and disability options.

We are #FISVProud of our benefits and well-being programs. Our commitment to wellness, wellness education, preventive services and fitness activities are designed to meet you where you are.

Life moves fast. And as it does, we know most people aren’t thinking about “financial services”. But we are.

We help people and businesses move money and information every minute of every day. Our solutions connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another, millions of times a day, behind the scenes, reliably and securely.

We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments enabling innovative financial services experiences that are in step with the way people live and work today. The company’s approximately 44,000 associates proudly serve clients in more than 100 countries, so their customers, members and consumers can move money when and where they need it, at the point of thought.

Our Aspiration is to move money and information in a way that moves the world. As a FORTUNE™ 500 company and one of FORTUNE Magazine World’s Most Admired Companies for the seventh consecutive year, we are committed to excellence and purposeful innovation.

We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran

Explore the possibilities of a career with Fiserv and Find Your Forward with us.

Full Job Description
Point of Sale Engineering Summer Internship

Program Overview:
Our Summer Intern program offers hardworking college students an opportunity to go beyond the classroom to develop leadership skills and gain relevant hands on experience working as part of a global support team with professionals across the enterprise. Additionally, interns will participate in scheduled activities throughout the summer, including sessions with Senior Leaders, site tours, volunteer opportunities, and other social events. Fiserv interns are in session from June 2, 2021 – August 13, 2021 and work approximately 40 hours per week.

About Clover

Join the Fintech and SaaS revolution that is helping small businesses grow faster. At Clover, you will be part of an entrepreneurial team working in a fast-paced and high growth environment, with the benefits of a parent company, Fiserv that is the largest payments processor and merchant acquirer worldwide.

Clover delivers the leading Point of Sale system with an elegant end-to-end solution that incorporates beautiful devices, cloud-based POS software, payments processing, platform API’s for third-party developers, and an ecosystem with over 500 apps. The Clover platform delivers solutions in a scalable and modular fashion that powers tiny merchants through large football stadiums, supporting millions of transactions daily.

Clover’s Point of Sale Engineering Team

The Point of Sale team develops applications that are used by Clover merchants on a day to day basis. Our solutions assist business owners in the managing of orders, inventory and employees. We have solutions that are tailored for both fine dining and fast food restaurants. Clover solutions also support merchant retail and services.

What does a Clover Summer Intern do?

As an intern on the Clover Point of Sale Engineering Team, you will work on important projects of great importance to the firm. With this project, you will build a solution from the ground up that addresses a real need for Clover Engineers. It will not only help make our products perform better in the field, but also help productivity of our engineers. You will be working with experienced engineers and gain valuable insights into the software development process in a real-world environment.

What does a Clover Innovation Pod Intern do?

As an intern on the Clover Point of Sale Engineering Team, you will work in a small pod of 2-3 engineers and 1 product manager to own an initiative. With this project, you will build a solution from the ground up that addresses a real need for the Clover Team. It will not only help make our products perform better in the field, but also help productivity of our engineers. You will be working with experienced engineers and gain valuable insights into the software development process in a real-world environment.

Requirements of the Internship

Progress toward completion of bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Management Information Systems or related field by December 2021 / May 2023 with demonstrated academic achievement.
Strong programming skills, in Java, SQL, JavaScript, and Python
Experience / interest in Server and Web app development
Some Android development experience is a big plus.
Minimum GPA of 3.0 (3.5 or above preferred)
Strategic and creative thinking; distinguished written and oral communications skills
Collaborative, team player who can thrive in a fast-paced environment with quickly changing, ambiguous requirements
Strong self-starter with an intellectual curiosity
