Full Job Description
Job Summary

Safeguard Medical is seeking a college intern to support the IT Digital Innovation team. Duties will include researching and developing sample programs demonstrating digital possibilities that enhance Safeguard’s value to its customers.

Explore ideas to provide business value through the effective use of technology. Lead the development of proto-type solutions to demonstrate leading, innovative capabilities, including machine learning, object recognition, and research techniques to leverage the growing open-source library of digital capabilities.

Essential Job Functions

Collaborates with the CIO to set the mission, vision, and strategy of the IT organization to maximize the success of business & enterprise IT projects, and ongoing M&A integrations – by leading with cloud-first, scalable, and partner-driven execution

Brainstorm and ideate with IT and members of the business to uncover opportunities for business value

Research technology and leading innovations of products and services in the first responder market

Build proto-type solutions (proof-of-concepts), and develop and library of portfolio projects in GITHUB

Learn to leverage Google’s TensorFlow library and leverage existing code repositories to quickly assemble “sketch” solutions

Have the ability to self-start and learn quickly, not fearing the unknown, but advancing confidently in your ability to research, assemble, and learn

Qualifications

Computer Science, Information Technology, or Management Information Systems major
Minimum GPA of 3.0
Familiar with Pyton, JavaScript, Microsoft Office, and aspects of Artificial Intelligence. (PyTorch and web scraping a plus)
Strong verbal and written communication
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to work well in teams
Strong work ethic and attention to detail

Competencies

Excellent research, analytical, and conceptual thinking, combined with the ability to assemble working demonstrations
Strong sense of self, ethics and effort, as well as the willingness to go the extra mile to achieve important goals
Plan to leave with a greater understanding of APIs, GITHUB, Medical Imaging Classification, Lean StartUp and more

Physical Requirements

Performing the duties of this job regularly involves sitting, standing, walking, hearing/listening, repetitive hand movement, grasping, reaching, lifting, carrying, bending/stooping, kneeling/crawling and vision requirements - close vision, adjust focus, color code.

Mental Requirements

This position requires the ability to maintain an appropriate work pace, comprehend and follow instructions, exercise logic and reasoning, organize and prioritize, read, compose written communication, communicate verbally, problem solve, make decisions, count and compute, analyze and interpret data, multi-task/re-direct, and experience numerous interruptions. This position requires the ability to maintain the highest standards of professional maturity and emotional intelligence even in difficult or stressful situation.

Other Requirements

25%-50% travel anticipated, willingness to travel as needed.

Work Environment

The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet to moderate.

This job description is not designed to cover an exhaustive list of duties. Other duties may be assigned, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Company Description

Pilot Company is the 10th largest privately held company in North America with more than 28,000 team members. As the industry-leading network of travel centers, we have more than 950 retail and fueling locations in 44 states and six Canadian provinces. Our energy and logistics division is a top supplier of fuel, employing one of the largest tanker fleets and providing critical services to oil operations in our nation's busiest basins. Pilot Company supports a growing portfolio of brands with expertise in supply chain and retail operations, logistics and transportation, technology and digital innovation, construction, maintenance, human resources, finance, sales and marketing.

Founded in 1958, we are proud to be family owned and consider our team members to be part of the family. Our founding values, people-first culture and commitment to giving back remains true to us today. Whether we are serving guests, a fellow team member, or a trucking company, we are dedicated fueling people and keeping North America moving.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

Full Job Description
Team Description:
Kitware's Medical Computing team solves complex healthcare challenges through customized software solutions. The team provides research, development, and technology integration services to research centers, universities and companies in the medical and biomedical sectors. By joining our team you will participate in a dynamic multidisciplinary work environment with exceptionally talented computer scientists, software engineers, mechanical engineers and biomedical engineers.

About the projects:
We build powerful software solutions using our open source platforms including VTK, ITK, 3D Slicer, Pulse, iMSTK, CMake and ParaView. Our commercial projects involve generating solutions for medical device companies from ultrasound and preclinical imaging companies, to surgical device companies. Our research projects involve collaborations with top research institutions, including Johns Hopkins University, Harvard Medical School, MIT, the University of Utah, Cleveland Clinic, Duke University and others.

In This Position You Will:
Join Kitware’s researchers and developers who are collaborating with outstanding clinicians and biomedical engineers from around the world to (1) solve complex medical image analysis and visualization challenges and (2) deliver those solutions as web-based applications. Your pursuits will include the following:
Assist the team in enhancing and applying VTK.js, a cutting edge, open source, JavaScript library for 3D scientific data visualization
Contribute medical image analysis algorithms written in C++ and/or Python to our ITK and VTK platforms
Learn about new medical image visualization and analysis methods, clinical applications, and medical imaging research directions
Participate in high-quality software engineering practices that are essential to successful community-supported open source projects

Required Qualifications:
Strong Python and JavaScript programming skills and a passion for full-time Python and JavaScript development.
B.S., M.S., or Ph.D. students in computer science, computer engineering, math, physics, statistics or a related field
Demonstrated software development expertise, e.g., active GitHub account, successful school or co-op projects, programming competitions, or documented open-source contributions
Enthusiasm for programming, learning, problem solving, and tracking technology trends
Exceptional collaboration and communication skills
Understanding of algorithms, computer systems, programming language constructs, and design patterns

Preferred Qualifications:Preferred Qualifications:
Web visualization technologies such as D3, WebGL, and HTML5 Canvas
Web software development experience, including REST services, web application security, client side HTML, CSS, and modern JavaScript (ES6, Webpack, Vue.js or other reactive frameworks). Experience with web server environments such as Node.js, Django, or Flask is highly desirable
Practical knowledge of C++ beyond coursework, as indicated by github activities or prior work
Knowledge of medical image acquisition, data formats, and processing methods
Practical knowledge of linear algebra and experimental statistics (ROC curves, pattern classification)
Familiarity with high-quality software processes, such as unit and integration testing, revision control (git), documentation, software review, and continuous integration tools (Jenkins, Travis, CircleCI)
Data science tools, including NumPy, Pandas, Jupyter/IPython, R, machine learning tools, data cleaning tools
Good eye for aesthetic and intuitive user interfaces
Company Description
Kitware collaborates with customers to solve the world’s most complex scientific challenges through customized software solutions. Kitware delivers innovation by focusing on advanced technical computing, state-of-the-art artificial intelligence, and full-spectrum software solutions. Since its founding in 1998, Kitware has developed a reputation for deep customer understanding and technical expertise, honest interactions, and open innovation. We are proud to be a 100% employee-owned company. For additional information, please visit kitware.com. You can also follow us on Twitter, LinkedIn, and Facebook.

Kitware is proud to be a 100% employee-owned company. Our team members enjoy a small company environment, flexibility in work assignments, and high levels of independence and responsibility. Full Job Description
Overview:
Pharmapace, Inc. is a consulting and contract Clinical Research Organization (“CRO”) founded by several veteran leaders in the biotech/pharmaceutical industry who are recognized as experts in their respective fields. The core mission of Pharmapace is to deliver exceptional value to the life sciences industry (biotech/pharmaceutical companies) by providing high-quality consulting and outsourcing services to support our customer’s clinical trials, regulatory submissions, medical affairs, safety surveillance, and outcomes research programs to help patients afflicted with a wide range of disease conditions. We have a particular emphasis in Biometrics services. Since our founding in 2013, Pharmapace has successfully assisted numerous life sciences companies in their drug development programs. Many of our Sponsors’ drugs that we have worked on, have received approval by the US Food and Drug Administration. We take great pride in what we do to help our valued customers to advance human health.

In early 2019, Pharmapace was acquired by WuXi AppTec, a leading global contract development and manufacturing organization that serves over 4,000 biopharmaceutical and medical device companies worldwide. Pharmapace remains committed to delivering exceptional services and value to our customers. Pharmapace is an integral part of WuXi Clinical Development Inc. (CRO), a division of WuXi Apptec, which has offices in Austin, Texas, Taiwan, and China. This combination allows us to leverage on WuXi Clinical’s vast resources and offer our customers a truly global solution to all aspects of clinical/drug development and regulatory submission.

Responsibilities:
Job Title: Intern Analyst (3 months internship with potential for conversion to full time employment)

Job Location: Pharmapace, San Diego, CA

Position Summary:
Contributes to the completion of routine technical tasks by performing dataset programming, graphic data presentation, and statistical analyses as part of the Clinical and Statistical Programming (CSP) team to support client drug development projects..

Essential Job Functions:
Assist CSP members with transforming specifications in statistical analyses plan into fully documented, validated programs supporting both safety and efficacy displays and analysis datasets required for clinical study reports
Assist in testing, maintaining, and documenting programs for use in creating study datasets in standard data tabulation model format, analysis datasets, statistical tables, figures, and listings
Assist Clinical Data Management with creating well-documented validated standard and non-standard edit check and monitoring programs to support the clinical trial team to ensure the integrity, accuracy and completeness of the data in preparation for clinical reporting
Adhere to statistical analysis plans and standard operating procedures while completing routine programming activities
Meet milestones as assigned with high quality
Perform other duties as directed by management or senior programming personnel

Qualifications:
Education:
Bachelor’s or above degree in Statistics/Biostatistics, Computer Science, or Mathematics

Experience Requirements:
Minimum 1 year of experience with SAS or R for Bachelor’s degree

Skills:
Basic knowledge of R or Base SAS, including SAS macro language, is preferred. Programming experience in a research environment is a plus
Credits in Statistics courses are desired
Understands the sequence of running programs to ensure up-to-date data and to troubleshoot, debug programming problems and to identify data trends
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint)
Effective verbal and writing skills

Physical Requirements:
Must be able to work in an office environment, which has minimal noise conditions
Ability to stand or sit for most of the work day
Must be able to perform some activities with repetitive motion, such as keyboarding

This job description does not state or imply that the above are the only duties and responsibilities assigned to this position. Employees holding this position will be required to perform any other job-related duties as requested by Management.

Highly motivated
Ability to interact with a variety of staff in a fast paced environment
Valid motor vehicle operator’s license

Experience with Linux
Experience with Windows
Basic computer networking
Customer service experience related to technical products

The Associate will conduct sourcing, due diligence, and analysis of potential JetBlue Technology Venture investments and support the leadership team in developing investment recommendations. The Associate will help support the ongoing influx of potential investment opportunities, will represent JetBlue Technology Ventures at various events in the travel industry, venture and startup ecosystems, and will build a strong network to source potential investments and support portfolio companies. The Associate must be able to work in a fast-paced, team environment, and model the JetBlue Technology Ventures values of Safety, Caring, Integrity, Passion, and Fun

Essential Responsibilities:

  • Conduct investment research, financial analysis, and modeling of potential investments
  • Develop in-depth assessment of business plans and investment proposals to determine business model viability, industry attractiveness, and strategic fit

  • Develop investment recommendations and supporting documents
  • Develop an independent, value-added perspective on investment discussions
  • Build strong relationships within the venture and startup ecosystems to source potential investments
  • Build strong relationships with relevant JetBlue departments

  • Support investment committee meetings

  • Proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
  • Strong financial modeling skills including the ability to analyze and model company financials
  • Experience in Investment banking or Venture Capital strongly preferred
  • Available for occasional overnight travel (up to 20%)
  • Must be able to multi-task and prioritize in a fast-pace multi-team environment
  • Ability to work to deadlines with quick turnaround
  • Possess and maintain a valid Driver’s License and a driving record from the state of your primary residence that meets JetBlue Airways insurance standards
  • Able to pass a ten (10) year background check and pre-employment drug test
  • Legally eligible to work in the country in which the position is located

Full Job Description
A Career at HARMAN

As a technology leader that is rapidly on the move, HARMAN is filled with people who are focused on making life better. Innovation, inclusivity and teamwork are a part of our DNA. When you add that to the challenges we take on and solve together, you’ll discover that at HARMAN you can grow, make a difference and be proud of the work you do every day.

Additional Work Location(s) : None

About the Role

Our 2021 program is slated to be a virtual experience, with a possibility of in-person based on local regulations at the time. HARMAN’s diverse portfolio of businesses and customers offers interns a great opportunity to gain exposure to a wide range of projects. As a member of our team, your primary role will be to assist members of the Legal Department with tasks relating to all legal aspects of corporate law, including but not limited to Intellectual Property, Contracts, Litigation, general Corporate law, and various support tasks.

Your Team

At HARMAN, we are inventors of useful, playful, beautiful things. Our vision is to make the life more connected, entertaining, personalized, and productive. Our iconic brands and technologies are transforming the car, the workplace and everywhere in-between. We work hard and accomplish amazing things as a team. This is your opportunity to join our talented professionals as a Summer Law Clerk with the HARMAN Legal Department to work on cutting-edge technologies and cool projects. At HARMAN, you can expect brilliance. We do.

What You Will Do

Assist internal and external counsel with diligence, research, and negotiation of corporate transactions, automotive supply chain issues, transactional matters, personnel/human resource matters, real estate issues, and contracts, including reviewing a variety of issues and drafting responses and proposals, coordinating commercial issues, drafting and reviewing contracts, risk review, and promptly responding to requests for legal review from all departments.
Work on all aspects of the litigation process from case inception through case closure, including investigating factual issues pertaining to claims, working closely with business units across the organization to properly defend and/or prosecute matters, assisting with case management and research, supporting internal investigations and studies, preparation of memos summarizing investigations, and other tasks to be determined.
Support Intellectual Property matters, including preliminary invention review, inventor interviews, communicating with and collecting information from various technology and business leads, communicating with outside counsel to provide feedback, cataloging information relative to German and Austrian inventor compensation laws, and providing various reports.
Update various legal databases (Anaqua, Serengeti, Novatus, etc.) relative to specific on-going tasks, including but not limited to: invention information, law firm e-billing system, contract management database record creation, and others as needed.
Provide support for special projects as needed.

Basic Qualifications:
Must be a JD Candidate currently enrolled in a law degree program with excellent academic credentials, with at least one semester completed, at an ABA-accredited institution taking at least one class in the semester prior to the internship program, and returning to school for at least one semester upon completion of the internship program.
Must be working toward a degree in law, with current course work in the area of law.
Must be commercially minded and able to view legal issues in light of business priorities.
Must have excellent oral and written communication skills, including exceptional negotiating skills, and be able to confidently interact and present information to senior leaders.
Ability to manage tight deadlines and multiple complex projects simultaneously, and work under pressure with keen attention to detail and excellent organizational skills.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and to act decisively; and able to provide quick, concise, and practice advice consistent with Harman business objectives.
Able to advise and where necessary problem-solve as pro-actively and commercially aggressive as possible
Possess the ability to interact effectively with other attorneys and employees, senior executives, opposing counsel and outside client personnel.
Superior ability to analyze complex business and legal issues, exceptional judgment, outstanding interpersonal skills, a teamwork-oriented attitude, strong initiative, and proven ability to effectively juggle competing priorities.
Demonstrated ability to evaluate risk and to exercise sound legal judgment.
Must be team-oriented and have the ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment with a solution-oriented approach to legal issues, strong interpersonal and relationship building skills, and a sense of humor and positive can-do attitude.

What You Need

Strongly prefer candidates who live within a commutable distance.
Must provide own housing and transportation to/from work.
Must provide proper work authorization.
Must have a valid drivers’ license and a vehicle, as the candidate may be traveling between two locations.

What is Nice to Have

Previous experience in the engineering or computer sciences field, or the completion of a degree in engineering or computer sciences strongly preferred.

What Makes You Eligible

Be willing to work in an office in Novi / Farmington Hills Harman Locations.
Successfully complete a background investigation and drug screen as a condition of employment
Must provide own housing and transportation to/from work
Must possess unrestricted work authorization
Must provide full work availability from May 24, 2021 through August 13, 2021 and be able to work 40 hours per week
Highly prefer candidates who live within a commutable distance

What We Offer

Access to employee discounts on world-class HARMAN products (JBL, HARMAN Kardon, etc.)
Real-world work assignments and the opportunity to make an impact on our business
Opportunity to collaborate with talented teams across the organization
An inclusive and diverse work environment that fosters and encourages professional and personal development

HARMAN is an Equal Opportunity /Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or Protected Veterans status. HARMAN offers a great work environment, challenging career opportunities, professional training and competitive compensation. (www.harman.com)

Company Description

We are seeking the best and brightest 2021 college graduates for our summer internship program. This is a tremendous opportunity to join a world-class marketing team. Approximately 50% of our internships have converted to full-time hires.

Sosemo is an award-winning digital marketing agency that specializes in search marketing, paid social, and media buying. Our internship program lasts approximately 3 months. Interns typically work 4 hours per day, 4 days per week.

During that time, interns rotate across our Paid Search (SEM), SEO, and Paid Social teams. This allows interns to gain a working knowledge of each marketing channel. Accommodations may be made if interns have a preference for a particular channel.

A portion of your time as an intern will be dedicated to training, while the other portion will be spent gaining hands-on experience assisting with campaign management, reporting, and related duties. You may also be required to assist with ad hoc requests such as data entry for new business.

Our internship program pays minimum wage. Consideration will be made to offer a full-time position at the end of 90 days to those who impress. Full-time employees earn a competitive salary, yearly bonus, and benefits.

Our office is located down the street from the New York Stock Exchange at 60 Broad Street. In addition to working with a stellar team, our office has beautiful common areas, weekly yoga/meditation, spectacular views of the Statue of Liberty, and free coffee and beer. Please note: our office is following all CDC guidelines and only allowing 50% capacity at this time. Employees currently have the option to work remotely, though working from our office is encouraged.

You can learn more about Sosemo @ www.sosemo.com.

Research and keep up on industry trends

Assist with Salesforce data entry for new business

The Financial Management System for California (FI$Cal) is seeking an undergraduate or graduate student intern to support the implementation of the FI$Cal system, a billion-dollar statewide project.

The student would work within the Project Management Division and report to the Governance and Reporting Manager. The student will work with a variety of teams and staff in the Project Management Office, including the Governance, Schedule and Quality and Testing units. The student will support and be responsible for work activities and products within these given areas.

This is a part-time, temporary, non-benefited, student position. Full Job Description
Internship: June 2021 - August 2021

Hours: 24-40 hour per week

Location: Remote

Position Reports To: VP of Engineering

Compensation: $23- $33 per hour, commensurate with experience

Who is Saga

Saga Education is a national nonprofit that has served over 17,600 students with high-dose math tutoring during their regular school day. Fueling this work is a bold vision to combat educational inequity by working with school districts to unlock the power of personal relationships to nurture academic, social and emotional growth for young people. Our students and schools represent historically marginalized communities. Our mission is to provide them rigorous, high impact tutorials that ensure they have the confidence and academic strength to achieve success in high school and beyond.

For more information, please visit us at www.sagaeducation.org.

The Work and Why it Matters
Our software engineering team supports this bold vision by building best-in-class products. Today this includes, Saga Connect, Saga Coach, and Woot Math. Saga Connect is an online learning platform for live tutor-student interactions. It enables our tutors (Saga Fellows and AmeriCorps members) to deliver high quality online math instruction. It was ranked as the best online platform for live instruction by the College Board, and today, we are proud to support the use of it by other organizations.

Saga is the best at training non-educators to be high quality and high impact. Our most recent effort is Saga Coach, an innovative platform that strives to capture this training in a self-serve course that is as engaging as it is effective.

Last, we continue to deepen our direct support of math teachers through Woot Math, a research-based, award-winning adaptive learning and formative assessment platform for the K-12 math classroom (acquired by Saga Education in 2020).

Our team is passionate about building high-value products that enable transformative learning and support the teachers and tutors that are the frontline of that work. To do this, we continuously gather data, listen to our users, and focus on providing tools and platforms that are as effective as they are delightful.

We value the ability to learn quickly and to adapt to the ever changing tech landscape. Our current code base includes Javascript, HTML5, Haxe, GraphQL, Ruby, and Python. That said, we value code quality, design and ingenuity – and the ability to learn new tech – over any particular language expertise. We invest in our interns, teach them what they need to know, and provide continuous support throughout the internship experience. In the words of a recent intern,

"My experience as a Saga intern was full of exploration and engaging problem solving. I was always working on something new, exciting, and enriching, with a team of helpful and caring engineers." - Yasaman M, IIT '23

No matter the language or technology, our goal remains the same: to deliver best-in-class, innovative products that reimagine how software can help teachers and tutors reach more students.

Position Overview

Saga Education is at the forefront of education reform and innovation, and we are investing heavily into technology and products to accelerate this vision. We're looking for a Software Engineering Intern to be an active member of the software team to help drive innovation in a rapidly changing environment.

Saga Education acquired Woot Math for its advanced technology platform, and is continuing to build out capacity and capabilities in the mobile web space. The Woot Math leadership team previously held executive positions at Disney Online, and the team has a rich history of developing award-winning, best-in-class software products.

Responsibilities

Work with a team of software engineers to develop products used by our tutors and students
Develop front-end and back-end technologies to further Saga's mission

Competencies

Mission Alignment - You acknowledge social injustice in education and have a desire to grow
Nimble Learning - You use both successes and failures to actively learn new lessons
Demonstrates Self-Awareness - You use feedback and reflection to gain productive insight
Collaborates - You work collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives
Action Oriented - You take on new opportunities and have a solutions-oriented approach

Experience & Qualifications
You may meet or have interest in any one of the following qualifications:

Proficient in writing front-end or back-end software
Pursuing BS/MS/PhD program in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, or related fields
Experience with software debugging and critical thinking skills
Experience with analytical and problem-solving skills
Passionate about developing software products that make an impact in education

Benefits

This position is not eligible for standard benefits but will have access to 7 PTO days.

Saga Education provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants.
People from all diverse backgrounds are strongly encouraged to apply.
Thank you for applying to Saga Education.

Full Job Description
This Intern position will work within the Plant Process Control group and will afford the opportunity to apply educational experiences to real world industrial applications. Experiences are offered that encompass both existing system maintenance / enhancements, as well as ground up design, development and installation of new systems and processes, focused on productivity and quality improvements. Strong mentoring by seasoned Control Engineers ensures a mutually beneficial work experience.

Under supervised direction, the primary responsibilities include developing, testing, debugging, documenting, and maintaining software applications for use in the production environment. These applications are based on the client/server technology. A typical process application today, supports one or more user interfaces, connects to one or more database servers, and communicates with one or more process data servers. The role includes the design and development of database systems, user interfaces, process algorithms, reusable software modules, communications servers, and application specific code. The operating systems and tools utilized in this effort include OpenVMS, Windows, PLC’s, DCS’s, RDB, MS SQL, Oracle, Wonderware, OSISoft PI, Intellutions iFix, C language, .NET languages, FORTRAN, and PLC block and ladder logic. The successful candidate will be expected to take part in a cross functional team of management information systems, process control, and operations personnel in the development of a computer integrated manufacturing environment.

Requirements:

  • Candidates must be a current student and have completed their sophomore year by June 2021 and be in good academic standing.
  • Minimum 3.0 GPA
  • Be authorized to work in the US without sponsorship

position: Intern: Credential Leakage Management (Cybersecurity, Software Development)
description:
Full Job Description
Siemens is looking for a summer intern to support the development of a software platform for professional credential leakage management. In this position, you will advance an already existing mockup towards a production-ready state, enabling the software to process huge datasets while still offering an appealing user interface. Furthermore, you will evaluate their extensibility and the degree of automation that can be achieved when these components are integrated in a tool chain for continuous integration and deployment. This project is part of a larger cybersecurity research project.

During this internship, you will experience the excitement and challenges of industrial research and be part of a world class team. An internship with Siemens Technology is a great opportunity for students to gain real world experience in a diverse work environment. Specifically, this internship provides an opportunity to learn about strategies to handle and manage credential leaks in large and complex organizations. You will also learn how to integrate such strategies into regulatory frameworks (e.g., privacy laws and regulations) and an enterprise IT environment. You will get exposed to state-of-the-art software development and deployment frameworks in order to develop a robust and scalable program suitable for a powerful and scalable cloud hosting solution.

While we prefer the internship to be on site in our lab in Princeton, NJ, the uncertain future course of the pandemic makes it likely that this internship will need to happen entirely remotely. Hence, we offer this as a remote internship and thus encourage applicants from across the country.

The Challenge

Software development of features and functionality of an existing PoC mock-up. This includes:

Understanding the requirements for handling and efficiently searching in large datasets
Setting up a CI/CD pipeline in a corporate environment
Securely setting up and operating systems hosted remotely
Developing an appealing User Interface and ensuring good User Experience
Developing the workflow for user alerts and adequately anonymizing datasets

The Candidate

A current student pursuing a BSc or MSc degree in Computer Science / Computer Engineering, or other related subject with a focus on Software Development. Experience in IT-Security and/or Cloud Environments is certainly a plus. Please note, you must still be enrolled as a student during the internship period to qualify for the position.
Software development experience with JavaScript frameworks and libraries, especially vue.js, a must
Experience with clean software development and knowledge of best practices
Experience with software development tools (IDEs, VCSs)
Experience with cloud-based systems, e.g., AWS, MS Azure
Experience with Linux and command lines
Experience in system administration and experience in handling large datasets are a plus
Ability to give presentations about complex technical topics
Excellent knowledge of English (spoken and written)

A successful candidate must be able to work with controlled technology in accordance with US Export Control Law. US Export Control laws and applicable regulations govern the distribution of strategically important technology, services and information to foreign nationals and foreign countries. Siemens may require candidates under consideration for employment opportunities to submit information regarding citizenship status to allow the organization to comply with specific US Export Control laws and regulations. Additional information on the US Export Control laws & regulations can be found on https://www.bis.doc.gov/index.php/policy-guidance/deemed-exports/deemed-exports-faqs

About Us

Our team is part of Siemens Technology, Siemens’ central Research & Development unit, and is composed of makers, innovators, engineers, and researchers that unite a passion about cybersecurity and securing our customers’ assets and networks - in domains such as control systems used in energy utilities that are part of the nation’s critical infrastructure, smart factories, building automation systems, intelligent transportation systems, healthcare, and innovative new products and solutions developed by Siemens. Our close contact to all our business units in Siemens provides the opportunity to contribute to and gain experience in real industrial applications.

Our research team is located in beautiful Princeton, NJ, a university town packed with exceptional international talent that provides a unique feel of this true cultural gem in the state. The town has plenty of activities to offer, but for those looking for more, at just about 1h drive we have NYC or Philadelphia. We have the best public schools in the country and all of the above glued together by a very active and welcoming community.

As Siemens’ central Research & Development department, we embrace this community. Our core mission is to support our Siemens business units as a central knowledge hub for all cybersecurity capabilities globally. We research and develop new and innovative solutions, based on much-needed deep technical expertise, and our network with internal and external experts and academia. This allows us to invent new solutions and approaches and verify their feasibility in the “real world” together with the product development teams of our business units – creating a stimulating setup for quick innovation cycles and rapid prototyping.

Join Us

We are more than employees; we are actively helping to make people’s lives a little better every day. Would you like to be a part of that? Then join us! Our Princeton facility is recognized for providing a stimulating environment for highly talented and self-motivated students. You will have the opportunity to test your knowledge in a challenging problem-solving environment. You will be encouraged to think out-of-the-box, innovate, and find solutions to real-life problems. Whether you’re helping to develop products for the operating units or working in interdisciplinary projects for the business areas: at Siemens Technology you’ll be working in the heart of Siemens’ technological research together with the best.

Organization: Technology

Company: Siemens Corporation

Experience Level: Student (Not Yet Graduated)

Job Type: Full-Time temporary

Full Job Description
IT Intern - Software Development
Chicago, IL

The American Medical Association (AMA), a nonprofit, is the nation's largest professional Association of physicians. We are a unifying voice and powerful ally for America's physicians, the patients they care for, and the promise of a healthier nation. To be part of the AMA is to be part of our Mission to promote the art and science of medicine and the betterment of public health.

As an employer, we are dedicated to many efforts, including employee learning and development, social responsibility, diversity and inclusion and wellness.

Our well-defined culture has strongly impacted the prosperity of our organization. Our foundational values of Respect, Integrity, Innovation, Impact, Collaboration, Agility, Equity, and Trust are at the core of our efforts and continue to shape the success of the AMA.

We have an opportunity at our corporate offices in Chicago for an IT Intern - Software Development on our Information Technology team. As an intern you will have the opportunity to work with our team of developers to learn about application development and processes. If you want exposure to real world projects and the drive to learn new exciting technology, you want to join our team. Some responsibilities will include research, testing, and development for a large suite of web applications.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Learn about our agile process, git workflows, code reviews, ticket writing and testing. Provide support, research, analysis and recommendations into extending coverage, leveraging tools and improving processes.
Research and present an effective documentation repository for team and code best practices and standards. Convert existing documentation into the new solution.
Work with various members of the team to learn about front end and back end development, business analysis, requirements gathering and application architecture.
Present a Learning Session to the team at the completion of the internship on the topic of your choosing, based on the skills and research acquired during the duration of the internship.
Report project status regularly to assigned project manager. Document concerns, issues and risks and recommended solutions regarding assignments to management.

May include other responsibilities as assigned.

REQUIREMENTS:
Completion of at least two years toward a BS degree in computer science or related field is required.
Understanding how to execute well-formed SQL for data retrieval is needed. Some knowledge and understanding of data and database technology a plus.
Some understanding of the systems development life cycle (SDLC) and some familiarity with both waterfall and iterative methodologies, such as AGILE, is a plus.
Ability to collect and analyze specific business requirements and work with the team to assess the software solution using Excel, SQL, Teams, Data Tools or related technologies.
Ability to work well with people from some different disciplines with varying degrees of technical experience and levels within the organization.
Ability to express concepts effectively verbally and in writing. Ability to learn, document, and successfully retain new skills to serve as temporary backup in various collaboration support areas as required.
Ability to thinking analytically with data.
Strong interpersonal and presentation skills, with experience communicating to stakeholders in both technical and non-technical fields.
Passionate about producing high-quality technology solutions.
Must possess a good sense of humor, and a positive, “can-do” attitude.
Must be flexible regarding work assignments and work independently with limited supervision

Our office is a business casual environment and we respect work-life balance. The American Medical Association is located at 330 N. Wabash Avenue, Chicago, IL 60611 and is convenient to all public transportation in Chicago.

We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to diversity in our workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment. As an EOE/AA employer, the American Medical Association will not discriminate in its employment practices due to an applicant’s race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity and veteran or disability status.

THE AMA IS COMMITTED TO IMPROVING THE HEALTH OF THE NATION

The purpose of an internship at Woodward is to provide students with the opportunity to gain exposure and “real life” business acumen within industry. Paya (Nasdaq: Paya) is a leading provider of integrated payment and frictionless commerce solutions that help customers accept and make payments, expedite receipt of money, and increase operating efficiencies. The company processes over $30 Billion of annual payment volume across credit/debit card, ACH, and check, making it a top 20 provider of payment processing in the US and #6 overall in e-Commerce. Paya serves more than 100,000 customers through over 2,000 key distribution partners focused on targeted, high growth verticals such as healthcare, education, non-profit, government, utilities, and other B2B goods and services. The business has built its foundation on offering robust integrations into front-end CRM and back-end accounting systems to enhance customer experience and workflow. Paya is headquartered in Atlanta, GA, with offices in Reston, VA, Fort Walton Beach, FL, Dayton, OH, Mt. Vernon, OH and Dallas, TX.

Strong time management skills and ability to perform well under pressure.
Strong office app skills (including MS-Office, excel, powerpoint, etc).

3.0+ GPA, preferred

position: Research Intern: Analytics for Cyber Defense
description:
Full Job Description
We are looking for a summer intern to contribute to our research activities by applying modern data analytics and machine learning techniques on a variety of structured and unstructured data in the field of Industrial Control Systems Security. As intern in this project, you will be responsible for developing new algorithms and prototype code as proof of concept for novel ideas in the field of OT (Operational Technology) cyber defense.

This task includes researching supervised and unsupervised methods and models for automatically findings non-linear correlation patterns in the domain of security anomaly and intrusion detection. You will work with high-fidelity simulation and lab-emulated data to perform the research in close collaboration with domain experts in the field of OT security and data scientists. In addition, you will learn about general concepts and methods of intrusion detection in OT systems, understand security telemetry, data sources, correlation rules, and the overall software architecture of a SIEM (Security Information and Event Management) in the ICS (Industrial Control Systems) domain.

You will work in collaboration with a developer to prototype and implement selected models using data stored in a NoSQL database (Elastic stack) as part of a custom interface. This task will be jointly performed in collaboration with other team members including data scientists, security experts, and software developers. The goal of the project is to design innovative methods that improve usability of a SIEM interface to SOC (Security Operations Center) engineers. Successful candidates will have the opportunity to work in close collaboration with an outstanding development team focusing on a unique market approach for threat detection in Industrial Control Systems.

The Challenge

Research, design, and implement data-driven machine learning/data mining algorithms based on high fidelity security data
Dive into massive, noisy, and complex real-world machine and user behavioral data to produce innovative analysis and new types of predictive models of engineering behaviors and manufacturing processes performance
Explore the potential of big data for design, engineering and analysis tasks and support the development of revolutionary approaches in the field of OT security intrusion detection
Present and discuss results (with potential of publication of results)

The Challenge

Qualified candidates will have/be:
A current student pursuing a BSc./MSc. degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Statistics / Mathematics / Computer Science / Computer Engineering, or other related subject with strong focus on machine learning and data mining. Please note, you must still be enrolled as a student during the internship period to qualify for the position.
Experience in the field of Big Data Analytics and machine learning with strong proficiency in data mining
Solid knowledge in statistics and exploratory data analysis
Strong proficiency in R and/or Python (including common analytics libraries, e.g., Pandas, SciKit-Learn, etc.) and good Java skills
Software development proficiency to work independently in Python
Capability for and interest in quick prototyping
Strong collaboration skills and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
Hands-on experience in command-line and development in Linux
Experience with the Elastic Stack (Elastic, Logstash, Kibana) desired
Experience with Jira and Gitlab, or similar platforms
Excellent knowledge of English (spoken and written)

Successful candidate must be able to work with controlled technology in accordance with US Export Control Law. US Export Control laws and applicable regulations govern the distribution of strategically important technology, services and information to foreign nationals and foreign countries. Siemens may require candidates under consideration for employment opportunities to submit information regarding citizenship status to allow the organization to comply with specific US Export Control laws and regulations. Additional information on the US Export Control laws & regulations can be found on https://www.bis.doc.gov/index.php/policy-guidance/deemed-exports/deemed-exports-faqs

Join Us

During this internship, you will experience the excitement and challenges of industrial research and be part of a world class team. An internship with Siemens Technology is a great opportunity for students to gain real world experience in a diverse work environment!

While we prefer the internship to be on site in our lab in Princeton, NJ, the uncertain future course of the pandemic makes it likely that this internship will need to happen entirely remotely. Hence, we offer this as a remote internship and thus encourage applicants from across the country.

Full Job Description
About our group:
Seagate has one simple mission: to help the world save more of its precious data. Multiple studies have shown that machine learning, artificial intelligence, and data analytics are all improved with larger data sets. These methods are what is needed for the world to solve its important challenges from developing vaccines to combating climate change to improving autonomy in driving that saves lives. Unfortunately, however, the IDC projects that 158 of the 175 predicted zettabytes of data produced in 2025 will not be saved. By lowering the cost of storage, Seagate aims to rescue as much of this at-risk 158 zettabytes as possible to provide larger data sets and correspondingly improved learning, autonomy, and analytics. To achieve this goal, Seagate is harnessing the power of open source software to reduce data center costs. Our group is dedicated to this goal.

About the role - you will:
As a Developer Advocate intern, your role will be central to this important corporate strategy as you will help create the public face of Seagate’s open source initiatives. You will interact with a community who shares this vision to deliver the world’s best overall data center storage solutions optimized for both capacity and performance. In this role, you will evangelize Seagate’s vision and open source initiatives via blog posts, hackathons, meet-ups, and code integrations with popular third-party software suites such as pytorch, Map-Reduce, Kubernetes, and Spark for example. You will work to support and learn from our full-time developer advocates and gain valuable experience as well as an understanding of whether this unique type of role is suitable for a full-time career.

No community can be successful without an inclusive culture and you will be responsible for modeling and ensuring inclusive and respectful community behaviors to promote healthy growth and nurturing of the community. Additionally, you will represent the external community in internal forums to amplify their voices and smoothly deliver their contributions and ideas appropriately within Seagate.

Interns typically work Monday thru Friday 8am to 5pm. The hours are subject to change with or without notice at the sole discretion of Seagate.

About you:
  • PhD Degree (in progress) in Computer Science, Data Science or related fields
  • Currently enrolled student returning to school in fall 2021
  • Knowledge of third-party software suites such as Kubernetes, pytorch, Map-Reduce or Spark
  • Love to learn
  • Love to teach
  • Love technology
  • Love open source
Location:
Location: Remote U.S.
Travel: 0-10%

Full Job Description
Siemens is looking for a summer intern to support the development of a platform intended to manage large datasets and make them available to Siemens internal research units, especially in the context of training data for machine learning use cases. As data is often classified and/or under data privacy regulations, such a portal needs to support custom approval processes and license agreements. All this needs to be accessible via a modern web-based user interface that not only provides browsing and preview functionality, but also enables the data provider to set specific sharing policies and requirements.

During this internship, you will experience the excitement and challenges of industrial research and be part of a world class team. An internship with Siemens Technology is a great opportunity for students to gain real world experience in a diverse work environment. Specifically, you will learn to evaluate the requirements for a robust backend and the necessary storage solution and how to integrate all the components into a CI/CD pipeline. The project will also allow you to review existing similar solutions and create a benchmark to inform various make or buy decisions. You will also learn how to match the chosen data management strategies to regulatory frameworks (e.g., privacy laws and regulations) and an enterprise IT environment. You will get exposed to state-of-the-art software development and deployment frameworks in order to develop a robust and scalable program suitable for a powerful and scalable cloud hosting solution.

While we prefer the internship to be on site in our lab in Princeton, NJ, the uncertain future course of the pandemic makes it likely that this internship will need to happen entirely remotely. Hence, we offer this as a remote internship and thus encourage applicants from across the country.

The Challenge

Support the definition of software and security requirements for the solution, including developing the workflow for data consumers and data providers
Understand the need for data protection regulations in a corporate environment
Review existing products and technology solutions to support the definition of a system architecture
Develop an appealing User Interface and ensure good User Experience
Develop a robust Application Server, including setting up a DevOps-style CI/CD pipeline into cloud hosting, while ensuring an exceptional high level of security, and integrating Siemens specific requirements (such as SSO access)

The Candidate

Qualified candidates will have/be:
A current student pursuing a BSc or MSc degree in Computer Science / Computer Engineering, or other related subject with a focus on Software Development. Experience in IT-Security and/or Cloud Environments is certainly a plus. Please note, you must still be enrolled as a student during the internship period to qualify for the position.
Experience with clean software development and knowledge of best practices
Experience with software development tools (IDEs, VCSs), preferably in a DevOps environment
Experience with JavaScript frameworks and libraries, preferably vue.js
Experience with application servers and suitable programming languages, preferably Django & python
Experience with Linux and command lines
Experience with cloud-based systems, e.g., AWS, MS Azure is a plus
Experience in system administration and experience in handling large datasets are a plus
Ability to give presentations about complex technical topics
Excellent knowledge of English (spoken and written)

A successful candidate must be able to work with controlled technology in accordance with US Export Control Law. US Export Control laws and applicable regulations govern the distribution of strategically important technology, services and information to foreign nationals and foreign countries. Siemens may require candidates under consideration for employment opportunities to submit information regarding citizenship status to allow the organization to comply with specific US Export Control laws and regulations. Additional information on the US Export Control laws & regulations can be found on https://www.bis.doc.gov/index.php/policy-guidance/deemed-exports/deemed-exports-faqs

About Us

Our team is part of Siemens Technology, Siemens’ central Research & Development unit, and is composed of makers, innovators, engineers, and researchers that unite a passion about cybersecurity and securing our customers’ assets and networks - in domains such as control systems used in energy utilities that are part of the nation’s critical infrastructure, smart factories, building automation systems, intelligent transportation systems, healthcare, and innovative new products and solutions developed by Siemens. Our close contact to all our business units in Siemens provides the opportunity to contribute to and gain experience in real industrial applications.

Our research team is located in beautiful Princeton, NJ, a university town packed with exceptional international talent that provides a unique feel of this true cultural gem in the state. The town has plenty of activities to offer, but for those looking for more, at just about 1h drive we have NYC or Philadelphia. We have the best public schools in the country and all of the above glued together by a very active and welcoming community.

As Siemens’ central Research & Development department, we embrace this community. Our core mission is to support our Siemens business units as a central knowledge hub for all cybersecurity capabilities globally. We research and develop new and innovative solutions, based on much-needed deep technical expertise, and our network with internal and external experts and academia. This allows us to invent new solutions and approaches and verify their feasibility in the “real world” together with the product development teams of our business units – creating a stimulating setup for quick innovation cycles and rapid prototyping.

Join Us

We are more than employees; we are actively helping to make people’s lives a little better every day. Would you like to be a part of that? Then join us! Our Princeton facility is recognized for providing a stimulating environment for highly talented and self-motivated students. You will have the opportunity to test your knowledge in a challenging problem-solving environment. You will be encouraged to think out-of-the-box, innovate and find solutions to real-life problems. Whether you’re helping to develop products for the operating units or working in interdisciplinary projects for the business areas: at Siemens Technology you’ll be working in the heart of Siemens’ technological research together with the best.

Full Job Description
For over 45 years, National Business Furniture (NBF) has transformed the look, comfort, and productivity of offices ranging from start-ups to Fortune 500 companies. They have built their success with advantages like live Customer Service, a broad product range backed by our famous lifetime guarantee, gorgeous full-color catalogs, strong web presence, and a cutting-edge virtual showroom. All of this is enhanced by their great team of dedicated furniture people who stand on the principals of service, integrity, results, and continuous improvement.

We're presenting an exciting new opportunity for a Software Development Intern in Milwaukee, Wisconsin who will assist in writing test scripts and documentations and who will also contribute defect free software to production in a fast-paced environment. The Software Development Intern will be working with individuals at all levels and departments in a collaborative team environment.

What Makes This a Great Opportunity:
As NBF continues to invest in eCommerce and add technologies, we are looking for somebody who is just as eager to apply their development experience in an impactful way. This person will leave with an understanding of ecommerce systems and how data flows through the system. They will get experience working with IT, Digital, Merchandising and Marketing and will understand how each department contributes to a successful ecommerce business. position: Software Development Intern: Security Data Visualization for Cyber Defense
description:
Full Job Description
We are looking for a summer intern to prototype and develop innovative approaches for visualizing NoSQL data in the context of a cyber defense project for industrial control systems.

This task includes researching optimal methods for visualizing security data stored in Elastic format in collaboration with data scientists and developing JavaScript REACTJS-based web interfaces that implement such methods. You will learn about general concepts and methods of intrusion detection in OT systems (Operational Technology), understand security telemetry, data sources, correlation rules, and the overall software architecture of a SIEM (Security Information and Event Management) in the ICS (Industrial Control Systems) domain.

The internship will focus on developing/extending the interface of an existing software based on the Elastic stack (ELK=Elastic, Logstash, Kibana) to prototype, implement, and test an innovative OT detection feature. This task will be jointly performed in collaboration with data scientists and other developers and architects. The goal of the project is to design innovative methods that improve usability of a SIEM interface for SOC (Security Operations Center) engineers. Successful candidates will have the opportunity to work in close collaboration with an outstanding development team focusing on a unique market approach for threat detection in Industrial Control Systems.

The Challenge

Deploy and configure the Elastic Stack in a development environment using Linux / Windows
Identify and document security data visualization requirements in collaboration with the project Requirements Manager and data scientists
Model, design, and build a front end and backend application that implements identified requirements according to development best practices using REACTJS, Node.JS, Kibana, and Elastic UI Framework
Implement automated test cases for the backend application
Perform verification and validation tests
Document, present and discuss results

The Candidate

Qualified candidates will have/be:
A current student pursuing a BSc./MSc. degree in Computer Science / Computer Engineering, or other related subject. Please note, you must still be enrolled as a student during the internship period to qualify for the position.
Hands-on experience in command-line and development in Linux
Experience with the Elastic Stack (Elastic, Logstash, Kibana)
Experience with Jira and Gitlab, or similar platforms
Software development proficiency to work independently in Python
Software development proficiency to work independently on web front end JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Node.JS, ReactJS
Excellent knowledge of English (spoken and written)

Successful candidate must be able to work with controlled technology in accordance with US Export Control Law. US Export Control laws and applicable regulations govern the distribution of strategically important technology, services and information to foreign nationals and foreign countries. Siemens may require candidates under consideration for employment opportunities to submit information regarding citizenship status to allow the organization to comply with specific US Export Control laws and regulations. Additional information on the US Export Control laws & regulations can be found on https://www.bis.doc.gov/index.php/policy-guidance/deemed-exports/deemed-exports-faqs

Join Us

During this internship, you will experience the excitement and challenges of industrial research and be part of a world class team. An internship with Siemens Technology is a great opportunity for students to gain real world experience in a diverse work environment!

While we prefer the internship to be on site in our lab in Princeton, NJ, the uncertain future course of the pandemic makes it likely that this internship will need to happen entirely remotely. Hence, we offer this as a remote internship and thus encourage applicants from across the country.

position: Software Engineer Intern - Reverse Engineering (Research) Fall 2021
description:
Full Job Description
Overview:
GrammaTech’s internship program offers students the opportunity to gain real experience in a friendly, open, and supportive environment. This position is on the Research side of our business, projects chosen are based on real needs, and interns work closely with engineers to make sure that projects are completed successfully.

GrammaTech will conduct a series of programming tests and screening interviews as part of our process in C, Python, and possibly other languages. There are multiple positions available on varying teams and a position will remain posted until all roles are filled.

Responsibilities:
Research projects at GrammaTech can take on a wide variety of topics and challenges. Projects focus on software assurance, software protection, reverse engineering, and software producibility. We do both static and dynamic analysis on both source and object code, in order to tackle serious problems with practical solutions.

Some past and future examples of intern projects:
Compile benchmark programs, design and run a large-scale Bug-Injector experiment
Web development of a reverse-engineering diagram viewer and editor
Improve precision and recall of similar machine code search, including feature engineering, run experiments to identify gaps, and implement solutions
Expand testing for vulnerability detection and rewriting for embedded systems. Set up sample systems, identify vulnerabilities, and test if our tools offer strong protection.
Builds tools to infer security policies for drone components and fuzz those components to find inputs that violate the policies.

Qualifications:
Required

Currently enrolled in a BS, MS, or PhD in Computer Science
Excellent programming skills (C, Python) in Linux or Windows environments
Experience with reverse engineering, assembly programming, and/or fuzz testing

Preferred

Enrollment in a Computer Science PhD program

About the Company

Innovation is at the heart of GrammaTech, and we are constantly pushing the boundaries of software research and development–from software assurance and software integrity to cyber‐security, threat mitigation and autonomic computing. We develop new technologies and see the results of our research incorporated into tools used by engineers and security professionals worldwide.

GrammaTech was founded in 1988, with the firmly grounded purpose of helping today’s organizations develop tomorrow’s software. With a focus on the evolving cyber‐security landscape, software hardening, and intelligent systems, we tackle the most challenging software issues through a constant stream of highly innovative research and commercial development programs. Headquartered in Bethesda, MD, and a Research and Development Center in Ithaca, NY, as well as opportunities for remote employment.

GrammaTech, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity/Disability/Veterans/Affirmative Action employer.
Members of underrepresented groups are encouraged to apply.

Full Job Description

Requirements
Conditions of Employment

Must sign a Participant Agreement

This position is established under the provisions of the Pathways Internship Program.
Qualifications
PLEASE NOTE: This is not a developmental opportunity, this position may be filled at the GS-04 or GS-05 grade level depending on applicant qualifications and organizational requirements. The individual selected for this position may be considered for promotion to a higher grade without further competition upon meeting all legal and regulatory/program requirements.

PART-TIME OR UNPAID EXPERIENCE: Credit will be given for appropriate unpaid and or part-time work. You must clearly identify the duties and responsibilities in each position held and the total number of hours per week.

VOLUNTEER WORK EXPERIENCE: Refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service Programs (i.e., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community; student and social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge and skills that can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.
Education

This position has an education requirement. You MUST provide transcripts to support your educational claims. Education must be accredited by an accrediting institution recognized by the U.S. Department of Education. http://www2.ed.gov/admins/finaid/accred/index.html

To qualify for a GS-04: Completion of 2 academic years of post high school study or an associate's degree in a related field of study and have 60 or more semester hours or 90 or more quarter hours leading to a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science.

To qualify for a GS-05: Completion of 4 academic years of post-high school study leading to a bachelor's degree or completion of 4 academic years of pre-professional study and have 120 or more semester hours or 180 or more quarter hours leading to a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field of study.

An academic year of undergraduate education is defined as: 30 semester hours, 45 quarter hours, or the equivalent in an accredited college or university, or approximately 36 weeks for at least 30 classroom hours per week in an accredited business, technical, or secretarial school.

FOREIGN EDUCATION: Education completed in foreign colleges or universities may be used to meet the requirements. You must show proof the education credentials have been deemed to be at least equivalent to that gained in conventional U.S. education program. It is your responsibility to provide such evidence when applying.

Additional information

This is a Pathways Student Internship opportunity managed by the Force Renewal Program and centrally funded by the Air Force's Central Salary Account (CSA). The Internship offers valuable work experience directly related to your academic field of study. This is your opportunity to begin a successful Federal civilian career with the United States Air Force. As an Intern, you will be given the opportunity to gain the knowledge, skills and abilities needed to pursue a successful career with the US Air Force and upon completing your degree and meeting conversion eligibility requirements, be eligible for placement in a permanent position. However, it is important to remember that eligibility for conversion does not guarantee you will be offered a permanent position. The length of Internship is normally two years or when you complete your academic program and degree requirements.

This internship is to provide a learning opportunity for a student enrolled in a field of study relating to their career path, to enhance their future goals and improve their knowledge with work experience in a working environment

The entire period served under the Internship Program counts as the participant's trial period.

Interns may work part-time or full-time schedules

Non-citizens may be eligible for employment if permitted by the DoD Appropriation Act

The law made taxable certain reimbursements and other payments, including driving mileage, airfare and lodging expenses, en-route travel to the new duty station, and temporary storage of those items. The Federal Travel Regulation Bulletin (FTR) 18-05 issued by General Services Administration (GSA) has authorized agencies to use the Withholding Tax Allowance (WTA) and Relocation Income Tax Allowance (RITA) to pay for "substantially all" of the increased tax liability resulting from the "2018 Tax Cuts and Jobs Act" for certain eligible individuals. Resume - For qualification determinations your resume must contain hours worked per week (if part-time) and dates of employment (i.e., month/year to month/year or month/year to present). Veterans: If claiming 30% Disabled Veteran or Veteran's Preference - Submit VOW certification memo or copy of the official DD-Form 214, which must include the character of service (i.e., with an honorable or general discharge). This will be annotated in block 24 on member copy 2, 4, or 7 of the DD-Form 214. If claiming 30% Disabled Veteran, you must also submit a VA Letter or a disability determination from a branch of the Armed Forces. NOTE: All veterans claiming 10-point preference must also submit a SF-15.
ACTIVE DUTY SERVICE MEMBERS: The VOW Act requires agencies to treat active duty service member as veterans, disabled veterans, and preference eligible, when they submit, at the time they apply for a Federal job, a "certification" of active service in lieu of a DD214, assuming the service member is otherwise eligible. A "certification" letter should be on letterhead of the appropriate military branch of the service and contain (1) the military service dates including the expected discharge or release date; and (2) the character of service. The "certification" must reflect the service member is expected to be discharged or released from active duty service in the armed forces under honorable conditions not later than 120 days after the date of submission. The "certification" must be signed by, or by direction of, the adjutant, personnel officer, or commander of your unit or higher headquarters and must indicate when your terminal leave will begin (if applicable), your rank, dates of active duty service, the type of discharge and character of service (i.e. honorable). Further, agencies are required to verify a qualifying separation from military service prior to appointment, through the DD214 or other appropriate documentation. Active duty members that fail to provide a valid "certification" of service with their application will be found "not eligible." Military members may be appointed before the effective date of their military retirement/separation if member is on terminal leave.

position: Research Intern: Testing AI with Adversarial Analytics
description:
Full Job Description
We are looking for a summer intern to investigate and develop approaches for automated adversarial testing of AI (Artificial Intelligence) / ML (Machine Learning) algorithms!

Data analytics methods are added via a variety of AI or ML methods into products, turning them into “smart” products. However, traditional approaches for security testing / penetration testing focus on the underlying system and hosting application, not on the AI algorithms themselves. However, recent research has shown that AI algorithms may be susceptible to malicious attacks that aim at tricking these AI algorithms into misclassifying input. This may have severe consequences, based on the area where such smart products are used. The goal of our research project is to create an overview about current state of research and state of the art, and devise approaches to test data analytics methods for susceptibility to attacks.

The internship will focus on providing an overview about existing technology and research results and put it into perspective in regard to usability for automated testing in industrial settings. Ideally, the intern will support the development of approaches to enhance research results, make results usable, and create a PoC for a (semi-)automated testing approach. You will learn about Adversarial Analytics and the current state of the art including promises and limitations. You will have the opportunity to put this knowledge into the perspective of a large industrial company with established goals and processes for proper security testing. Additionally, you will present and discuss results with experts from different cybersecurity disciplines and understand the specific challenges of transferring academic results to commercialization.

The Challenge

Present and discuss results (with potential of publication of results)

A current student pursuing a MS/PhD degree in Computer Science / Data Science / Cybersecurity / Computer Engineering, or other related subject with a strong focus on IT-Security, Cybersecurity, or Data Science. PhD candidates or interns looking for a PhD topic preferred. Please note, you must still be enrolled as a student during the internship period to qualify for the position.
Experience with Adversarial Analytics preferred
Solid knowledge about and experience with Data Analytics methods, especially Machine Learning, required. Experience with improving classification results / reducing misclassifications preferred.
Ability for scientific work (reviewing papers and creating overviews about existing research / prior art) a significant plus
Experience in Penetration Testing / Security Assessments a significant plus
Solid software development skills (i.e., Python, Java or C/C++) a plus

Full Job Description
We are looking for a summer intern to investigate and develop automated solutions for gathering and processing data from Ransomware leak websites. This task includes automating manual processes in Threat intelligence to help monitor ransomware leak websites.

Ransomware switched from encrypting data on victim machine to stealing the data and threatening to publish it on the internet should a ransom not be paid. Most malware families host a portal on the dark web where they announce the latest victim and often publish sample of stolen data.

It is important for a corporation like Siemens to know as soon as possible when confidential data exchanged with a partner, a customer, or a supplier may have been lost due to a ransomware attack. For this reason, Siemens is constantly monitoring Ransomware Leak websites for known victims and initiating respective internal investigations / security incidents.

Despite the potential for automation, this process is periodically carried out by an analyst in a purely manual fashion. The challenge for the candidate is to fully automate this process and integrate it with the ecosystem of the Siemens CERT (Computer Emergency Response Team).

The internship will focus mostly on development, i.e., creating tools that can automatically crawl ransomware leak website, parse content, identify victim organizations and alert on potential matches from a given list. As an intern, you will learn about current capabilities and strategies of ransomware and how corporations react to and protect against such threats in a hands-on manner, working closely with Siemens CERT’s Cyber Threat Intelligence experts.

The Challenge

Create an automated script to periodically access Ransomware leak portals in a secure way (VPN + Tor).
Create a backend processing platform that can take screenshots, parse web content, and extract names of the victim organizations.
Organize and store collected data for historical searches.
Compare the list of victims with a database of known companies of interest and create alerts in case of matches.
Automatically initiate download of relevant content for further processing.
Report on your results to management and technical staff

The Candidate

Qualified candidates will have/be:
A current student pursuing a BS/MS/PhD degree in Computer Science / Computer Engineering, or other related subject with a strong focus on IT-Security or Cybersecurity. Please note, you must still be enrolled as a student during the internship period to qualify for the position.
Experience developing software in Python is required. Experience with Django is a plus.
Experience with Git is required. Experience with Gitlab, or similar platforms is a plus
Experience with Linux and command lines in required
Experience in implementing web APIs is a plus
Experience with Tor is a plus
Experience in identity access management is a plus
Prior experience with natural language processing and/or code profiling a significant plus
Ability to give presentations about sophisticated technical topics
Excellent knowledge of English (spoken and written)

Successful candidate must be able to work with controlled technology in accordance with US Export Control Law. US Export Control laws and applicable regulations govern the distribution of strategically important technology, services and information to foreign nationals and foreign countries.
