Overview:
Why Consider JAGGAER?

JAGGAER is the world's leading provider of comprehensive source-to-pay solutions. Some of the largest commercial, manufacturing and life sciences companies and government organizations in the world trust JAGGAER with billions of dollars of annual spend. JAGGAER eProcurement and strategic sourcing customers across the globe have gained access to the best suppliers, with the best terms, on our scalable, customizable, user-friendly platform. Our SaaS-based, source-to-settle solution provides unparalleled visibility, insights and recommendations to procurement leaders and suppliers. The result is a fluid supply chain driven by powerful spend analysis, comprehensive contract management and efficient accounts payable solutions.

What We’re Looking For:
As our Business Analyst intern, you will work with a Scrum development team to learn business operations, requirements gathering, business case and user story development and quality assurance testing. You will take part in various aspects of the software development life cycle for product feature development and delivery on his/her assigned team; from need determination, to intake of customer requirements, to reviewing that development output meets requirements, to post-development documentation, and more.

As stated by QAT Global “The business analyst works with the stakeholders to analyze and document business processes for the system to be developed, determine functional requirements and high-level features, elaborate on the details of the software project and requirements to set the direction of the project, and support its implementation.”

This position is part of an eight week internship program, consisting of 30 hour work weeks Monday-Friday. As a our BA ntern, here are a few exciting things you can expect during your time with JAGGAER:

Working with a Scrum team Product Owner (PO), you will have responsibilities in conducting business systems analysis for your Scrum team. You will learn and perform work processes from documenting requirements gathering from internal and external customers all the way through participating in some QA of the final product features. Additionally, you will work in a downstream function from the PO, to learn the career path to product owner; but also, to be eligible for an entry level Scrum team role in quality assurance, business analysis or other similar available position upon graduation.
Reporting to a Product Owner and or Product Development Manager this intern will learn about Agile and Scrum procedures, take part in various of its ceremonies, and learn about the life cycle development process. The intern will also receive various assignments in support of these processes, in conducting documentation and technical writing, and otherwise assisting in the conduct of the team, as assigned.

Principal Responsibilities:
Awesome things you’ll do:
Review requirements, specifications and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback
Document requirement gathering with business users and technical team to capture the requirements and use cases.
Detailed documentation preparation for requirements, use cases, functional requirements, and non- functional requirements.
Support in providing analysis, modeling, and other quantitative techniques as needed to answer business questions and evaluate business issues and objections.
May learn and apply user interface prototype development or designing UI mockups; but not a regular function
Process flow development and diagraming
Will develop basic Project Management skills and learn to provide project progress updates to project stakeholders.
Due to Covid-19 safety protocols, you will get to experience first-hand how teams have shifted to working remotely yet maintaining collaboration and teamwork

Position Requirements:
What you’ll bring:
Excitement for learning something new and being an important part of a small, focused team
At least 2 years completed in a bachelor's degree seeking program
Major of study in computer science, business information systems, commercial design or computer graphics for software, project management, business administration, analytics, or other general majors where your course of study includes a focus and interest in technology
Or Recent graduate of a Coding Bootcamp or other computer technology program, or professional management certification such as Six Sigma or Agile certification
Strong analytical skills, work ethic, independence, problem solving ability, effective communication skills, and overall positive attitude
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Proficiency with Microsoft Excel; in particular formula writing
Basic SQL ability not required, but a plus (demonstrated acumen to learn is necessary)
Strong organizational skills with the ability to multi-task
Interest in becoming a software QA, BA, software designer or software developer
Demonstration of basic knowledge of the software development life cycle
Knowledge of basic code writing principles
Willing to learn Agile Scrum development process

Full Job Description
Overview:
Why Consider JAGGAER?

JAGGAER is the world's leading provider of comprehensive source-to-pay solutions. Some of the largest commercial, manufacturing and life sciences companies and government organizations in the world trust JAGGAER with billions of dollars of annual spend. JAGGAER eProcurement and strategic sourcing customers across the globe have gained access to the best suppliers, with the best terms, on our scalable, customizable, user-friendly platform. Our SaaS-based, source-to-settle solution provides unparalleled visibility, insights and recommendations to procurement leaders and suppliers. The result is a fluid supply chain driven by powerful spend analysis, comprehensive contract management and efficient accounts payable solutions.

What We’re Looking For:
We are seeking a Quality Assurance (QA) intern to learn with our QA team and perform functional testing on our state-of-the-art procurement software service. Along with performing functional testing, you may have the opportunity to learn the basis of automation techniques and scripting, and perhaps complete discrete assignments with the automation team.

Functional testing is a type of user testing that is conducted by test feeding inputs into or performing operations of software to check for compliance with development requirements. This is non-code testing that will be performed primarily as part of an agile Scrum team.

Automation testing uses script automation to test code performance. Learning in this area may be performed as part of scrum team testing; but will be in conjunction with the QA automation team and may be done also outside of a Scrum team.

This position is part of an eight week internship program, consisting of 30 hour work weeks Monday-Friday. As a our QA intern, here are a few exciting things you can expect during your time with JAGGAER:

Working with staff QAs, youwill have responsibilities primarily of performing functional test of actual software on given environments, towards production, just as a regular staff QA. They will also learn and may begin over time to take on responsibilities of designing and implementing tests, and to debug and define corrective actions. You will also review system requirements and track quality assurance and outcome metric.
Reporting to a Product Owner and or Product Development Manager, you will learn about Agile and Scrum procedures, take part in various of its ceremonies and learn about the development life cycle process. The intern will also receive various assignments in support of these processes, in conducting documentation and technical writing, and otherwise assisting in the conduct of the team, as assigned.
Ultimately the successful candidate will be responsible for conducting tests before product launches to ensure software feature effectiveness, and that it meets requirements. Simultaneously you will learn the software development life cycle in a real development environment; while gaining experience in resolving system malfunctions to meet quality standards.

Principal Responsibilities:
Awesome things you’ll do:
Review requirements, specifications and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback
Learn to create detailed, comprehensive and well-structured test plans and test cases
Will learn the use of industry standard Agile software to identify, record, document and track bugs
Perform regression testing when bugs are resolved
Learn new testing tools and test strategies
May have opportunity to develop and execute automation scripts using open source tools
Due to Covid-19 safety protocols, you will get to experience first-hand how software teams have shifted to working remotely yet maintaining collaboration and teamwork

Position Requirements:
What you’ll bring:
Excitement for learning something new and being an important part of a small, focused team
2+ years in a Business Information Systems or Computer Science degree seeking program
Interest in becoming a software QA, BA, software designer or software developer
Demonstration of basic knowledge of the software development life cycle
Knowledge of basic code writing principles
Basic knowledge of HTML, SQL and scripting
Willing to learn Agile Scrum development process and QA testing techniques

Full Job Description
About Us:
Founded in 1828, Centreville Bank is dedicated to delivering “banking the way you want” to our customers. We are one of the region’s most stable and well-capitalized banks, with a growing presence that reaches into every corner of Rhode Island and nearby Massachusetts and Connecticut.

Summary:
The data and reporting intern will provide support to the Business Intelligence team through data mining, data analytics and report development. The internship program provides an opportunity for the candidate to develop their technical skills while utilizing Crystal Reports, Microsoft Access, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Power BI and Monarch. The intern will also gain general knowledge of banking operations, including loans, deposits, retail banking, interest rates, risk and regulatory reporting.

Collect and analyze large data sets using various applications. Identify trends and inconsistencies in data. Present results to Business Intelligence team.

Provide support to Business Intelligence team for data and reporting needs relating to Bank projects.

Pursuing a degree in Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, Finance, Information Technology or other related field
Excellent analytical, communication, and documentation skills.
Practices excellent time management skills.
Advanced knowledge of MS Excel and other MS Office applications.
Knowledge of SQL

Scheduling and Availability:
Must be available to work 40 hours per week during normal business hours.

Please note that while we do review every application that we receive, we may not be able to contact each candidate. If your background aligns with what we are looking for, you can expect to hear from us within 2 weeks of your application date.

Centreville Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All positions are subject to periodic evaluation.

Full Job Description
LaunchBay (based in North Billerica, MA) is a small company focused on product development and commercialization. Our team focuses on transforming early stage concepts into practical solutions to some of the world’s most challenging problems. We are looking for graduate student interns to assist with optimization of pilot scale production projects using artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML).

Your Impact:
Work closely with other chemical and mechanical engineers to develop and apply machine learning models to pilot projects
Perform data analysis to understand model performance and derive insights from data sets
Prepare reports and present the findings to peers unfamiliar with machine learning at project/program review meetings

Preferred qualifications:
A graduate-level student in data/computer science, electrical engineering, or other related disciplines
Strong grasp of machine learning concepts proven through academic or research projects
Competence in computer programming and automatic data processing
Critical thinking and excellent communication skills
Passion for applied research and product development

What you will get in return:
You will have a unique opportunity to create innovations and technical breakthroughs by applying machine learning methods to all stages of product development from concept to launch. You will also have ample opportunities to learn about quality control, systems thinking as well as small business development. Successful completion of this internship could lead to a full time position at LaunchBay.

Full Job Description
CIVIC Financial Services is a private money lender, specializing in the financing of non-owner occupied residential investment properties. CIVIC has funded over $4.0 Billion in loans since its inception, providing Mortgage Brokers and Real Estate Investors with a fast, cost effective funding source for their real estate investment needs.

CIVIC is committed to creating a workplace where our people thrive, which translates into a culture of inclusion, recognition, and success for our teammates and clients alike. Since 2016, CIVIC has been recognized by Best Workplaces and Fortune as a Great Place to Work, and CIVIC’s employee engagement ranks among the top 5% of companies nationally.

Whether you are an entrepreneur, an innovator, a game changer, a creative, a problem-solver, a thinker, or an operator we have all kinds. CIVIC is the place for smart, ambitious, dedicated people who work hard and play nice.

Yes, our business is in real estate investing... but our greatest investment is in you!

The Digital Innovation Intern will learn how we develop new creative software solutions to support our business needs and growing organization. This includes assisting with projects, manage our custom loan origination platform, test, and QA our new deployment features, creating mock-ups and UI prototypes, and assisting the team with deadlines. If you have any interest in becoming a software engineer, developer, business analyst, UI/U designer, or QA analyst this is the department for you. This is a hands-on role, working with a fast-paced and inviting digital innovation team, encompassing all aspects of development and systems support.

What you’ll do:
Support “on-demand” Digital Innovation requests.
Assist with project management through Microsoft Azure DevOps, Planner and SharePoint.
Ensure consistent and accurate systems support.
Administrative tasks to support the business analysts.
Assist team with analyzing data and different programs.
Collaborate with team on troubleshooting issues.
Contribute ideas and assist to enhance organizational needs.
Work collaboratively with other departments on special projects.

What you’ll need:
2nd year Junior or Senior pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in computer Information Technology/computer Science, Digital Innovation, Software/Web Development, UI/UX, Systems Engineering, or related field; Or Master’s Degree candidate seeking hands-on, real-world experience.
1+ year of prior work experience, preferably in a corporate office setting.
Knowledge of the mortgage/finance/real estate industry is a plus, but not required.
Must be professional and personable with great interpersonal communication skills
Excellent writing skills
Strong organizational skills
Good Microsoft Office Skills (Azure DevOps, Planner, Sharepoint, Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel)
Familiar with IT systems, different networks, and systems
Proven internet research experience
Ability to work fast under pressure, meet deadlines, and prioritize tasks effectively
Must be flexible and adaptable; able to work in a changing environment
Must have common sense and problem solving skills
Ability to deliver friendly, timely and reliable customer service to internal and external clients
Ability to work on multiple marketing projects simultaneously, with attention to detail

What's in it for you:
We have a strong focus on going above and beyond when it comes to caring for our team members and our communities. In addition to traditional benefits like health insurance, casual Fridays, paid vacation, holidays and sick leave, we’re proud to offer these unique and enriching work perks:

Celebrations: When we say we “work hard and play hard,” we mean it! We like to celebrate often via onsite and offsite happy hours, themed parties, parking lot BBQ's, milestone ceremonies, pot lucks, and Workout Tuesdays (to name a few).
Investments: As we're in the lending space, we believe we should consistently and frequently invest in our CIVIC team. We give away money every month to help our teammates pay off student debts, participate in our loan and lending accounts, and reward them for their “grand ideas” that make CIVIC better.
Comfortable Spaces: We like to make sure our teammates are well fed and can “find their zen” while at the office. Our kitchens are stocked with free snacks and beverages, in addition to catered breakfasts on Fridays and catered lunches multiple days per month. Many of our branches also have dedicated break spaces that are quiet, serene and perfect for relaxing.
Education: Every other Tuesday, we encourage our team to take “900 Seconds of Genius" (15 minutes) to focus on a passion project or topic that helps them grow. We also offer an online curriculum of courses through our own CIVIC University.
#CIVICCares Initiative: From beach cleanups, to food and clothing drives, to building homes for Habitat for Humanity, CIVIC provides several opportunities throughout the year for our team to step outside the office, bond, and come together to give back to our local communities.

CIVIC is an Equal Opportunity Employer and welcomes applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

General Purpose of Position:
The Process Engineer Intern will work with subject matter experts and be responsible for developing core technical proficiencies on the equipment, processes, and procedures for application of Aprecia’s proprietary three-dimensional printing (3DP) technology for Technical Transfer and scale up of Aprecia’s products to commercial manufacturing at Blue Ash, OH facility.

Duties/Responsibilities
1 Assist and take part in specific projects in review of late stage Product Development efforts in formulation, process robustness and manufacturing controls, learning and assisting with technology transfer or process validation required to achieve a successful transition

3 Learn and provide support for risk analysis performed in Technical Services and assure appropriate parameters are evaluated. Training on appropriate statistical approaches associated with testing for justification and support of critical process parameters and quality attributes
4 Collect data and assist in database assembly for Aprecia products. Learn statistical methods for evaluation of raw material critical quality attributes (CQA), in-process testing and critical process parameters (CPP) for continuous process improvement and annual report evaluations.
5 Assist in review of technical memos, qualification/validation protocols and reports for cleaning and manufacture of drug product to demonstrate a state of control
6 Execute sampling and testing as needed for Technical Services protocols
7 Assist in reviewing SOPs (standard operating procedures) for production where the introduction of new products or processes are being addressed
8 Manage specific project details as delegated for technical transfer and continuous improvement efforts within Aprecia
9 Communicate effectively with multidisciplinary teams as required and present findings to department heads, project managers, and the wider development teams as required
10 Other duties as assigned.

No direct reports

Position may require 10% travel

Work Shift:
Responsibilities for this role may be covered across multiple shifts

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
  • Good organizational skills with a collaborative approach to problem solving
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Self-directed and motivated for completion of projects
  • Data base assembly knowledge preferred
  • Statistical analysis and management of data experience preferred
  • Familiarity with MS Office Suite
Education and Experience:
  • Working towards a B.S. degree in Engineering, Chemistry, Computer Science, Math or a related discipline required
  • Manufacturing background, project management skillset, and 3rd and 4th year students with previous intern experience preferred
Physical Demands and Work Environment:
  • Good eyesight to read, interpret, and create technical materials
  • Good manual dexterity to operate computer and other general office equipment

Full Job Description
Ankura is a team of excellence founded on innovation and growth.

This position supports the Ankura Disputes & Economics Business Group - one of seven practices focused on client delivery services across the Firm.

Practice Summary: The Disputes and Economics practice focuses on assisting clients with financial, accounting, and economic issues associated with complex litigation. A sample of diverse consulting engagements includes: consulting and preparation of expert reports and testimony in consumer class action, overdraft fee/banking, labor and employment, and healthcare matters; consulting on complex forensic accounting and financial reporting matters; and litigation support.

Position Summary: Our Summer Internship Program has been created to give students an opportunity to learn what life as a consultant in our Disputes & Economics practice is like at Ankura. As an Intern, you will work on a variety of projects with different engagement teams. The program aims to give you exposure to the breadth of our services and client work. You will work closely with our professionals – Consultants through Senior Director – and gain first-hand experience in consulting. Your assignments may involve work in fact-finding, allocating costs, analyzing damages, organizing information, or helping to manage data. You will also learn new skills and participate in social and volunteer activities throughout the summer.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Interns perform a wide range of functions that may include developing and performing financial, accounting, economic, and statistical analyses; loading and validating data received from clients into structured data formats; developing models using data analytical tools and programs; performing detailed and complex spreadsheet analyses; assisting with data gathering activities including document review, research, and quality control of data entry activities; and preparation of client reports and exhibits.

Basic Qualifications, Skills, and Characteristics:
Third year undergraduate students graduating between December 2021 and June 2022 with a preference for candidates majoring in Finance, Economics, Accounting, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or other analytical course of study.
Solid academic performance with a 3.3 cumulative GPA or better.
A working knowledge of MS Office Suite (e.g., Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and strong research and analytical skills.
Strong oral and written communication skills.
Initiative, adaptability, creative problem-solving skills, an ability to work well with teams, self-motivated, and able to work overtime when needed.
Advanced technical skills with statistical and/or database programming software (e.g., SQL, R, Python, Stata, SAS) is a plus.

Position Description:
About Lenovo

Focused on a bold vision to deliver smarter technology for all, we are developing world-changing technologies that create a more inclusive, trustworthy and sustainable digital society. By designing, engineering and building the world’s most complete portfolio of smart devices and infrastructure, we are also leading an Intelligent Transformation – to create better experiences and opportunities for millions of customers around the world. Join us in defining our world of tomorrow and creating smarter technology for all!

Who You’ll Work With
At Lenovo, we manufacture one of the world’s widest portfolios of connected products, including PCs (ThinkPad, Yoga, Lenovo Legion), tablets, smartphones and workstations as well as augmented and virtual reality (Mirage, ThinkReality) and smart home/office solutions, software and services. Lenovo’s data center solutions (ThinkSystem, ThinkAgile) are creating the capacity and computing power for the connections that are changing business and society.

MBG (Mobile Business Group) – For over 90 years, Motorola has been a pioneering force in the mobile industry. From creating the first cellular phone in 1973 to the ground-breaking design of the RAZR; our mantra is simple, build the best innovative products and make sure they're attainable for everyone. It’s this philosophy that drives us relentlessly to create meaningful innovation that provides greater consumer choice and positively impacts their lives.

About Our Team
This is a friendly and dynamic team of about a dozen researchers and engineers with very diverse backgrounds and strong technical expertise. We incorporate converging technologies into both existing and new products that take us beyond today’s most advanced products: smartphones, tablets, PCs, and other electronic devices. We perform research and system integration of software and hardware to deliver exciting products utilizing artificial intelligence, computer vision, natural language processing, context awareness, connectivity, authentication & security, as well as other relevant research areas.

What You’ll Do
You will join the Mobile Technology Innovation team in Lenovo Research, an advanced research, and technology group within Lenovo in downtown Chicago. You will be working with a group of experienced colleagues on one or more of the current research projects. You will participate in regular team meetings, brainstorming sessions, team-building events, and other company activities. You will have opportunities to contribute to the business by solving actual technical problems with innovative ideas, try out your idea by writing code and testing your code, file patent applications, and make technical presentations.

**Note: This is a Fall Semester internship with the potential to extend through Spring 2022

  • Familiar with one or more development systems like TensorFlow, PyTorch, Linux, Android, Windows, or real-time embedded system
  • Show a passion for innovation!

Position Purpose

The purpose of an internship at Woodward is to provide students with the opportunity to gain exposure and “real life” business acumen within industry. MBG (Mobile Business Group) – For over 90 years, Motorola has been a pioneering force in the mobile industry. From creating the first cellular phone in 1973 to the ground-breaking design of the RAZR; our mantra is simple, build the best innovative products and make sure they're attainable for everyone. It’s this philosophy that drives us relentlessly to create meaningful innovation that provides greater consumer choice and positively impacts their lives.

About Our Team
This is a friendly and dynamic team of about a dozen researchers and engineers with very diverse background and strong technical expertise. We incorporate converging technologies into both existing and new products that take us beyond today’s most advanced products: smartphones, tablets, PCs, and other electronic devices. We perform research and system integration of software and hardware to deliver exciting products utilizing artificial intelligence, computer vision, natural language processing, context awareness, connectivity, authentication & security, as well as other relevant research areas.

What You’ll Do
You will join the Mobile Technology Innovation team in Lenovo Research, an advanced research, and technology group within Lenovo. You will be working with a group of experienced colleagues on one or more of the current research projects. You will participate in regular team meetings, brainstorming sessions, team-building events, and other company activities. You will have opportunities to contribute to the business by solving actual technical problems with an innovative idea, try out your idea by writing code and testing your code, file patent applications, and make technical presentations.

This is a Fall Semester internship with the potential to extend through Spring 2022

Full Job Description
Personalis is a rapidly growing cancer genomics company transforming the development of next-generation therapies by providing more comprehensive molecular data about each patient's cancer and immune response. Our ImmunoID NeXT Platform® is enabling the development of next generation immuno-oncology therapeutics and diagnostics.

Summary:
You will join a team of software engineers whose mission is to simplify, modernize and scale business. The business needs robust, high-performance software that can accurately and reliably orchestrate analysis of large volumes of next-generation sequencing (NGS) data. Our in-house developed software platform called "Symphony" provides the infrastructure to scale our business for a wide range of clinical and research applications, from genetic disease research, to cancer clinical diagnostics, to leading-edge developments in immuno-oncology.

We are offering a summer internship opportunity to promising computer science students who have a professional interest in software engineering. This internship will offer you direct exposure to real world industry applications of software engineering to the rapidly growing biotechnology space and will focus on developing you in areas where a computer science curriculum typically does not.

The internship will be approximately 10-12 weeks in duration (dates flexible depending on your academic calendar).

Responsibilities:
The emphasis of this internship program is to gain exposure to best industry practices in software engineering. You will be responsible for a summer project from conception through feasibility, development, testing and rolling into "production".

During the 10-12-week program, you will:
Understand the latest technology in software engineering, its impact on immuno-oncology, bioinformatics, Next Generation Sequencing and high-performance computing and where you can best focus your academic studies for future career direction.
Select your summer project with direct business application(s).
Create a project plan for your summer project with a well defined scope and realistic deadlines.
Leverage Agile development practices as more information about your summer project becomes available during the development process.
Participate in our weekly Kanban planning and semi-weekly standups.
Leverage technologies such as Java, Springboot, Hibernate, ReactJS, Kubernetes, Docker, Linux, Bash and Python to effectively build and operate software that help run the business.
Version control software source code and file system resources and gain exposure to common versioning/branching strategies.
Learn coding standards/conventions and undergo at least one code review of your project with the software engineering group.
Write regression and unit tests to ensure desired functionality over time.
Understand and leverage CI-CD pipeline to automated deployments & automated testing, signifying your work is ready for "production".
Presentation of your summer project to the Personalis Research & Development organization.

A successful intern will emerge with valuable, hands-on industry experience and find him/herself in a fantastic position for a career in the software industry.

Requirements:
Support engineering efforts to explore new methods and technologies in the cutting-edge software engineering group at a rapidly growing company
See your summer project from feasibility through "production" with a final presentation to conclude
Software interns will be required to work on Pacific Standard Time.
The ideal candidate will be completing their junior year of undergrad, or first year of graduate school at a top university and will be returning to school in the fall.
Software development
Experience with language such as Java and ReactJS.
Familiarity with Unix/Linux or OS X command line
Familiarity with testing frameworks like JUnit, Jest,
Due to COVID-19 pandemic, this position will be 100% remote but only available to candidates residing in and authorized to work in the United States.

Education:
Bachelors or Master degree in Computer Science.

Application process:
Submit your resume and one academic reference by April 25th, 2021. No cover letter necessary. References will not be contacted unless you are selected for the interview process.
Candidates selected for interview process will be informed by April 30th 2021.
Video interviews and programming assessment through week of May 3-5th 2021.
Start/end of internship flexible based on academic calendar.

Drive global technology

We accomplish this by building perfectly designed products which are simple to use, user friendly and a seamless integration into various applications. We just happen to build great technology solutions. By joining our team, you’ll have an immediate impact to contribute to solving a significant marketplace problem. Our goal is to challenge, prepare and accelerate your career growth by exposing you to various leaders in the organization, having you participate in strategy discussions to further advance our footprint in the marketplace and the opportunity to witness how we build great technology solutions. By the way, we have a lot of fun and the only way you’ll find out how much fun we have is by joining our team.

Product Management - work with Service Team & IT groups to manage day to day issues that may come up Manage Product Updates; Enhancements & Bug Fixes- write IT requirements, review estimates, test code changes, implement code changes and test in productions Work with training on updates, enhancements & bug fixes Work with the Business Teams & Sales on the best course of action for our Product.

What we are looking for…

Currently pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Data Analytics, Human Resources, and Communications
GPA 3.0+ preferred
Basic Microsoft Office Skills Strong Communication Skills - Interact with IT, Business Owners, Testing Coordinators,
Vendors Programming Languages are not required but technical background is a plus

Learn more about Fiserv:
To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that provides flexibility and affordability with a variety of medical, dental, vision, life insurance and disability options.

We are #FISVProud of our benefits and well-being programs. Our commitment to wellness, wellness education, preventive services and fitness activities are designed to meet you where you are.

Life moves fast. And as it does, we know most people aren’t thinking about “financial services”. But we are.

We help people and businesses move money and information every minute of every day. Our solutions connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another, millions of times a day, behind the scenes, reliably and securely.

We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments enabling innovative financial services experiences that are in step with the way people live and work today. The company’s approximately 44,000 associates proudly serve clients in more than 100 countries, so their customers, members and consumers can move money when and where they need it, at the point of thought.

Our Aspiration is to move money and information in a way that moves the world. As a FORTUNE™ 500 company and one of FORTUNE Magazine World’s Most Admired Companies for the seventh consecutive year, we are committed to excellence and purposeful innovation.

We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer. position: Research Internship - Fall 2021 (NLP, Computer Vision, or Machine Learning)
description:
Full Job Description
Type: Internship
Experience: PhD/Graduate Students

Who we are:
Dataminr puts real-time AI and public data to work for our clients, generating relevant and actionable alerts for global corporations, public sector agencies, newsrooms, and NGOs. Our leading AI platform detects the earliest signals of high-impact events and emerging risks from vast amounts of publicly available information. Our real-time alerts enable tens of thousands of users at hundreds of public and private sector organizations to learn first of breaking events around the world, develop effective risk mitigation strategies, and respond with confidence as crises unfold.

Dataminr is making its mark for growth and innovation, recently earning recognition on the Deloitte Technology Fast 500, Forbes AI 50 and Forbes Cloud 100 lists. We also earned accolades for 'Most Innovative Use of AI' from the 2020 AI & Machine Learning Awards.

Join our team and help the world manage risk in real time. You'll work with 600+ talented people across seven offices, united by our passion to collaborate, make a difference, and have fun while doing it!

Who you are:
You're a Ph.D. candidate who has published in top tier conferences and are passionate about having a positive impact on the world. You are enthusiastic about working on some of the most challenging problems in AI, working in a highly collaborative environment and directly contributing to products while advancing the state of the art. You are very creative, can work independently, and are an excellent collaborator and communicator.

Responsibilities:
Perform research to advance the state of the art and solve specific problems at scale in one or more of the following areas: NLP, HCI, Machine Learning/Deep Learning, Computer Vision, Complex Networks.
Work closely with a diverse, interdisciplinary team on a specific project to be completed during the internship.
Excel in placing a human-centered focus on the work (context, end-user impact, etc), finding solutions that work in practice and have significant impact.

Minimum qualifications:
Must be enrolled in a Ph.D. program in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or a related field.
Ideal candidates will have had prior internship experience.
Outstanding publication record in the candidate's field of study (ACL, CVPR, CHI, WWW, RecSys, ICCV, NIPS, ICML, etc.).
Demonstrated ability to work independently, set up experiments and demonstrate progress through principled used of metrics.

Dataminr is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Individuals seeking employment at Dataminr are considered without regards to race, sex, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, genetics, marital status, pregnancy, unemployment status, sexual orientation, citizenship status or veteran status.

Full Job Description
Overview:
SW Health Informatics Engineering Intern - Bothell, WA

Internships are a great way for university students to learn about a technology or product they are passionate about while gaining practical work experience in a corporate environment. At Fujifilm Sonosite, we are committed to finding talented students who share our passion for medical device technology and this internship reflects that commitment! We have the opportunity, you have the talent! Read on to learn more about what we are looking for and if you think you’ve got what it takes to be successful in this role, apply today!

FUJIFILM, Sonosite, Inc . We are an innovative and high performance culture with tremendous opportunities. People who work here are given the unique opportunity to contribute to the advancement of healthcare throughout the world. Headquartered in Bothell, WA USA, Fujifilm Sonosite is represented by a global distribution network in over 100 countries. Since its inception, Fujifilm Sonosite’s lightweight, robust products have created and led the point-of-care ultrasound market. From sophisticated urban hospital emergency rooms to clinics in austere, remote villages, Fujifilm Sonosite systems are used by over 21 medical specialties and provide clinicians around the world with a cost-effective tool for improving patient safety and workflow efficiency. Fujifilm Sonosite holds a number of prestigious design awards and has in excess of 145 patents.

External US:
Job Summary:
FUJIFILM Sonosite is seeking a motivated, resourceful, and ambitious student intern to assist in Software Engineering duties within Health Care Informatics Software Engineering. The position will introduce the student to a variety of new software engineering development practices and procedures such as Agile. The student will be training directly under the primary Principal / Architect for a new Web Informatics product.

The primary goal of this internship is to be able to take the knowledge gained in one’s education and apply that knowledge to the real life experience. This is an exciting, and unique, internship that will allow the student to learn and partake in the following items below:

Web Application / Micro Services & Software Engineering Development through JAVA & C#
Console / Hardware Engineering through C# an C++
Software Building, Testing, and Verification Practices
Infrastructure Setup through Virtual Machines, System Architecture Design
Exposure to enterprise Design Patterns
Exposure to Health Care Informatics Protocols and Network Communication Architecture
Technical Documentation Creation and Process

Essential Job Functions:
Learn and apply knowledge gained from education to real-life experiences.
Support Principal / Software Architect in Web Service Development, Console Application Development, Embedded Application Development, & Software Design.
Assist in minor Documentation writing for work that is done.
Assist in Software testing and functionality verification.
Being open to learn in a fast-paced environment.

Knowledge and Experience:
A completed semester or quarter of an Introduction to Computer Science or Software Engineering course. This also may include outside additional training, given that the student’s path is Computer Science or Software Engineering.
Basic to Intermediate knowledge in both Object Oriented and Non-Object Oriented Software Development Languages for at least one the following: JAVA, C#, HTML5, and C – other languages are acceptable as well.
Basic to Intermediate knowledge in Web Application protocols such as HTTP & TCP.
Basic knowledge in web communication such as JSON.
Basic understanding of Database Systems is a plus.
Basic Understanding in Virtual Servers, Windows Server and Linux Operating Systems are a plus.
Basic knowledge of Angular, React, or Node JS frameworks are a plus.

Skills and Abilities:
Strong problem solving skills
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Ability to communicate effectively both within other groups in Engineering and throughout the company.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, small team environment with minimal supervision.
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Ability to lift 25 pounds, with or without accommodations.

FUJIFILM Sonosite, Inc. Visit us today to learn more about our exciting technologies and how you can make a difference. To apply and obtain further details regarding key responsibilities and experience requirements, check out our careers page at www.Sonosite.com/careers.

FUJIFILM Sonosite, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Full Job Description
At Cirrus Logic, mixed-signal engineering drives our company. We develop high-performance, low-power signal processing solutions in audio, voice and haptics, delivering innovative end-user experiences and solving difficult challenges for new generations of mobile and consumer devices. While breaking the innovation barrier, we’ve also built an award-winning company culture, thanks to our extraordinary workforce and our ongoing efforts to champion and promote diversity, as well as our principles of equality and fairness in the workplace. Would you enjoy working alongside the industry's top engineers and solving sophisticated challenges for the world's top consumer brands? Join our team and help us continue to make this an exceptional place to work!

As an intern on our Software Tools team, you will work alongside our applications, firmware and algorithm development teams to write production code for our software tools. We develop advanced software tools, running on Windows and Mac platforms that allow Cirrus Hardware Engineers and our Customers to perform graphical configuration and tuning of our products.

Are you right for this role? If so, you can expect excellent development opportunities and a chance to get real world experience in a fun environment!

Responsibilities

Work within a large, globally distributed software development team that develops advanced software tools, running on Windows and Mac platforms
Collaborate with the local team to clarify, breakdown, and estimate requirements
Work with stakeholders and teammates to create, review, and implement designs
Learn good practices and techniques for developing software on a global team
Learn as much as much as possible about Cirrus Logic products and the Solutions we provide our Customers

Required Skills and Qualifications

Actively pursuing a BS or MS in Computer Science or Computer Engineering (or similar relevant area)
Understanding of Object-Oriented design and development skills in Java, C++, C# (or similar statically-typed system language)
Python, Ruby or similar system scripting language
Experience/Exposure to multi-threaded systems, multi-process systems, IPC, Algorithms, Data Structures
Strong desire to work actively with development teams and learn both soft and technical skills

Preferred Skills and Qualifications

Experience with Java or C#
Experience with high-level UI frameworks (JavaFX, Swing, XAML/.NET, Qt or similar)
Understanding of version control (Git, SVN)
Experience with Unit/UI Testing (JUnit, TestFX)
Experience/interest in embedded development, digital signal processing, microcontrollers
Experience/interest in build automation, deployment and continuous integration methodologies
This position is located in Austin, TX

Cirrus Logic is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We strive to select the best qualified applicant for any opening and to reward employees based on their skills, experience and performance. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, pregnancy status, marital status, gender, age, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by law.

description:
Full Job Description

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About the SAP Internship Experience Program

The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP
Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team

Data Platform team is responsible to Design, Architect and implement a robust Data Platform (which is a collection of many different Infrastructure) to bring data in (un)structured & semi-structured format to Data Lake or Data Warehouse. Lot of experiments & new technologies getting evaluated to make a appropriate Data driven decisions.

Our group has engineers (senior and entry level) working closely with their respective expertise to solve complex distributed problems.

Candidates having a Data Driven engineering mindset and eager to learn, be part of solving complex problems, this is the group you don’t want to overlook

What you’ll do:
Position title: SAP SuccessFactors iXp Intern – Full-Stack Software Developer

Location: San Ramon, CA

Expected start date to end date: June 7th, 2021 – August 13th, 2021

In this role, you’ll:
Project : Data Platform and Search

Team is currently in the POC/Prototype phase to build the Data Platform where Events which are generated by our business applications will be sent thru our platform which gets categorized and sorted appropriately in *Streaming style* to make data available to upstream analytics or other business pillars to consume in real time. ML & AI models will be applied on the data once its reaches our Data Lake.

For 2021 we have to solidify our prototype and make some architectural decisions with all the experiments and code changes to prove our scalability and resilience story

Data Platform is an effort to make SAP SuccessFactors an Data Driven Company to serve or internal & external customers
Details are given as part of what Data Platform is all about and what’s our direction towards solving current gap in providing data for our Data Scientist

Who you are:
We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.

Engineering and Data Driven mindset
MS computer science preferred
Programming (Java/Python), Big Data, Data Science
JAVA/Python, Linux System knowledge

Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!

WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

Additional Locations: Virtual - USA

What you will do

Johnson Controls invites you to apply for an internship located in Boca Raton, Fl, Aurora, CO or Milwaukee, WI. This internship is designed to provide you with a positive work/training experience and challenging objectives. Specific identified internship responsibilities are outlined below. This will be a full-time summer 2021 internship.

The intern will be assigned to the Security Operations team and will shadow the SOC analysts. description:
Full Job Description
Requisition ID: 284960
Work Area: Sales

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About the SAP Internship Experience Program

The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP
Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team

Our Sales Solutions team is responsible for the End-to-End solution delivery supporting SAP’s core Sales Deal Execution business processes closely interacting with the respective LoB Global Customer Organization (GCO). Here we act as the Business’ trusted advisor and expert, driving together the simplification of business processes based on a user-centric approach.

You can work on a wide variety of projects – cloud applications, user experience, operational support, new development and implementation of new innovative technology.
You can be part of IT teams who showcase SAP as the company’s first and best reference customer through The Best Run SAP program and close collaboration and co-innovation with our SAP standard development organization.

We are looking for bright minds to participate and contribute their great ideas through co-innovation and solution implementation projects empowered through SAP’s cutting-edge technologies to enable SAP as the digital enterprise. Customer Experience, End-User Centricity and Immaculate Work Ethics is the key

What you’ll do:
Position title: SAP Sales Solution iXp Intern – IT Technology Consultant

Location: NSQ/ Virtual USA – please note that roles will be remote until local guidelines ensure safe office reopenings

Expected start date to end date: May 17, 2021 – November 17, 2021

In this role, you’ll:
Work within our IT unit to enable best in class IT solutions for our Sales Solutions business processes which will include:

Being a part of an agile team, assume responsibility for tasks and complete them end-to-end with the best quality.
primarily focus on development and customization of cloud-based software application.
design and implement new solutions using SAP’s latest Cloud Platform technologies.
drive continuous improvements with focus on quality, stability, usability, maintainability and ultimately customer satisfaction.
assume responsivity of all software development tasks working with multiple teams of developers supporting software product in ownership.
develop skill and competency on latest solutions and technologies relevant for internal sales processes.

Finally, bring your energy and passion and we’ll give you the tools to develop your knowledge and grow!

Who you are:
Education and Qualifications / Skills and Competencies

Graduate in Computer Science or equivalent.
Practical knowledge of Iron Python is must.
Quick Learner, passionate, motivated and self-managed.
Experience in agile project delivery (Scrum, Kanban etc.) connected with End-User Centricity.
Ability to work in an international, virtual and highly diverse team.
Excellent English skills.
Familiarity of Callidus CPQ and Callidus Commissions solutions is a plus
Practical experience with SQL.

Work Experience

Ideally 1 – 2 years of working experience or experience through internships, working student employments or first full-time jobs.
Ability to work well in an international, virtual and highly diverse team as well as independently and have a positive self-motivated can-do attitude
Experience working in an Agile development environment.
Ability to deliver in the set timeframe.

Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!

WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

Full Job Description
Position Description:
About Lenovo

Focused on a bold vision to deliver smarter technology for all, we are developing world-changing technologies that create a more inclusive, trustworthy and sustainable digital society. By designing, engineering and building the world’s most complete portfolio of smart devices and infrastructure, we are also leading an Intelligent Transformation – to create better experiences and opportunities for millions of customers around the world. Join us in defining our world of tomorrow and creating smarter technology for all!

Who You’ll Work With
At Lenovo, we manufacture one of the world’s widest portfolios of connected products, including PCs (ThinkPad, Yoga, Lenovo Legion), tablets, smartphones and workstations as well as augmented and virtual reality (Mirage, ThinkReality) and smart home/office solutions, software and services. Lenovo’s data center solutions (ThinkSystem, ThinkAgile) are creating the capacity and computing power for the connections that are changing business and society.

MBG (Mobile Business Group) – For over 90 years, Motorola has been a pioneering force in the mobile industry. From creating the first cellular phone in 1973 to the ground-breaking design of the RAZR; our mantra is simple, build the best innovative products and make sure they're attainable for everyone. It’s this philosophy that drives us relentlessly to create meaningful innovation that provides greater consumer choice and positively impacts their lives.

About Our Team
This is a friendly and dynamic team of about a dozen researchers and engineers with very diverse backgrounds and strong technical expertise. We incorporate converging technologies into both existing and new products that take us beyond today’s most advanced products: smartphones, tablets, PCs, and other electronic devices. We perform research and system integration of software and hardware to deliver exciting products utilizing artificial intelligence, computer vision, natural language processing, context awareness, connectivity, authentication & security, as well as other relevant research areas.

What You’ll Do
You will join the Mobile Technology Innovation team in Lenovo Research, an advanced research, and technology group within Lenovo in downtown Chicago. You will be working with a group of experienced colleagues on one or more of the current research projects. You will participate in regular team meetings, brainstorming sessions, team-building events, and other company activities. You will have opportunities to contribute to the business by solving actual technical problems with innovative ideas, try out your idea by writing code and testing your code, file patent applications, and make technical presentations.

**Note: This is a Fall Semester internship with the potential to extend through Spring 2022

Position Requirements:
Basic Qualifications:
  • Pursuing MS degree in CS, CE, EE or related field
  • Hands-on experience applying machine learning and deep learning knowledge to computer vision, image processing, or related area
  • 3+ years programming experience in one or more languages like Java, Python, C, C++, or MATLAB
Preferred Qualifications
  • Pursuing Ph.D. degree in CS, CE, EE or related field
  • Understand the design and use of data structures and algorithms
  • Experience developing one or more of the following: mobile camera system, image signal processing (ISP), computational photography, human-computer interaction
  • Familiar with one or more development systems like TensorFlow, PyTorch, Linux, Android, Windows, or real-time embedded system
  • Show a passion for innovation!
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any federal, state, or local protected class.

position: Internship - Product Manager, Credit Cards - Summer 2021
description:
Full Job Description
**Note: Unfortunately, Summer Internships at LendingTree are not open to students who will require sponsorship now or at any point in the future. Thank you.

This position will likely work remotely the entire summer. However, our preference is to hire someone who will be based in the Chicago, IL area on the chance we're able to go back to office during the summer.

THE POSITION

Our former Summer Interns will tell you, LendingTree’s Internship Program is selective, challenging and structured to push the limits of what they thought they could do - and they wouldn’t have wanted it any other way. Are there easier ways to spend your summer? Absolutely. But a LendingTree Internship will help you grow professionally and also get you closer to landing a phenomenal job once you graduate – maybe even with LendingTree. Here’s what you can expect:

Real work. The only person you’ll be getting coffee for at LendingTree is yourself. You’ll be doing professional level work that will have a real impact on the business
Training. Sure you’ll learn a ton of industry skills as you contribute to your team every day, but you’ll also go through specific training on: crafting a phenomenal resume and LinkedIn profile, getting interviews and how to handle them, how to give a great presentation and more
You’re not alone. In addition from the support from your team you’ll be assigned a Mentor outside of your department who will guide you and mentor you throughout the summer
End of summer presentation. At the end of the summer every Intern gives a PPT presentation to Executives which will include a summary of what you accomplished, what you learned and 2 ideas that will either make the company money or save the company money

RESPONSIBILITIES

Own a project – Analyze current customer experiences. Define and run qualitative and quantitative customer research to inform the development of web-based products
Monitor and analyze product performance and communicate findings and recommendations for meaningful changes.
Define Product requirements for actionable changes and reiterate.
Put together wireframes to support product requirements and changes to be done.
Understand scope of the internal web-based product, participate in workshops. Own feature delivery, and write product requirements by working with business and development teams.
Communicate to partners on the progress of the feature/functionality.

QUALIFICATIONS

Undergrad or grad student (3.5+ GPA required) who will be graduating in Dec. 2021 or May 2022 (GPA must be listed on your resume to be considered).
Preferred majors: Business, Information Technology, Computer Science, Sociology, Psychology
Proficient in Excel (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUPs, etc.) and SQL
Good understanding of customer research methods (qualitative, quantitative)
Knowledge of Agile/Scrum product development or software development methodologies is preferred.
Willingness to roll up your sleeves and GET STUFF DONE.

COMPANY

LendingTree is the nation’s largest online lending marketplace. That means we connect customers with multiple lenders so they find the best deals on loans, credit cards, savings accounts and insurance. Our goal is to help people save money, and we believe the best way to do that is by giving them a way to shop for loans and compare lenders so they make their best financial choices. Our CEO Doug Lebda founded the company in 1996 after a frustrating house-hunting experience. In those days, we mostly helped people find good mortgage deals. Now, we help consumers find their best in personal loans, auto loans, business loans, student loans, credit cards, savings accounts, home equity loans and more.

What else you should know:
We’re a publicly-traded company (TREE).
We’ve welcomed several other companies into the LendingTree family to augment our efforts at helping borrowers make their most sensible financial choices.
We’ve built the LendingTree app and My LendingTree dashboard to give consumers tools to manage and monitor their financial health.
We still make funny commercials.

CULTURE

We’re a fast-paced company with an entrepreneurial bend. We work hard and test our products often. We’re collaborative, ambitious, candid and high-energy. Our teammates are some of the brightest, most talented people you’ll ever work with. We care more about your smarts than we do about the kinds of clothes you wear (but please, do wear clothes to work!), and we’re pretty good about rewarding innovation, creativity and the knack for just getting stuff done (we even have an award for employees called the GSD, “Get Stuff Done”). Come work with us!

LendingTree is the kind of company that not only promotes diversity and inclusion; we thrive because of these values. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion (or creed), gender, gender expression, age, national origin, disability, marital status, sexual orientation or military status.

Full Job Description
Aeroseal is hiring immediately! Data Analyst Summer Intern needed!

Who are we? A fast-growing company with award-winning technology that has created new products that are disrupting well-established industries.
Yes, we have fun company amenities including a ping pong table, popcorn machine and company happy hours. Our team members play as hard as they work. But it takes more than amenities to be a great place to work.

How is Aeroseal different?

We are:
Restless with curiosity and always asking if there's a better way
Passionate about turning our customers' problems into opportunities to grow their business
Constantly learning, because we understand we must try new approaches to get new outcomes.
There is more to our culture of innovation. But we also have a sense of urgency, so we won't list them all here.

What's the rush? Well, our company has an ambitious mission.

Aeroseal wants to make a lasting impact on people and the world around us, improving their lives and making the world a better place in which to live.

And we need your help to make it happen.

Overview

The Data Analyst Intern would be responsible for building out our prospect database to accommodate new initiatives and achieved desired company goals. This individual would utilize multiple sales and marketing tools, including Salesforce and Sales Navigator, to both prospect and capture within our CRM. There is a strong component of creativity, resourcefulness, and ingenuity to appropriately locate and determine appropriate prospects for entry. Additionally, this intern will gain a great deal of exposure to CRM software, namely Salesforce, having shared responsibility for pulling lead reports generated from events and correctly labelling each for accurate entry to Salesforce. This role will also be tasked with updating current data within Salesforce to remedy inaccurate collection over time (especially where automated methods are not feasible or available), properly organizing accounts by hierarchy, general lead conversion, and CRM maintenance support. Working closely with the Marketing team and Sales leaders, this intern will have full support and walk away with a greater understanding of Salesforce, Sales Navigator, prospecting methods, business strategy, and more.

Responsibilities include:
Lead/ Account Prospecting using tools such as Sales Navigator to find contacts and accounts needed to support current and future business initiatives.
Export, Review, Update and Import lead lists to Salesforce, from various events (webinars, tradeshows, association events, member lists, etc.)
Update current data within Salesforce to accommodate data validity efforts.
An example might include reviewing current accounts and assigning proper hierarchy to those that have a Headquarters location along with branch offices, or accounts requiring secondary industries.
General lead conversion to support both Salesforce maintenance and the Sales Teams.

Skills and Requirements:
Pursuing a Bachelors Degree in Marketing, Business Analytics, Data Analytics, Computer Sciences or Sales or other related areas with applicable skill sets
Junior or Senior with 3.0 GPA or higher
Passionate about Marketing and Sales
Working knowledge of software applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.) and familiarity with the Windows operating system.
Desire and aptitude to learn new software's
Strong organizational skills with the ability to multi-task
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Ability to work independently and remote
Local to the Dayton area, or within reasonable commuting distance

Full Job Description
Join a team that is changing millions of lives.

Transforming smiles, changing lives

At Align Technology, we believe a great smile can transform a person’s life, so we create technology that gives people the confidence to take on whatever’s next. We revolutionized the orthodontic industry with the introduction of the Invisalign system, and we have never lost sight of that spirit of innovation. Our diverse and collaborative teams are constantly pushing the boundaries of what’s possible.

Ready to join us?

About this opportunity

The successful Database Marketing Intern will be provided a mentored learning experience and the opportunity to grow his/her classroom knowledge and skills in collaborative professional work environment focused on shaping and creating data sets to drive analytical capabilities.

This internship will give you an amazing opportunity to work on key projects and initiatives to identify new patterns and make new discoveries that will enhance our product offering. The Database Marketing Intern will draw upon the practice of data analysis, data management methodologies, data mining, pattern recognition, data modeling, and solutions design in order to help solve complex business problems. This will be a three-month internship based in San Jose, CA.

In this role, you will…

Build Big Data data sets that will be used in Power BI visualizations and be used to power new insights within the global team.

Present a capstone project to Senior leadership with some of your findings from what you build in your time with Align.

Communicate with internal and external clients to understand business needs and provide data solutions.

Work in an agile, collaborative environment, partnering with other scientists, engineers, and other analysts to bring new solutions to the table.

In this role, you’ll need …

Excellent problem solving skills
Experience in debugging, troubleshooting, and designing & implementing solutions to complex technical issues
Currently enrolled in a bachelor’s program, including but not limited to: Statistics, Data Science, Analytics, Economics, Business Administration, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering, or Mechanical Engineering
Ability to work in a team environment
Detail oriented with focus on quality and accuracy
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong technical and analytical abilities, a knack for driving impact and growth, Strong database query and data manipulation skills in SQL required.

Sound like a good fit?

Great! Click the "Apply" link to let us know you are interested. Not the right fit? Don’t worry, Align is quickly growing so we are creating more opportunities to expand our Align family. Please consider joining our Talent Network to receive notifications about future jobs or sharing this opportunity with others in your network.

About Align

Align Technology is a publicly traded medical device company that is transforming smiles and changing lives. Our global team of talented employees develop innovative technology, tools and treatment options to help dental professionals worldwide achieve the clinical results they expect. Our digital ecosystem combines the power of technology to create beautiful smiles through the integration of AI and machine learning, digital imaging and visualization, biomechanics and material science to develop the Invisalign system, the most advanced clear aligner system in the world; iTero Intraoral Scanners and OrthoCAD digital services. Did you know? Align is the world’s largest manufacturer of custom 3D-printed materials.

By joining Align, you will be part of a global, fast-growing company in one of the most dynamic industries. Great people, innovative technologies, and meaningful work – these are just some of the things employees say make Align Technology a great place to work.

We respect your privacy. Please review our Applicant Privacy Policies for additional information.

Global Diversity Statement:
At Align, we believe in the power of a smile, and we know that every smile is as unique as our employees. As we grow, we will continue building a workforce of diverse cultural backgrounds and life experiences and fostering a culture of open-mindedness and compassion for all our employees. We live our company values by promoting healthy people and healthy communities. All with the intent of changing millions of lives, one unique smile at a time.

Equal Opportunity Statement

It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunity in all of our employment practices without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, marital status, protected veteran status, age, individuals with disabilities, sexual orientation or gender identity or expression or any other legally protected category.
