Full Job Description
  • (3151516)
Remote Undergraduate Clinical Data Science Research Opportunity, Dr. Crowson’s Lab, Mass Eye & Ear

Contact information:
Matthew G. Crowson MD MPA MASc FRCSC

Laboratory Website: https://projects.iq.harvard.edu/crow/people/matthew-g-crowson

Harvard Catalyst Profile: https://connects.catalyst.harvard.edu/Profiles/display/Person/193106

Project description and duties:
Dr. Crowson’s work involves applying data science techniques (i.e. machine learning and its various forms) to clinical data. Dr. Crowson has several ongoing projects including innovative applications of:

  • Computer vision for image segmentation as part of autonomous surgery,
  • Natural Language Processing for clinical notes,
  • Among others.
Dr. Crowson also performs ‘traditional’ clinical research using existing clinical data from the electronic health record. Further, Dr. Crowson also generates systematic reviews and other review-style manuscripts of interest to the machine learning and Otolaryngology fields.

Example prior projects:
Crowson MG, Dixon P, Mahmood R, Lee JW, Shipp D, Le T, Lin V, Chen J, Chan TCY. Predicting Postoperative Cochlear Implant Performance Using Supervised Machine Learning. Otol Neurotol. 2020 Sep; 41(8):e1013-e1023. PMID: 32558750.

Crowson MG, Lee JW, Hamour A, Mahmood R, Babier A, Lin V, Tucci DL, Chan TCY. AutoAudio: Deep Learning for Automatic Audiogram Interpretation. J Med Syst. 2020 Aug 07; 44(9):163. PMID: 32770269.

Crowson MG, Hamour A, Lin V, Chen JM, Chan TCY. Machine learning for pattern detection in cochlear implant FDA adverse event reports. Cochlear Implants Int. 2020 11; 21(6):313-322. PMID: 32623971.

Learning outcomes:
Goals for this research experience is to improve competency in data analysis methods, presentations, and scientific writing. Deliverables such as 1-2 peer reviewed manuscripts with student serving as first-author on the manuscript if work completed. The student may complete additional manuscripts if motivated.

Relevant texts for methods of the lab:
  • Applied Predictive Modeling. by Max Kuhn and Kjell Johnson. ISBN-10: 1461468485
  • R for Data Science: Import, Tidy, Transform, Visualize, and Model Data by Hadley Wickham and Garrett Grolemund. ISBN-10: 1491910399
Dr. Crowson, the principal investigator, will be the primary mentor. Research meetings will be held weekly, as well as continued daily contact using a mobile/web-based platform (e.g. Discord or Slack).

About Us:
Massachusetts Eye and Ear is an international center for treatment and home to the world's largest vision and hearing research centers. Mass. Eye and Ear is a member of Mass General Brigham and a teaching hospital of Harvard Medical School.

Mass. Eye and Ear clinicians are driven by a mission to find cures for blindness, deafness and diseases of the head and neck. Internationally acclaimed since its founding in 1824, Mass. Eye and Ear employs full-time, board-certified physicians who offer high quality and affordable specialty care that ranges from the routine to the very complex. Learn more about our Mission, Vision and Values and Diversity, Equity and Inclusion on our site.

Providing a safe environment for everyone is the core tenet of our Safe Care Commitment. Across Mass General Brigham, employees are doing their part to ensure that the hospitals, clinics, practices and office spaces across our system are safe and ready.

Mass. Eye and Ear physicians are located at our main campus in Boston, and at our suburban locations in the greater Boston and Providence areas, across 21 locations.

Skills required:
Some experience with statistics and computer programming languages such as Python or R strongly recommended. Students do not necessarily need to consider medicine as a possible career, as computer science and engineering students would also benefit from such an experience. Experience with machine learning techniques preferred.

Clinical Innovations-Req # 2695384

Digital Engagement Intern

Description:
Mount Sinai Hospital is looking for eager applicants to join the department of Clinical Innovation’s Digital Engagement Team. The Digital Engagement team overseas several technology projects that look to leverage new and existing IT infrastructure to improve patient experiences and clinical outcomes.

The Intern Position for the Department of Clinical Innovation is a blended Project Management and IT role. The Intern assists in project planning and implementation as a member of a project team. Key tasks include engaging with unit managers to increase adoption, end user training, managing/leading meetings, and reviewing, assigning, and completing project tasks.

This role will also have a special project with the MyChart Bedside Mobile team. This project is will involve coordinating the communication, training, and adoption of the MyChart Bedside Mobile app. The new app is a patient facing phone app that gives additional information about the patient’s stay including information about their care team, medications, lab results, schedule, and more. The challenge we face and will be working on, is making sure our clinical staff have the training and support to effectively engage with the patients and drive patient usage.

In addition to traditional project manager work, this role will require flexibility and the ability to take on additional tasks as the projects and priorities change. Potential work & roles include – Training/Trainer, Reporting, Data Analytics, Market Research, IT, Patient Engagement & More. Experience in all these areas is not required, but a willingness to learn new skills and push oneself is needed.

The Intern will also asked to take on tasks with limited information, work independently, and find creative solutions to achieve the project goals, sometime with little direction.

Strength Through Diversity

The Mount Sinai Health System believes that diversity is a driver for excellence. We share a common devotion to delivering exceptional patient care. Yet we’re as diverse as the city we call home- culturally, ethically, in outlook and lifestyle. position: Internship - Product Manager, Credit Cards - Summer 2021
description:
Full Job Description
**Note: Unfortunately, Summer Internships at LendingTree are not open to students who will require sponsorship now or at any point in the future. Thank you.

This position will likely work remotely the entire summer. However, our preference is to hire someone who will be based in the Chicago, IL area on the chance we're able to go back to office during the summer.

THE POSITION

Our former Summer Interns will tell you, LendingTree's Internship Program is selective, challenging and structured to push the limits of what they thought they could do - and they wouldn't have wanted it any other way. Are there easier ways to spend your summer? Absolutely. But a LendingTree Internship will help you grow professionally and also get you closer to landing a phenomenal job once you graduate – maybe even with LendingTree. Here's what you can expect:

Real work. The only person you'll be getting coffee for at LendingTree is yourself. You'll be doing professional level work that will have a real impact on the business
Training. Sure you'll learn a ton of industry skills as you contribute to your team every day, but you'll also go through specific training on: crafting a phenomenal resume and LinkedIn profile, getting interviews and how to handle them, how to give a great presentation and more
You're not alone. In addition from the support from your team you'll be assigned a Mentor outside of your department who will guide you and mentor you throughout the summer
End of summer presentation. At the end of the summer every Intern gives a PPT presentation to Executives which will include a summary of what you accomplished, what you learned and 2 ideas that will either make the company money or save the company money

RESPONSIBILITIES

Own a project – Analyze current customer experiences. Define and run qualitative and quantitative customer research to inform the development of web-based products
Monitor and analyze product performance and communicate findings and recommendations for meaningful changes.
Define Product requirements for actionable changes and reiterate.
Put together wireframes to support product requirements and changes to be done.
Understand scope of the internal web-based product, participate in workshops. Own feature delivery, and write product requirements by working with business and development teams.
Communicate to partners on the progress of the feature/functionality.

QUALIFICATIONS

Undergrad or grad student (3.5+ GPA required) who will be graduating in Dec. 2021 or May 2022 (GPA must be listed on your resume to be considered).
Preferred majors: Business, Information Technology, Computer Science, Sociology, Psychology
Proficient in Excel (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUPs, etc.) and SQL
Good understanding of customer research methods (qualitative, quantitative)
Knowledge of Agile/Scrum product development or software development methodologies is preferred.
Willingness to roll up your sleeves and GET STUFF DONE.

COMPANY

LendingTree is the nation's largest online lending marketplace. That means we connect customers with multiple lenders so they find the best deals on loans, credit cards, savings accounts and insurance. Our goal is to help people save money, and we believe the best way to do that is by giving them a way to shop for loans and compare lenders so they make their best financial choices. Our CEO Doug Lebda founded the company in 1996 after a frustrating house-hunting experience. In those days, we mostly helped people find good mortgage deals. Now, we help consumers find their best in personal loans, auto loans, business loans, student loans, credit cards, savings accounts, home equity loans and more.

What else you should know:
We're a publicly-traded company (TREE).
We've welcomed several other companies into the LendingTree family to augment our efforts at helping borrowers make their most sensible financial choices.
We've built the LendingTree app and My LendingTree dashboard to give consumers tools to manage and monitor their financial health.
We still make funny commercials.

CULTURE

We're a fast-paced company with an entrepreneurial bend. We work hard and test our products often. We're collaborative, ambitious, candid and high-energy. Our teammates are some of the brightest, most talented people you'll ever work with. We care more about your smarts than we do about the kinds of clothes you wear (but please, do wear clothes to work!), and we're pretty good about rewarding innovation, creativity and the knack for just getting stuff done (we even have an award for employees called the GSD, "Get Stuff Done"). Come work with us!

LendingTree is the kind of company that not only promotes diversity and inclusion; we thrive because of these values. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion (or creed), gender, gender expression, age, national origin, disability, marital status, sexual orientation or military status.

Full Job Description
The Genuity Artificial Intelligence Research Institute at Genuity Science is offering student internships in AI/ML in the biomedical sciences. Interns will work with closely with Institute Scientists on data generated from secondary/tertiary analysis pipelines. Interns will learn to use AI/ML, probabilistic programming, and other statistical genomics approaches to analyze various large-scale omics data sets to better understand disease etiology, identify novel drug targets, and discover biomarkers for use in precision medicine.

The mission of the Genuity AI Research Institute is to further scientific knowledge of biological complexity and the nature and origins of human disease. Advancing the collective understanding of human biology with AI/ML-enabled strategies allows scientists to more fully address human disease. To this end, the Institute is developing and publishing the industry’s most advanced data analytics.

The Genuity AI Research Institute is a novel “Manhattan” style R&D platform aimed at overcoming existing barriers in biomedical research and drug development paradigms. To do so, the Institute facilitates scientific collaborations among academia and industry to expedite commercial realization of scientific discoveries in the most effective manner possible.

Preferred Qualifications

Undergraduate and graduate students in Biology, Statistics, Computer Science, Biostatistics, Bioinformatics, or related field are encouraged to apply
Coursework in machine learning, deep learning, statistical methodology, predictive modeling, and algorithm development
Basic programming skills in Python and/or R with experience using modern machine learning and deep learning libraries (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Edward, sklearn, caret, etc.)
Strong communication and presentation skills with the ability to translate and communicate results to individuals of diverse backgrounds

Full Job Description
OBJECTIVE
The Remote Services Internship position will model the SUCCESS mission, vision, and values each day, functioning as a guide for daily accountabilities and responsibilities. This role is primarily responsible for creating, updating and resolving technical service requests from clients and internal staff with speed and precision. A focus of triaging devices dropped off in the office and on-going collaboration with other members of SUCCESS’S technical team when appropriate. Performing routine maintenance and monitoring tasks, additional depot tasks, and service support tasks as directed.

TRIAGE SUPPORT AND SERVICE REQUEST ACCOUNTABILITIES (50%)
Intake equipment delivered or dropped off to the SUCCESS office
Documenting case and device information in CRM systems
Working with vendors to resolve hardware and software issues on equipment
Repairing devices directly, or through warranty support
Updating clients on status of equipment
Triaging/resolving support requests in an efficient, effective manner-avoiding mistakes and minimizing time per service
Ensuring that remote services response standards are met on a consistent, day-to-day basis
Ensuring customer satisfaction with the resolution of each service request by confirming resolution upon completion of each service request
Collaboration with peers and technical staff to aid in transition of work to appropriate team
Following documented procedures, identifying gaps in documentation, and requesting that documentation be developed to bridge gaps
PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT ACCOUNTABILITIES (20%)
Create an accurate record of work performed according to SUCCESS standards and submit for weekly approval
Actively participate in the shadowing opportunities
MONITOR CLIENT NETWORK ACCOUNTABILITIES (15%)
Create service requests when monitoring reveals a need for technical intervention or correction and triage
TECHNICAL OPERATIONS SUPPORT ACCOUNTABILITIES (15%)
Perform service support tasks to aide tech ops team’s efficiency
Perform non-routine technical tasks under the direction of a Lead/Manager
RESPONSIBILITIES
This role will demonstrate SUCCESS’s core values and culture through daily work and expectations.
Feedback regarding the day-to-day interactions with individual technicians, teams and customers.
Collaborative approach to the Client Services Team, to aid in the forward movement across Operations
Identify and share positive feedback from internal Teams and Customers to encourage a constructive team environment.
Stay current and execute on tasks within your business unit.
Engage with Leads/Coordinators from other business units on collaboration between departments.
(This list of duties and responsibilities is not all inclusive and may be expanded to include other duties and responsibilities, as management may deem necessary from time to time.)

QUALIFICATIONS
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE
Recently completed an IT training program and/or actively pursuing a 2 or 4-year degree in an IT related field
Exceptional customer service skills and ability to articulate technical issues/resolutions in non-technical terms
Able to identify and respond to tickets according to priority
Ability to work quickly and accurately with attention to detail
Strong work ethic with an ability to meet deadlines with consistent time management skills
Experience following written procedures and documenting work
Willingness to “pitch in” as a member of the remote support team, to ensure that overall standards are consistently met
Recognition of, and empathy for, client expectations, business needs, frustrations and concerns

position: Teacher, Assistant, Internship STEM Camps ==Coding, Minecraft, Robotics==
description:
Full Job Description

Summer STEM Teachers, Assistants, Internship (Minecraft, Coding & Robotics)
Hello, and thank you for your interest in our Summer Technology Teacher and Assistant Positions! Below is an overview of the program and positions as well as a few questions to help us determine if you are a good fit for our company.

============== APPLY ONLINE http://bit.ly/3e4ONvU =====================

************************
**JOB DESCRIPTION**
************************

You must be available for 8 weeks this summer from June 8 to August 7. Classes typically run Monday-Thursday with occasional Fridays, and you will need to be available from 8 am to 5 pm. Some classes run in only the morning or just the afternoon, and sometimes both.

As a Teacher or Assistant, you will be driving to your site, typically a school or community education building. You will typically be responsible for bringing 2-3 plastic bins of equipment per class, which you will then be set up in a classroom before students arrive. You will need vehicle to transport class equipment. Our headquarter location is in Roseville, Minnesota. You will need to go every 1 to 3 weeks to our headquarters for training and equipment pick up and drop off.

Rochester and St. Cloud teachers will only need to go twice in one summer

You will be delivering our curriculum to classes of up to 18 students. Teachers must be comfortable with managing up to 12 students alone. Grade level will vary between K-8th grades depending on the class.

************************
ABOUT PROGRAM:
************************
Tech Academy teaches week-long technology classes throughout the US. We offer classes in Minecraft, Movie Making, Video Game Design, Legos, and Robotics for students ages 6-14. We are seeking enthusiastic applicants for our Summer Camp Technology Teacher and Assistant positions.

Ideal applicants for Teacher positions are college students/graduates with experience with elementary-age children or licensed teachers.

Ideal applicants for Assistant positions are tech-savvy high school or college students, or those qualified for the Lead Teacher position looking for a more relaxed role in the classroom.

Many of our past employees were able to use positions to satisfy an internship requirement from school.

************************
Training and Equipment:
************************
Before teaching or assisting, teachers must complete 12 hours of online training on basic camp management and leadership skills. You must also complete an in-house 12-hour employee orientation.

The curriculum will be provided to each teacher for each class. You are required to go over the curriculum, and submit projects to us prior to teaching. We will available during business hours via phone and email to help you. You will be provided all of the equipment needed to teach a class each week.

************************************
Pay:
************************************
Teachers: $15-$20 an hour
Assistants $12-$16 an hour
Prep and training: $8.25 an hour

************************************
Requirements:
************************************
-College Student/Graduate majoring in Engineering, Computer Science, Graphic or Visual Arts, Video Game Design or Education
-Experience with Elementary age children
-Have a valid driver’s license
-You will be required to complete a local and national background check
-Be very comfortable with technology and using computers
-Your own reliable vehicle that can transport up to 4 large plastic totes
-Able to lift equipment totes weighing up to 40 pounds
-You must be very punctual and reliable. Students must always be supervised.
-You must be organized and efficient to run an effective class
-You must be self-confident, energetic, creative, and assertive enough to control a class of high energy elementary-age kids
-You need to be able to work independently and communicate via email and phone with us on a regular basis
Reliable access to the Internet and a cell phone.

Plusses:
Knowledge of Legos, Minecraft, or both Programming or Robotics experience of any kind

============== APPLY ONLINE http://bit.ly/3e4ONvU =====================

We will need to follow all current COVID-19 Procedures in place during the summer

  • Childcare: 1 year (Preferred)

  • Driver's License (Preferred)

description:
Full Job Description
About Lumen
Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumen’s network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies.

The Role

Lumen Internships give the business an opportunity to train innovative college students pursuing specific disciplines in specific areas beneficial to Lumen. The student, in turn, has the opportunity to gain real-world experience and decide if Lumen is a good fit for them as they look for employment opportunities in line with their newly acquired degree. This internship is year-round. Candidates should be able to work 10-15 hours a week during the school year and fulltime during the summer months.

The Main Responsibilities

Essential Duties - Network Planning
  • Assists in all aspects of simple network equipment installation and decommissioning specifications
  • Ensuring data integrity of inventory systems reflect actual installed equipment
  • Maintaining Web Site
  • Able to learn Ethernet, SONET, and DWDM technologies
  • Minor Project Management skills

Must have a professional, outgoing, customer-service oriented manner Ability to interact with a variety of people, and professional in stressful situations Must be able to work independently and productively with minimum supervision; able to manage multiple projects.

Full Job Description
About Attentive:
Attentive is a personalized text messaging platform changing the way consumers interact with businesses and organizations. The company is one of the fastest growing startups in New York City and recently raised a $470 million Series E investment led by Coatue in March 2021. Other investors in Attentive include Bain Capital Ventures, Sequoia, IVP.

We work with 3,000+ of the most innovative brands like Coach, Urban Outfitters, CB2, Pura Vida, Lulus, and Jack in the Box. Attentive was founded in 2016 by the co-founders of TapCommerce, a mobile marketing platform that was acquired by Twitter in 2014.

Role Background:
We’re looking for a self-motivated, highly driven Data Analytics intern to join our Business Intelligence team for the summer. Our team is responsible for surfacing insights from raw data to internal stakeholders to make data driven decisions. We manage the data visualization tool Looker, build dashboards, and support analytics needs throughout Attentive.
You at Attentive
You are currently enrolled in a Masters or Bachelor's degree program in Computer Science, or related technical field.
You have experience in Software Development and coding in SQL
You have inherent curiosity, can’t help but ask “why?” and love using data & logic to explore potential solutions
You are excited by new technologies and building new things.
You are enthusiastic about the high impact, fast-paced work environment of an early stage startup.
Product Development at Attentive
Our team is 200+ engineers, product managers and designers from top tech companies including Google, Microsoft, Twitter, Moat, Oscar and AppNexus.
We believe our company will win in the long run through product innovation. To get there, we obsess over iteratively delivering customer value through rapid prototyping and data driven decision making.
Benefits and Perks
Internship salary is $35/hour
Daily lunch delivery credit and other goodies sent to home
Regular company-wide social events (even virtually!)
An extremely enthusiastic team that appreciates collaboration
Attentive is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We’re committed to diversity and maintaining a work environment that is free from harassment and discrimination. We’re committed to them because our core values demand it - values like Integrity First, Listening & Cultivating Discussion, and Default to Action. We believe in embracing “self” and that our true strength lies in the diversity of our employees. For this reason, applicants from all backgrounds are encouraged to apply, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of any protected status under federal, state, or local law.

Full Job Description
As a Product Management Intern, you are part of the team that sets the vision and strategy for the RTI product portfolio and manages the product life cycle that transforms that vision into reality. In this role, you will develop a deeper understanding of IIoT connectivity while working across multiple RTI teams to help discover, build and launch product capabilities. Your responsibilities involve driving projects for the RTI Connext product suite—our secure, real-time connectivity platform for the Industrial IoT—including:

Researching and capturing market and product requirements for industry-specific development workflows and improving out-of-the-box customer experience.
Developing go-to-market strategies and plans for new capabilities.
Creating sales and marketing content to support our field teams.
Updating and implementing PM processes (in tools like Confluence, Jira and Salesforce).

Real-Time Innovations (RTI) is the largest software framework provider for smart machines and real-world systems. Our software runs the largest power plants on the continent, connects perception to control in over 200 autonomous vehicles, drives the new generation of medical robotics, controls hyperloop and flying cars, and provides 24x7 medical intelligence to hospital patients and emergency victims. We are the best positioned small company in the world to create the very real future of intelligent, distributed systems.

RTI leads the world market for software that connects real-world devices. Our diverse and global workforce believes in working hard and enjoying the journey. We recognize employees for their achievements, offer great opportunities for career growth and development, and provide the tools they need to succeed. We also offer great benefits and flexibility. We commit to making your life as satisfying as your career. And, RTI’s team is unmatched; our collaborative, transparent, and creative culture truly sets us apart from the rest.

We solve some of the greatest challenges in technology. Our mission is to transform industries: automotive, medical, power, defense, and control. Our core values emphasize excellence, teamwork, and your potential. Few small companies can truly claim to make the world run better like RTI. Come help make a real difference.

Responsibilities
Understand and analyze RTI market, customer and product needs to identify product gaps and opportunities.
Translate product opportunities into technical requirements and product backlogs.
Work with engineers to build and launch new features.
Develop sales & marketing tools, including product collateral, getting started procedures, presentations, competitive analysis, videos and blogs.
Qualifications

position: 2021 Summer Intern - Global Brand and Communications
description:
Full Job Description
Program Overview:
Fiserv’s Summer Internship Program offers talented college students an opportunity to go beyond the classroom to develop leadership skills and gain meaningful hands on experience working as part of a global support team with professionals across the enterprise. Additionally, interns will participate in scheduled activities throughout the summer, including sessions with Senior Leaders, team projects, and other networking opportunities. Fiserv summer interns are in session from June 2, 2021 – August 13, 2021 and work approximately 40 hours per week.

Job Description

Fiserv Summer Interns will perform duties such as gathering and organizing data to provide information for departmental projects or reports; offering innovative suggestions; accompany professional level employees on assignments; request or give information and other related duties as assigned. Assignments serve to offer practical experience and broad exposure to the organization.

You will provide reporting and visualizations support to the Marketing Analytics team to help marketers throughout Fiserv build and execute effective marketing programs. You will work with marketing analytics leaders to review, compile and report on data in meaningful and compelling ways, and to create visualizations to more effectively communicate learnings and insights.

Qualifications:
Actively pursuing a bachelor’s degree and will graduate between December 2021 and June 2023.
3.0+ GPA preferred
Must have advanced Excel and PowerPoint knowledge and technical aptitude to learn new applications quickly
Currently pursuing a 4-year college degree in Marketing, Business, Decision Sciences or related discipline
Excellent analytical skills and a high degree of business acumen
Proven attention to detail and accuracy
Web Analytics – Adobe Analytics experience highly preferred
Analytics Reporting Tools (Power BI, Tableau)
Military-Affiliated candidates encouraged to apply (Veterans, Military Spouses, and Guard/Reservists)
Must possess unrestricted work authorization and not require future sponsorship

Majors:
A wide range of bachelor’s degree programs considered, based upon specific department needs, such as: Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Data Analytics, Finance, Economics, Accounting, Business Administration, Mathematics, Supply Chain, Human Resources, Purchasing, Sales and Communications

Please Note: Where we encourage you to apply now, our 2021 summer internship interview process begins in December and will continue through April. You can expect to hear from one of our recruiters if your qualifications

align.

Learn more about Fiserv:
To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that provides flexibility and affordability with a variety of medical, dental, vision, life insurance and disability options.

We are #FISVProud of our benefits and well-being programs. Our commitment to wellness, wellness education, preventive services and fitness activities are designed to meet you where you are.

Life moves fast. And as it does, we know most people aren’t thinking about “financial services”. But we are.

We help people and businesses move money and information every minute of every day. Our solutions connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another, millions of times a day, behind the scenes, reliably and securely.

We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments enabling innovative financial services experiences that are in step with the way people live and work today. The company’s approximately 44,000 associates proudly serve clients in more than 100 countries, so their customers, members and consumers can move money when and where they need it, at the point of thought.

Our Aspiration is to move money and information in a way that moves the world. As a FORTUNE™ 500 company and one of FORTUNE Magazine World’s Most Admired Companies for the seventh consecutive year, we are committed to excellence and purposeful innovation.

We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Full Job Description
Position Description:
About Lenovo

Focused on a bold vision to deliver smarter technology for all, we are developing world-changing technologies that create a more inclusive, trustworthy and sustainable digital society. By designing, engineering and building the world’s most complete portfolio of smart devices and infrastructure, we are also leading an Intelligent Transformation – to create better experiences and opportunities for millions of customers around the world. Join us in defining our world of tomorrow and creating smarter technology for all!

Who You’ll Work With
At Lenovo, we manufacture one of the world’s widest portfolios of connected products, including PCs (ThinkPad, Yoga, Lenovo Legion), tablets, smartphones and workstations as well as augmented and virtual reality (Mirage, ThinkReality) and smart home/o¬ffice solutions, software and services. Lenovo’s data center solutions (ThinkSystem, ThinkAgile) are creating the capacity and computing power for the connections that are changing business and society.

MBG (Mobile Business Group) – For over 90 years, Motorola has been a pioneering force in the mobile industry. From creating the first cellular phone in 1973 to the ground-breaking design of the RAZR; our mantra is simple, build the best innovative products and make sure they're attainable for everyone. It’s this philosophy that drives us relentlessly to create meaningful innovation that provides greater consumer choice and positively impacts their lives.

About Our Team
This is a friendly and dynamic team of about a dozen researchers and engineers with very diverse background and strong technical expertise. We incorporate converging technologies into both existing and new products that take us beyond today’s most advanced products: smartphones, tablets, PCs, and other electronic devices. We perform research and system integration of software and hardware to deliver exciting products utilizing artificial intelligence, computer vision, natural language processing, context awareness, connectivity, authentication & security, as well as other relevant research areas.

What You’ll Do
You will join the Mobile Technology Innovation team in Lenovo Research, an advanced research, and technology group within Lenovo. You will be working with a group of experienced colleagues on one or more of the current research projects. You will participate in regular team meetings, brainstorming sessions, team-building events, and other company activities. You will have opportunities to contribute to the business by solving actual technical problems with an innovative idea, try out your idea by writing code and testing your code, file patent applications, and make technical presentations.

This is a Fall Semester internship with the potential to extend through Spring 2022

Position Requirements:
Basic Qualifications:
  • Pursuing MS degree in CS, CE, EE or related field
  • Hands-on experience applying machine learning and deep learning knowledge to computer vision, image processing, or related area
  • 3+ years programming experience in one or more languages like Java, Python, C, C++, or MATLAB
Preferred Qualifications
  • Pursuing Ph.D. degree in CS, CE, EE or related field
  • Understand the design and use of data structures and algorithms
  • Experience developing one or more of the following: mobile camera system, image signal processing (ISP), computational photography, human-computer interaction
  • Familiar with one or more development systems like TensorFlow, PyTorch, Linux, Android, Windows, or real-time embedded system
  • Show a passion for innovation!
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any federal, state, or local protected class.

position: Internship - Product Manager, Credit Cards - Summer 2021
description:
Full Job Description
**Note: Unfortunately, Summer Internships at LendingTree are not open to students who will require sponsorship now or at any point in the future. Thank you.

This position will likely work remotely the entire summer. However, our preference is to hire someone who will be based in the Chicago, IL area on the chance we're able to go back to office during the summer.

THE POSITION

Our former Summer Interns will tell you, LendingTree’s Internship Program is selective, challenging and structured to push the limits of what they thought they could do - and they wouldn’t have wanted it any other way. Are there easier ways to spend your summer? Absolutely. But a LendingTree Internship will help you grow professionally and also get you closer to landing a phenomenal job once you graduate – maybe even with LendingTree. Here’s what you can expect:

Real work. The only person you’ll be getting coffee for at LendingTree is yourself. You’ll be doing professional level work that will have a real impact on the business
Training. Sure you’ll learn a ton of industry skills as you contribute to your team every day, but you’ll also go through specific training on: crafting a phenomenal resume and LinkedIn profile, getting interviews and how to handle them, how to give a great presentation and more
You’re not alone. In addition from the support from your team you’ll be assigned a Mentor outside of your department who will guide you and mentor you throughout the summer
End of summer presentation. At the end of the summer every Intern gives a PPT presentation to Executives which will include a summary of what you accomplished, what you learned and 2 ideas that will either make the company money or save the company money

RESPONSIBILITIES

Own a project – Analyze current customer experiences. Define and run qualitative and quantitative customer research to inform the development of web-based products
Monitor and analyze product performance and communicate findings and recommendations for meaningful changes.
Define Product requirements for actionable changes and reiterate.
Put together wireframes to support product requirements and changes to be done.
Understand scope of the internal web-based product, participate in workshops. Own feature delivery, and write product requirements by working with business and development teams.
Communicate to partners on the progress of the feature/functionality.

QUALIFICATIONS

Undergrad or grad student (3.5+ GPA required) who will be graduating in Dec. 2021 or May 2022 (GPA must be listed on your resume to be considered).
Preferred majors: Business, Information Technology, Computer Science, Sociology, Psychology
Proficient in Excel (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUPs, etc.) and SQL
Good understanding of customer research methods (qualitative, quantitative)
Knowledge of Agile/Scrum product development or software development methodologies is preferred.
Willingness to roll up your sleeves and GET STUFF DONE.

COMPANY

LendingTree is the nation’s largest online lending marketplace. That means we connect customers with multiple lenders so they find the best deals on loans, credit cards, savings accounts and insurance. Our goal is to help people save money, and we believe the best way to do that is by giving them a way to shop for loans and compare lenders so they make their best financial choices. Our CEO Doug Lebda founded the company in 1996 after a frustrating house-hunting experience. In those days, we mostly helped people find good mortgage deals. Now, we help consumers find their best in personal loans, auto loans, business loans, student loans, credit cards, savings accounts, home equity loans and more.

What else you should know:
We’re a publicly-traded company (TREE).
We’ve welcomed several other companies into the LendingTree family to augment our efforts at helping borrowers make their most sensible financial choices.
We’ve built the LendingTree app and My LendingTree dashboard to give consumers tools to manage and monitor their financial health.
We still make funny commercials.

CULTURE

We’re a fast-paced company with an entrepreneurial bend. We work hard and test our products often. We’re collaborative, ambitious, candid and high-energy. Our teammates are some of the brightest, most talented people you’ll ever work with. We care more about your smarts than we do about the kinds of clothes you wear (but please, do wear clothes to work!), and we’re pretty good about rewarding innovation, creativity and the knack for just getting stuff done (we even have an award for employees called the GSD, “Get Stuff Done”). Come work with us!

LendingTree is the kind of company that not only promotes diversity and inclusion; we thrive because of these values. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion (or creed), gender, gender expression, age, national origin, disability, marital status, sexual orientation or military status.

description:
Full Job Description
Position:
IT/Computer Information Systems Intern - Full-time - Summer 2021

Job Description:
About the Internship

The 2021 Arrow Internship Program will be 100% virtual. All events, training and meetings will be virtual. Arrow will supply all interns with company equipment.

Approximately 9 weeks; mid-June to mid-August; 100% remote due to current health and safety conditions

Candidates must be available on June 17, 2021 and August 12, 2021

Interns may be considered for potential extension and/or full-time opportunities on based on their internship performance

Who is Arrow Electronics?

Arrow Electronics is a global provider of products, services and solutions to industrial and commercial users of electronic components and enterprise computing solutions. Arrow serves as a supply channel partner for more than 150,000 original equipment manufacturers, value-added resellers, contract manufacturers, and commercial customers through a global network. The Company maintains over 300 sales facilities and 45 distribution and value-added centers, serving over 80 countries. A Fortune 110 company with 19,300 employees worldwide, Arrow brings technology solutions to a breadth of markets, including telecommunications, information systems, transportation, medical, industrial and consumer electronics. Arrow provides specialized services and expertise across the entire product lifecycle by connecting customers to the right technology at the right place, right time and right price. Arrow provides extraordinary value to customers and suppliers - the best technology companies in the world - and connects them through the company's industry-leading services.

Why Be an Intern?

Hands-on approach to learning and applying your degree

This intern will be working with Arrow's Program Management Team for our Global Engineering Organization. The IT/ Computer Information Systems Intern will develop applications that are used by Arrow’s core businesses, as well as external customers, to deliver data and performance reports. The intern will provide data analysis focusing on the business needs and drivers. They will focus on the definition, construction, and deployment of reports, dashboards, metrics and analytic components within a dynamic and high profile business intelligence environment.

Full Job Description

We are looking for a Data Science Intern who will support our product, sales, leadership and marketing teams with insights gained from analyzing cloud data.

This is a unique opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a new multi-disciplined team of experienced individuals who will be driving the solution design, development, and deployment of advanced machine learning solutions supporting the company’s digital medicine program and other mobile health applications.

The position is within Sikka Artificial Intelligence Lab’s team, which contributes to our autonomous diagnosis, health outcomes and inferencing technology strategy as well as our self-driving practice initiative.

The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. They must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams, from databasing and APIs to user engagement data. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide insights into machine learning techniques focused on classification, supervised learning, reinforced learning and eventually deep learning
  • Produce new and creative ML solutions in a landscape may include neural networks, with specific interest and emphasis on classification, supervised and unsupervised learning leading to deep learning systems, computer vision, human-computer interaction
  • Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions
  • Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques
  • Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets
  • Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes
  • Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy

Desired technical expertise:

  • Strong problem solving skills
  • Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
  • Experience working with and creating data architectures.
  • Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
  • Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.
  • A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques

We’re looking for someone in the midst of completing their Master’s or PHD in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field and is familiar with the following software/tools:

  • Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques: GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, etc.
  • Knowledge/Experience querying databases and using statistical computer languages: R, Python
  • Knowledge/Experience using web services: Spark, S3, RedShift, etc.
  • Knowledge/Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc.
  • Knowledge/Experience with distributed data/computing tools: Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, MySQL
  • Knowledge/Experience with NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB, Neo4J, Neptune, Cassandra, HBase and associated languages (Cypher, Gremlin)

Company Description:

Sikka Software is revolutionizing the field of retail healthcare software by providing the Sikka Platform Cloud which is seamlessly connected to over 400 combinations of practice management and financial systems covering over 96% of the dental, veterinary, audiology and optometry markets and provides a single application programming interface that anyone can build apps on. The company began with a simple vision, to help healthcare providers and small offices optimize their businesses via a series of easy-to-use cloud based applications through the Sikka Platform Cloud. Sikka Software has over 17,000 installations and is experiencing strong growth and market presence in the retail healthcare big data space.

About Lenovo

Focused on a bold vision to deliver smarter technology for all, we are developing world-changing technologies that create a more inclusive, trustworthy and sustainable digital society. By designing, engineering and building the world’s most complete portfolio of smart devices and infrastructure, we are also leading an Intelligent Transformation – to create better experiences and opportunities for millions of customers around the world. Join us in defining our world of tomorrow and creating smarter technology for all!

Who You’ll Work With
At Lenovo, we manufacture one of the world’s widest portfolios of connected products, including PCs (ThinkPad, Yoga, Lenovo Legion), tablets, smartphones and workstations as well as augmented and virtual reality (Mirage, ThinkReality) and smart home/office solutions, software and services. Lenovo’s data center solutions (ThinkSystem, ThinkAgile) are creating the capacity and computing power for the connections that are changing business and society.

MBG (Mobile Business Group) – For over 90 years, Motorola has been a pioneering force in the mobile industry. From creating the first cellular phone in 1973 to the ground-breaking design of the RAZR; our mantra is simple, build the best innovative products and make sure they're attainable for everyone. It’s this philosophy that drives us relentlessly to create meaningful innovation that provides greater consumer choice and positively impacts their lives.

About Our Team
This is a friendly and dynamic team of about a dozen researchers and engineers with very diverse backgrounds and strong technical expertise. We incorporate converging technologies into both existing and new products that take us beyond today’s most advanced products: smartphones, tablets, PCs, and other electronic devices. We perform research and system integration of software and hardware to deliver exciting products utilizing artificial intelligence, computer vision, natural language processing, context awareness, connectivity, authentication & security, as well as other relevant research areas.

What You’ll Do
You will join the Mobile Technology Innovation team in Lenovo Research, an advanced research, and technology group within Lenovo in downtown Chicago. You will be working with a group of experienced colleagues on one or more of the current research projects. You will participate in regular team meetings, brainstorming sessions, team-building events, and other company activities. You will have opportunities to contribute to the business by solving actual technical problems with innovative ideas, try out your idea by writing code and testing your code, file patent applications, and make technical presentations.

**Note: This is a Fall Semester internship with the potential to extend through Spring 2022

Position Requirements:
Basic Qualifications:
  • Pursuing MS degree in CS, CE, EE or related field
  • Hands-on experience applying machine learning and deep learning knowledge to computer vision, image processing, or related area
  • 3+ years programming experience in one or more languages like Java, Python, C, C++, or MATLAB
Preferred Qualifications
  • Pursuing Ph.D. degree in CS, CE, EE or related field
  • Understand the design and use of data structures and algorithms
  • Experience developing one or more of the following: mobile camera system, image signal processing (ISP), computational photography, human-computer interaction
  • Familiar with one or more development systems like TensorFlow, PyTorch, Linux, Android, Windows, or real-time embedded system
  • Show a passion for innovation!
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any federal, state, or local protected class.

position: Research & Development Intern, Petroleum Engineering & Computer Science
description:
Full Job Description

About Ulterra Drilling Technologies

Ulterra is the largest pure-play, independent supplier of PDC drill bits to the oil and gas industry. Originally founded in 2005 and strategically headquartered in Fort Worth, Texas, Ulterra is the market share leader in North America and one of the fastest growing PDC drill bit companies in the world. With field service locations all throughout the United States, Canada, and international, Ulterra is advantageously located near the drilling activity to provide direct support to operators across the globe. Ulterra is dedicated to the complete design, manufacture, and delivery of customized drilling solutions and application specific technology with unmatched speed-to-market. In addition to supplying operators with consistent quality and innovative designs, Ulterra works alongside operators to target any performance limitations to ensure monetary efficiency and performance productivity.

With over 400 employees worldwide, Ulterra strives to earn the trust of our customers through customer support and consistent performance. Spanning across offices and manufacturing facilities around the globe, Ulterra is a company of people and it’s our people that make the difference. Ulterra takes pride on engaging our employees to create innovative solutions by collaborating with one another and our customers to make a difference in the oilfield. It’s this empowerment and collaboration that fuels our innovation and sharpens our competitive edge.

Position

Research & Development Intern, Petroleum Engineering & Computer Science

Job Description: Individual responsibilities for this position will center on leveraging experience from E&P drilling engineering towards the creation of valuable software assets for use internally to Ulterra and externally to our valued customers.

This includes:

1. Conducting research and exploring valid options to initiate the creation of a machine learning computer vision program that can evaluate and provide actionable recommendations from our database of dull pictures and information.

2. Assisting in the creation of web-based dashboards and evaluation software that improves the understanding and usage of drilling data acquired from Ulterra drill bits.

To be successful as an R&D intern, you must be highly self-motivated, proactive, have working knowledge of petroleum engineering, the inner workings of E&P companies, and software programming, and a drive to learn, build, and innovate on new methods that execute successful value creating campaigns.

Work Experience:

· Understanding of upstream oil & gas and drilling

· Self-starter

Desired Knowledge & Skills:

  • Knowledge of Petroleum Engineering and drilling concepts
  • Knowledge of E&P drilling program objectives and key criteria
  • Knowledge of machine learning frameworks
  • Knowledge of Drill Bit characteristics
  • Knowledge of JavaScript
  • Strong communication skills (written & oral)
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
  • Ability to work on cross-functional teams
  • Ability to read, write, understand, and communicate in English
  • Must be able to lift up to 20 lbs.

Required Knowledge & Skills:

  • Knowledge of Python Programming

  • Field of study in Petroleum, Engineering, Computer Science, or related field

Full Job Description

iOS Developer Intern

We are currently looking for enthusiastic and skilled iOS Developer Interns to join our Product development department and provide creative ideas and development work to help achieve specific product goals for iOS applications in the aviation industry. Someone who is also looking for an opportunity to find a good fit with our growing company, and is seeking an opportunity to be converted into a full-time employee.

You will also be working directly on the product development teams, with Design and Marketing, and at times with the president of the company who plays a large part in the overall designing of the product. You will be fully hands-on working with many aspects of the products on the front-end and back-end.

We are looking for someone who is positively aggressive, creative, willing to learn new things, seeks out the new and improved, and someone who is not afraid to fail and make competent mistakes. Someone who believes that there is no proverbial "box" to begin with so never has to be asked to “think outside of the box”.

You must be prepared to work with very bright and creative individuals who believe in a vision and who see themselves as a family who believe that truth, integrity, and personal wellbeing comes first and that the vision of the company is most important in their professional lives.

Responsibilities

  • Design, build, maintain clean, and clever swift codes
  • Able to build APIs
  • Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of iOS applications
  • Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to address and mitigate these problems
  • Work with the company's AI team and provide insights into key Machine Learning algorithms for the product
  • Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization of the iOS application
  • Apply understandings of mobile, and native apps (iOS)
  • Collaborate with other developers and designers to help define, build, and deliver new features in the iOS application
  • You will spend a lot of your time building iOS apps, efficiently coding in Swift. This includes new feature development, architecture, writing unit tests, refactors, and bug/crash fixes
  • Work in the development team to build basic algorithms for in-app metrics tracking and user adoption tools
  • Share responsibilities such as app architecture/design reviews, code reviews, performance tuning, and build pipeline management
  • Own and deliver all your tasks, small must-do tasks to larger, complex projects with many moving parts
  • Share your opinions and help shape our technical direction, best practices, product ideas, and team processes. Your inputs are most valuable.

Requirements

  • You are pursuing a BS or MS in Computer Science or related technical field
  • Solid understanding of object-oriented programming design & development concepts
  • Previous experience with Xcode and Swift/Objective-C
  • Strong analytical, problem solving, and debugging skills
  • Ability to be flexible and adaptable in a fast-paced startup environment
  • Solid coding chops, code design skills, and practitioner of mobile development best practices - including object-oriented design principles; design pattern usage; writing modular, reusable, testable code; data structures; concurrency; performance profiling and tuning
  • Developing proficiency in Swift, Cocoa Touch, Xcode, CocoaPods, git, etc. - the skills and tools needed to build iOS apps.
  • Developing proficiency in Java, JavaScript, Node.js, Angular (v7 or higher), PHP, Laravel, MongoDB, etc. - the skills and tools needed to build strong websites and mobile apps backend APIs.
  • Great communicator, adaptable, supportive, hard-working, and has a great sense of humor.
  • Loves to learn new things about programming each day.

This internship will help you acquire software engineering and development skills and provide you with knowledge of aviation industry-specific engineering requirements. Ultimately, you will gain experience in conceptualizing, designing, and developing software for both B2B and B2C markets within the aviation industry and should be prepared to enter any fast-paced work environment.

This internship has no set salary, it offers other forms of compensation, such as training, experience building, and possible commission and/or bonuses and full-time employment.

position: Computer Science/Electrical Engineering Development Summer Intern V
description:
Full Job Description
About our group:
We lead Seagate's consumer product division focusing on next-gen data storage and user experience.

About the role - you will:
Areas of Interest: NVMe, USB3.1 Gen 1/2, Thunderbolt, SATA, SAS, Fiber Channel, 10G Ethernet, RAID, Debug, System Performance Test, Python

Are you an Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or Computer Engineering undergrad student seeking an exciting summer 2021 internship and looking for an opportunity to leave a lasting impression in the consumer space?

We are looking for students ready to roll up their sleeves and help build game-changing products over the course of a 12 week summer internship at our Fremont Research Center. We are looking for students excited to help solve big problems and join a team with equally motivated co-workers. This is an awesome opportunity to work on early stage product development, solving real consumer issues. Responsibilites include:

Have the opportunity to help develop, test, and debug our cutting edge Consumer Electronic and Data Center Products
Help to characterize system performance and usage models for various storage technologies, propose methods to optimize data throughput
Support Research activities for other Advanced Development projects

Our summer interns typically work Monday thru Friday 8am to 5pm. The hours are subject to change with or without notice at the sole discretion of Seagate. Weekly communications with overseas design teams may be necessary.

About you:
Our ideal intern candidate must be a self-directed team player who thrives in a continually changing environment and has the following attributes and experience:
Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or Computer Engineering and returning to school in fall 2021
Excellent oral and written communication skills and the ability to work well in a team environment are essential to succeed in this role.
Great interpersonal skills and the ability to build consensus is a must
Excellent analytical and debug skills
Strong Electrical/Computer Engineering fundamentals with demonstrated ability to apply these skills to solve difficult real world problems
Experience with Network System Performance Testing and Script Writing a plus
Experience with various OS such as Linux, Unix, Windows and MacOS a plus
Experience with NVMe, USB3.1 Gen 1/2, Thunderbolt, SATA, Debug, System Test a plus
Experience with high speed interfaces and Hardware Testing a plus

Location:
Location: Fremont, CA

Our Gold LEED-certified Fremont product-design campus drives innovation, bringing together a diverse set of engineering, design, operations, support and administrative teams. The site is equipped with state-of-the-art clean room and lab space. On-site social activities are popular, including our annual BBQ, ice cream social, and holiday events. Wellness programs, gaming rooms and the on-site fitness center help round out and balance your Seagate work-life experience, along with opportunities to give back to our local community.

We are a dynamic and diverse team on a recurring multi-year, critical program, seeking a software development intern who likes to be challenged, solve problems, and be a contributing member of a highly skilled DevOps team. You will be on the leading edge focusing on technical analysis, software automation, and enhancements to systems currently under development to creatively solve our customer's needs.

As a member of our Code Name: “DogPatch” software team, you will work directly with domain experts and technical staff to support products integrated into Lockheed Martin “Skunk Work” product lines. While we can’t tell you what it’s for…once you’re briefed into the program, you’ll find it to be one of the most interesting and rewarding missions you could ever be part of!

Our intern experience focuses on building the ‘Next Generation of Engineer’. We assign a work ‘buddy’ to help you acclimate to the new team, set-up your development environment, support you with your work assignments and introduce you to your co-workers and peers to help you feel like a part of our team. You are supported by an Intern organization that hosts seminars to further your technical and professional business skills, creates social events and team building exercises, and collaborates on a ‘summer project’ to build upon your existing engineering skills. If this sounds like something you’d find interesting and exciting – joining the Lockheed Martin Rotary & Mission Systems could be the place for you!

College student actively enrolled in a Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, or other related degree program from an accredited college/university. Full Job Description
We’re hiring Summer Interns to join Insider Intelligence, the leading provider of research focused on digital transformation for a 10-week virtual program.

Insider Intelligence provides a variety of research products with a massive amount of data, forecasts, and insights to equip business leaders with prescriptive analysis and actionable takeaways for better business decisions.

Our analysts focus on these major industries: Advertising & Marketing, Consumer Demographics, Social Media, Video, Mobile, Financial Services, Telecoms & Technology, Commerce and Retail, and Digital Health.

The ideal candidate is:
Detail-oriented: You pay close attention to the small details when working on a task or project.
Curious: You ask lots of questions. You are innovative and strive to come up with creative solutions.
Eager to learn: You are ready to acquire new knowledge and develop professionally. You embrace emerging technologies and keep up with modern trends and tendencies.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills: You are an active listener, you proofread your work, and you’re concise.
Collaborative: You are comfortable working with other people towards a common goal. You thrive in an environment that encourages diversity of thought and perspectives.
Strong organizational skills: You prioritize well, you have a plan, you meet deadlines. Your goal is to be as productive and efficient as possible.

We have internship opportunities in the following areas:
Content: The Content teams aggregate information from many sources, analyze that research and data, and plug it into forecasting models. They use the information from the forecast model to make educated predictions on where the market is going and distill some best practices and practical steps for our clients.
Sales: The Sales team is the revenue engine of Insider Intelligence and is the most direct link between our digital transformation research and our customers. We work with the largest and most prestigious advertising agencies, consumer brands, social media companies, and financial services organizations in the world. Our Sales team relies heavily on cutting edge technology, analysis and analytics to enable our clients to stay one step ahead of the competition and to seize new opportunities.
Marketing: The Marketing team supports every group within the organization to ensure that all material and content produced by Insider Intelligence is compelling and meets the needs of our end customers. Overview:
Vectrus strives to bring high performance, operational excellence, and customer focus to every aspect of our business. In a rapidly changing and complex world, we continue to push to be a top innovator and achiever in the software development field and are proud to serve in our country's defense. We're seeking dedicated innovators and achievers to help us expand on our mission to provide high quality software solutions in the areas of RF modeling/simulation, spectrum sharing, and interference deconfliction applications. As either a Entry Level Software Engineer or an Engineering Intern at Vectrus, you will be provided the opportunity to learn from our professional software development team while you provide support to multiple DoD Program Offices as well as our commercial customers. You will work alongside our software development team to develop full software applications, RF modeling applications, quick-response custom tailored software applications, and many other related software engineering tasks.

  • Write and review software documentation.
  • Coordinate with team members to ensure problem resolution, appropriate risk reduction, and user satisfaction.
  • Work with our team to conduct software engineering best practices, such as code reviews, unit testing, and software static analysis. Be able to implement new software development process metrics as required by our customers.
Material & Equipment Directly Used:
Real-Time Spectrum Analyzers (RSA), Signal Generators, servers, and basic computers.

Working Environment:
Work will be performed in an office environment approximately 90% of the time. Some laboratory work may be required. Local travel is required with the possibility of regional and international travel roughly 5 to 10% of the time.

Minimum Qualifications:

Associates (2) year degree or in pursuit of a Bachelor’s (4 year) degree from an accredited College or University in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Programming, or related field with:
  • Experience preparing technical documents, test plans/reports, analytical evaluations, and presentations.
  • Ability to obtain a SECRET Security Clearance.
  • Must be a U.S Citizen.
Preferred Qualifications:
  • Past experience in with software development
  • Past experience performing RF modeling and simulation.
  • Active SECRET Security Clearance.

About Lenovo

Focused on a bold vision to deliver smarter technology for all, we are developing world-changing technologies that create a more inclusive, trustworthy and sustainable digital society. By designing, engineering and building the world’s most complete portfolio of smart devices and infrastructure, we are also leading an Intelligent Transformation – to create better experiences and opportunities for millions of customers around the world. Join us in defining our world of tomorrow and creating smarter technology for all!

Who You’ll Work With
At Lenovo, we manufacture one of the world’s widest portfolios of connected products, including PCs (ThinkPad, Yoga, Lenovo Legion), tablets, smartphones and workstations as well as augmented and virtual reality (Mirage, ThinkReality) and smart home/o¬ffice solutions, software and services. Lenovo’s data center solutions (ThinkSystem, ThinkAgile) are creating the capacity and computing power for the connections that are changing business and society.

MBG (Mobile Business Group) – For over 90 years, Motorola has been a pioneering force in the mobile industry. From creating the first cellular phone in 1973 to the ground-breaking design of the RAZR; our mantra is simple, build the best innovative products and make sure they're attainable for everyone. It’s this philosophy that drives us relentlessly to create meaningful innovation that provides greater consumer choice and positively impacts their lives.

This is a friendly and dynamic team of about a dozen researchers and engineers with very diverse background and strong technical expertise. We incorporate converging technologies into both existing and new products that take us beyond today’s most advanced products: smartphones, tablets, PCs, and other electronic devices. We perform research and system integration of software and hardware to deliver exciting products utilizing artificial intelligence, computer vision, natural language processing, context awareness, connectivity, authentication & security, as well as other relevant research areas.

You will join the Mobile Technology Innovation team in Lenovo Research, an advanced research, and technology group within Lenovo. You will be working with a group of experienced colleagues on one or more of the current research projects. You will participate in regular team meetings, brainstorming sessions, team-building events, and other company activities. You will have opportunities to contribute to the business by solving actual technical problems with an innovative idea, try out your idea by writing code and testing your code, file patent applications, and make technical presentations.

Someone who believes that there is no proverbial "box" to begin with so never has to be asked to “think outside of the box”.

Who we are?

Soave Enterprises holds interests in a diversified portfolio of companies which collectively generate annual sales in excess of $1.8 billion. These industries include metal recycling operations, luxury automotive dealerships, luxury residential real estate developments, industrial services and hydroponic greenhouse operations. We specialize in identifying and growing business potential, leveraging management strengths and financial resources to strengthen the businesses we acquire.

Soave Enterprises has a position open for a Student Intern - IT Department at its Corporate Office in Detroit MI.

Position Overview:
Soave Enterprises seeks a motivated individual interested in starting their professional career in the IT field as an intern. The individual will monitor and maintain computer systems and networks within the organization in a technical support role. He or she will also perform entry-level software development tasks and be part of the company s annual PC replacement project. The individual will work closely with a mentor and with managers within the IT department.

Interface and communicate clearly with department peers and internal employees to escalate problems as needed and resolve issues.

Analyze and correct problems using documented procedures and available tools while leveraging personal knowledge and skills.
Resolve remote access issues, printing issues and network connectivity issues.
Perform entry-level software development tasks including research, analysis, data querying, standards adherence and code optimization.

Able to perform work in a professional manner.

Job Description

Skyline Security Consulting Inc. is seeking a talented Cyber Compliance Intern to join one of the region's fastest-growing companies. This internship will consist of a combination of some on-site (headquarters office), some virtual (remote) work , and training. This is an UNPAID INTERNSHIP, however there will be expenses paid monthly totaling $500. These expenses incurred by the intern will be paid on the 1st and 15th of the month, $250 for each cycle.

As a Skyline Security intern, you will be learning how to detect, mitigate and exploit risks and vulnerabilities in information systems, as well as help, develop and test custom cybersecurity tools in support of internal operations and client projects. You will learn how to properly identify, implement, document, and validate NIST SP 800-53 security controls in accordance with various cybersecurity frameworks such as NIST RMF, CSF, and others. You will also learn how to maintain compliance with requirements such as PCI DSS, ISO 27001, FISMA, HIPAA/HITECH, and more under the direction of highly experienced and certified industry professionals.

As a Skyline Security intern, you will support IT Compliance within the Information Technology framework, collaborating with a broad team of technical and business resources and delivering customer-focused support to Skyline Security Consulting Inc.’s operational and compliance needs.

The responsibilities of the position include, but are not limited to, the following:

  • Evaluating system projects for IT controls compliance requirements
  • Defining IT controls compliance requirements
  • Coordinating IT controls design and implementation
  • Validating IT controls have been effectively designed and executed

In order to be qualified for this role, you must possess the following:

  • Be enrolled in a Computer Science, Information Systems or related four-year degree program as a Junior or Senior (graduate students are also welcome to apply)
  • Have a strong interest in Cyber Security, especially for networks, systems, and software
  • Have technical ability to understand networking, systems administration, and other facets of information technology
  • A background in software development using any mainstream programming language (e.g. Python, Java, etc.) is preferred, but not required
  • Basic knowledge of Security, Cyber Risk, IT general controls
  • Basic knowledge of FFIEC, NIST Cybersecurity Framework, and other auditing standards.
  • Basic knowledge of CISSP and CISA Certifications and requirements.
  • Ability to research and write technical assessments of various aspects of Cybersecurity Controls
  • Ability to document large volumes of electronic files involved in an Audit or Risk Assessment
  • Ability to manage time and prioritize projects and tasks
  • Ability to work well with internal customers, understand needs and support appropriately
  • Ability to communicate effectively, represent technical topic in business terms
  • Able to communicate clearly via email, telephone, or in-person with staff, clients, leadership, and industry partners
  • Be able to meet monthly in-person, in Bridgewater NJ for monthly Staff meetings
  • Enrolled in an IT Major E.g. Computer Science, Computer Info. Systems, or Management Info. Systems or equivalent
  • Ability to pass a background and drug screening
  • Minimum 3.0 GPA required
