Full Job Description
We are currently seeking a candidate to fill the following internship during the 2021-2022 season.
Title: Information Technology Intern
Paid Internship: $8.00/Hour
Reports to: Information Technology Service Desk Manager

Education:
Bachelor’s degree (or in pursuit of) from four-year accredited college or university with a degree in Computer Science, Information Technology (“IT”), Computer Engineering or related field preferred.
Degree in Computer Science / Information Technology/ Computer Engineering or related field preferred.
Previous work experience in IT not required, but a plus.
Basic Function: Shadow IT personnel and assist in providing technical support and consultation to system users on matters relating to software, hardware, network, mobile device and telecom at multiple office locations.

Skills Required:
Strong knowledge of PC hardware, Microsoft operation systems and Office suite of software applications.
Working knowledge of Microsoft Active Directory, Windows Server and Exchange. Working knowledge of data networks.
Ability to troubleshoot and to apply strong problem-solving skills in resolving issues at the end user level, including analysis and resolution of software applications issues (i.e., evaluate whether a program meets user needs, and if not, make appropriate recommendations; hardware issues and network issues).
Strong interpersonal and customer service skills and the ability to develop solid working relationships at all levels across the organization.
Excellent attention to detail and an ability to produce high-quality, accurate work under pressure and within designated deadlines.
Effective verbal, written and interpersonal communications.
Strong organizational and time management skills with ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks in a high-energy environment.
Ability to support a 24/7 work environment in providing services to Houston Texans (“Club”) and be willing to work rotating schedules during the Club’s football season.
Ability to maintain confidential and/or proprietary information.
Ability and internal drive to demonstrate a winning attitude and a strong work ethic in the performance of all job responsibilities.

Job Function (duties and responsibilities):
Create a positive client support experience and build strong relationships by analyzing and resolving problems and issues in a timely and responsive manner, communicating promptly on progress, and interacting with Club employees with a consummately professional attitude.
Apply knowledge and experience to understand, analyze and resolve problems and issues with software, hardware and information system procedures, resolve or escalate technical issues as necessary to achieve timely problem resolution, provide consultation and implement effective solutions.
Assist in the setup and deployment of PC and/or laptop equipment for new employees using standard hardware images and software via Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM).
Participate in the overall service delivery process (Information Technology Infrastructure Library and IT Service Management (“ITIL/ITSM”)).
Investigate and resolve software and hardware incidents (e.g., MS Office suite, operating systems, graphics, printing, email, mobile devices, VPN, web browser, etc.).
Document problem analysis, communication and resolution in ServiceNow, the ITIL/ITSM service desk tracking application.
Maintain an updated inventory of service desk related assets such as PC hardware, software, mobile devices, printers and scanners, and conduct semi-annual physical equipment audits.
Modify configurations, utilities, software settings, etc., for workstations as required.
Remain current on all state-of-the art technical equipment and best practices in the information systems industry through self-paced learning, training courses and technical conferences.
Perform various other tasks as may be assigned from time to time by the Service Desk Manager and/or Vice President, Information Technology.
Job responsibilities are to be physically performed in the Club or on a remote basis during business hours or after hours (i.e., from another office location or from home or elsewhere), as determined by the particular situation and with supervisor approval.

Travel Requirements: Possible domestic travel to pre-season and regular season games as assigned.

Please note that while resumes of all candidates will be considered, as a way for the Texans organization to acknowledge and reciprocate the tremendous support given the Team by local fans and the local community in general, qualified candidates with permanent addresses in the Houston metropolitan and surrounding areas will be given first consideration whenever possible.

If your skills and experience match our available position requirements, a Human Resources representative will contact you directly. Due to the volume of resumes received by the Houston Texans, we are unable to provide updates on the status of individual applications.

The Houston Texans organization is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

description:
Full Job Description
Responsibilities

One of the nation’s largest and most respected providers of hospital and healthcare services, Universal Health Services, Inc. has built an impressive record of achievement and performance. Growing steadily since its inception into an esteemed Fortune 500 corporation, annual revenues were $11.4 billion in 2019. In 2020, UHS was again recognized as one of the World’s Most Admired Companies by Fortune; ranked #281 on the Fortune 500; and in 2017, listed #275 in Forbes inaugural ranking of America’s Top 500 Public Companies. Headquartered in King of Prussia, PA, UHS has 90,000 employees and through its subsidiaries operates 26 acute care hospitals, 328 behavioral health facilities, 42 outpatient facilities and ambulatory care access points, an insurance offering, a physician network and various related services located in 37 U.S. states, Washington, D.C., Puerto Rico and the United Kingdom.

Position Summary:
The Corporate Information Services team at UHS is looking for motivated professionals to join our cutting edge team and implement technology solutions to improve healthcare quality and safety, improve patient care, and engage patients and their families in their healthcare.

As a Software Engineer Intern (SQL Server) you will have the opportunity to work on real-time and meaningful projects, develop your technical skills, collaborate and network with various teams, and receive mentorship.

Essential Job Duties:
Participates in lunch and learn sessions to collaborate on UHS IS priorities.
Participates in IS projects.
Shadows Information Services employees to learn the different roles.
Gains familiarity with different healthcare IS systems.

Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or a related degree from accredited college or university
Basic computer skills and experience with Microsoft Office applications ‘
Healthcare experience preferred
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Strong problem solving and analytical skills
Desire to learn and share ideas in a collaborative work environment

Any employment referenced in this website is not with Universal Health Services, Inc. but solely with one of its subsidiaries including but not limited to UHS of Delaware, Inc.

No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by UHS as a result of the referral or through other means.

All UHS subsidiaries are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates. UHS subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers and as such, openly support and fully commit to recruitment, selection, placement, promotion and compensation of individuals without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), genetic information, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

The primary responsibility of the Information Technology Intern is to support agency-wide information technology functions, such as computer deployments, maintenance, and service requests. This position will assist in Lextran’s major technology projects.

PRIMARY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

Assist with day-to-day management and maintenance of Lextran’s administrative technology functions, including computer deployments, troubleshooting, and end-user support.
Assist in the administration of a Microsoft Office 365 environment, including email support, password resets and reporting.
Assist in maintaining an agency inventory of technology and assessing future needs.

Vasion, formerly PrinterLogic, is looking for a part-time Quality Assurance/Tester Intern to join our growing team in St. George, UT, and that exemplifies our core values.

Action Owners, with key learnings drawn from Extreme Ownership by Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
Truth Seekers, illustrated in Radical Candor by Kim Scott

We are looking for a CS, Engineering, SW Developer, IT intern to help us with QA / Software testing and some test automation. As a software tester you will be helping to design test cases, execute test plans and automate tests to validate our SasS and on-premise solutions. We are a small and agile engineering team, with lot’s of manual tests. We value hard work, upfront communication, resourceful attitude and a desire to have fun. This will be a summer internship from May to August, 2021 intended for current students who are currently living in the Southern Utah area.

Become an expert on PrinterLogic solutions.
Responsible for writing tests and validating solutions based on customer requirements
Build out tests environments and tests for performance, reliability, scalability, longevity, etc.
Work closely with product owners and engineers to understand/define customer & functional tests
Participate as a productive member of an agile team of engineers
Communicate well with product managers, customer support, and other team members
Must be flexible and able to learn new languages and technologies quickly

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:
CS, Engineering, SW Developer, IT knowledge and practice
QA techniques and skills is a plus (Python, Selenium, JavaScript, C++, Jira, Agile)
Detail oriented is required
Understanding of web stacks and technologies
Strong organizational, communication, time management skills and a capacity for attending to details
Proficient with problem-solving skills
Must work well with others
In pursuit of Bachelor's Degree in an IT or Programming related discipline.

Benefits & Compensation:
Gain experience in a fast paced, quick growing company
Competitive, passionate and fun work atmosphere
Compensation based on experience, skill level, and certifications
Part-time hourly

Full Job Description
Position Description:
About Lenovo

Focused on a bold vision to deliver smarter technology for all, we are developing world-changing technologies that create a more inclusive, trustworthy and sustainable digital society. By designing, engineering and building the world’s most complete portfolio of smart devices and infrastructure, we are also leading an Intelligent Transformation – to create better experiences and opportunities for millions of customers around the world. Join us in defining our world of tomorrow and creating smarter technology for all!

Who You’ll Work With
At Lenovo, we manufacture one of the world’s widest portfolios of connected products, including PCs (ThinkPad, Yoga, Lenovo Legion), tablets, smartphones and workstations as well as augmented and virtual reality (Mirage, ThinkReality) and smart home/office solutions, software and services. Lenovo’s data center solutions (ThinkSystem, ThinkAgile) are creating the capacity and computing power for the connections that are changing business and society.

MBG (Mobile Business Group) – For over 90 years, Motorola has been a pioneering force in the mobile industry. From creating the first cellular phone in 1973 to the ground-breaking design of the RAZR; our mantra is simple, build the best innovative products and make sure they're attainable for everyone. It’s this philosophy that drives us relentlessly to create meaningful innovation that provides greater consumer choice and positively impacts their lives.

About Our Team
This is a friendly and dynamic team of about a dozen researchers and engineers with very diverse backgrounds and strong technical expertise. We incorporate converging technologies into both existing and new products that take us beyond today’s most advanced products: smartphones, tablets, PCs, and other electronic devices. We perform research and system integration of software and hardware to deliver exciting products utilizing artificial intelligence, computer vision, natural language processing, context awareness, connectivity, authentication & security, as well as other relevant research areas.

What You’ll Do
You will join the Mobile Technology Innovation team in Lenovo Research, an advanced research, and technology group within Lenovo in downtown Chicago. You will be working with a group of experienced colleagues on one or more of the current research projects. You will participate in regular team meetings, brainstorming sessions, team-building events, and other company activities. You will have opportunities to contribute to the business by solving actual technical problems with innovative ideas, try out your idea by writing code and testing your code, file patent applications, and make technical presentations.

**Note: This is a Fall Semester internship with the potential to extend through Spring 2022

Position Requirements:
Basic Qualifications:
  • Pursuing MS degree in CS, CE, EE or related field
  • Hands-on experience applying machine learning and deep learning knowledge to computer vision, image processing, or related area
  • 3+ years programming experience in one or more languages like Java, Python, C, C++, or MATLAB
Preferred Qualifications
  • Pursuing Ph.D. degree in CS, CE, EE or related field
  • Understand the design and use of data structures and algorithms
  • Experience developing one or more of the following: mobile camera system, image signal processing (ISP), computational photography, human-computer interaction
  • Familiar with one or more development systems like TensorFlow, PyTorch, Linux, Android, Windows, or real-time embedded system
  • Show a passion for innovation!
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any federal, state, or local protected class.

Shape the future today.

The world is changing. The question is, what will be our contribution to the outcome? We have set the pace in the field of mobility from the very beginning, and we will continue to do so. At Mercedes-Benz Vans, interdisciplinary teams are developing the mobility of tomorrow. Our goal is to make mobility safer, simpler, and more sustainable for people across the globe. Put your pioneering spirit to good use: This is your opportunity to make a contribution that extends far beyond your job title.

At Mercedes-Benz Vans, we offer you the perfect environment for your professional and personal growth. Mercedes-Benz Vans, LLC (“MBV”) is a plant in Ladson, South Carolina that produces Sprinter vans for the U.S. and Canadian market under the brands Mercedes-Benz and Freightliner. The midsize Mercedes-Benz Metris vans are also reassembled at this location.

Mercedes-Benz Vans, LLC invested 500 million U.S. dollars in the construction of a new Sprinter production plant in addition to an expansion of the previous assembly operations. In September 2018, MBV officially opened its new plant, located next to existing operations in the North Charleston area. The MBV facility will provide up to 1,300 jobs by the end of the decade and is expected to create at least 600 additional jobs in the region through its suppliers.

More than 120,000 Sprinters have been assembled in North Charleston and delivered to destinations in the U.S. since 2006. The U.S. is now the second largest market for Sprinter vans, after Germany.

Mercedes-Benz Vans, LLC is committed to fostering an inclusive environment that appreciates and leverages the diversity of our team. RESPONSIBILITIES:
Computer hardware and software deployment
End user support
Asset inventory management
Workstation imaging
Client patching and vulnerability mitigation
Review of system alerts and incident response
Create and update documentation
Application development and report creation
Other projects as assigned

Education: Currently a student enrolled in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related degree program.

Full Job Description
Time Frame: Summer 2021

At CUNA Mutual Group, we help people achieve financial security. Always working in the best interest of our valued customers, we help protect, invest and plan for a healthy future.Always working in the best interest of our valued customers, we help protect, invest and plan for a healthy future. We are a team of dynamic, collaborative, and innovative individuals who strive to make a difference in the organization and our communities.

We are looking for new team members who have a passion for information technology (application development or infrastructure) and strong communication skills. As an Information Technology Intern, you will be an active member of a cross-functional team. CUNA Mutual Group has embraced the Agile Methodology and follows both Scrum and Kanban frameworks to produce business value. Cross-functional teams are a critical component of these frameworks and are responsible for producing potentially-releasable, high-quality solutions at the end of each two-week team sprint. Members of these teams may have specialized skills and focus areas, but the collective team has accountability for technical analysis, design, development, configuration, and testing activities.

Throughout your internship you will have the opportunity to work directly with senior IT professionals to gain exposure to technologies, methodologies, and standards used today. You will also be provided several opportunities to network with your intern peers and other employees across CUNA Mutual Group.

Are you ready to join our team?

Responsibilities:
Help your team establish goals
Participate in managing the inventory of work to be completed by your team – and help break work into small, manageable components
Identify work you can complete for your team – and take ownership of completing this work
Identify external dependencies and risks that could block your team’s ability to complete work and achieve goals
Provide overall effort and remaining effort estimates for work you own
Communicate impediments and/or obstacles to the team’s progress
Collaborate and integrate with other teams as needed to resolve issues outside of your control
Deliver potentially releasable quality solutions at the end of each sprint
Demonstrate work that was “done” and answer questions about solutions delivered during each sprint
Embrace continuous improvement by inspecting the way in which your team works, actively participating in team retrospectives, and creating a plan for improvement

Requirements :
Enrolled and working towards an undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or related major.
Open to relocating after graduation to pursue a career as an IT professional.
Demonstrated ability to clearly and effectively communicate business and technical information verbally, in writing, and presentation.

Preferred Skills:
Application Development:
Understanding of application development life cycles, object-oriented designs and development, and agile methodology. (Scrum/Kanban)
Experience with the following is helpful: C#, JavaScript, Bootstrap, React, Web API, .NET Core, Angular, Xamarin, Entity Framework, Git, SQL, Azure, TDD, SSRS.

OR

**PROTECTED VETERAN DEFINITION

Protected veteran means a veteran who may be classified as an active duty wartime or campaign badge veteran, disabled veteran, Armed Forces service medal veteran or recently separated veteran.

Active duty wartime or campaign badge veteran means a veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service during a war or in a campaign or expedition for which a campaign badge has been authorized under the laws administered by the Department of Defense.

Armed Forces service medal veteran means any veteran who, while serving on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service, participated in a United States military operation for which an Armed Forces service medal was awarded pursuant to Executive Order 12985 (61 FR 1209, 3 CFR, 1996 Comp., p. 159).

Disabled veteran means (1) a veteran of the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service who is entitled to compensation (or who but for the receipt of military retired pay would be entitled to compensation) under laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, or (2) a person who was discharged or released from active duty because of a service-connected disability.

Recently separated veteran means a veteran during the three-year period beginning on the date of such veteran's discharge or release from active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service.

Full Job Description
Summary:
AvtechTyee is seeking an energetic, inquisitive, and disciplined Information Security Analyst Intern for projects related to implementing cyber security controls. The candidate will interface with several critical functional groups within the business. This is a project-based, process-focused role where the candidate will be required to be hands-on.

Our goal is to obtain CMMC Level 3 certification in the next six months and the intern will assist with the implementation of cyber security controls. The intern will be required to have technical knowledge and some work experience related to information systems and security.

The candidate will also work closely with the IT service desk analyst to provide first level IT technical support for all incoming calls, emails, walk-ins and Self-Service requests as well as planning and deploying hardware installations, end client software installations and configurations as per our security standards. This role may be required to work after-hours and/or on weekends and will perform other duties as assigned.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Analyze information security related logs, reports and data and identify risks to AvtechTyee’s information systems
  • Assist in formulating Plan of Action and Milestones (POA&M) to identify risks to AvtechTyee’s information systems and track remediation activities.
  • Implement and enforce the security policies and processes that are required by NIST and CMMC Security Controls and System Security Plans (SSPs)
  • Assist with applications/tools including but not limited to SIEM, IPS, internet gateway, multifactor authentication and DLP tools.
  • Utilize a variety of accredited security software tools to conduct vulnerability assessments, continuous monitoring scans, and those employed to maintain OS configurations.
  • Deployment of workstation image builds and maintenance of client hardware devices.
  • Involvement in the testing of client OS and applications as well as client hardware devices.
  • Provide updates to customers at regular intervals on Ticket status.
  • Attend to production support issues in a timely manner and escalate them to other IT team members and IT Manager.
  • Introduce and manage desktop virtualization technologies like VMware Horizon VDI at AvtechTyee.
  • Other duties as assigned
Qualifications:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Desired Education and Experience:
  • Actively pursuing undergraduate degree in Information Systems or Computer Science
  • Or equivalent combination of education and experience
International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) Requirements:
  • Must be a United States Person
  • ITAR defines a U.S. Person as a U.S. Citizen, U.S. Permanent Resident (Green Card Holder), Political Asylee or Refugee
Desired Skills::
  • Possess expert knowledge of Windows & Linux Operation Systems and be capable of installing, troubleshooting and configuring OS
  • Possess expert knowledge in supporting VPN and Virtual environments such as VMWare and VDI
  • Deep knowledge of network topologies, configuration management, VPN, Terminal Services, RDP and DHCP.
  • Be proficient in providing remote support through remote desktop protocol or other Remote Control software
  • Possess expert knowledge of various computing systems and peripheral equipment such as workstations, printers, scanners, hand-held devices and mobile phones
  • Experience working as a project team member or leading an IT related project that utilized a structured project management methodology
  • Experience working with end-points security and encryption solutions
  • Strong focus and attention to detail
  • Excellent problem solving and decision making skills
  • Ability to work independently with limited supervision
  • Ability to work effectively as part of a team
Project Description:
AvtechTyee is seeking to obtain NIST 800-171 and CMMC Level 3 certifications in the next six months. This project is to further secure AvtechTyee’s information technology (IT) infrastructure, cybersecurity and related business operations.

The goal of this project is to implement cyber security controls that will help improve cybersecurity posture. The solution(s) that will be used will adhere to the NIST 800-171 and CMMC Cybersecurity Frameworks and industry standards and best practices.

Project Deliverables::
  • Documentation and Implementation of NIST 800-171 and CMMC Cyber security controls
  • System Security Plan
  • Cyber Security Practice Guide
  • Presentation to the leadership team on the implementation of Cyber security domains

About AvtechTyee:
Since 1969 AvtechTyee has been a leader in the design, development, and manufacture of electronic systems for the aerospace industry, with a focus in five product groups: Communications, Power Lighting and Control, Electro-Mechanical, Switches and Connectors and Indicators. AvtechTyee’ s products are flying onboard 42 aircraft types within the air transport, regional commuter, and business jet sectors, serving 450 customers in 49 countries of the world. Our versatility in supporting aerospace electronics requirements ranges from the custom design and manufacturing of complex power supplies to complete Digital Audio Systems. The innovative design teams at AvtechTyee help anchor our competitive edge in this industry as we offer a broad range of system solutions and a proven ability to design and manufacture equipment requiring power conversion, digital electronics, and software capabilities. AvtechTyee is certified to ISO9001, AS9100 and the FAA’s ACSEP. Product Support includes in-house repair services (FAA approved Repair Station #IG6R621N), loaner/exchange programs, and both in-house and offsite airline training.

Who we are:
Jamf, the standard for Apple in the enterprise, extends the legendary Apple experience people love to businesses, schools, and government organizations. After watching hundreds of users struggle to deploy, update, and secure Apple computers, iPads, and iPhones in business and in the classroom, we knew there had to be a better way to handle such pesky IT functions. Removing the barriers of technology and empowering doctors to treat patients, teachers to teach, and businesses to thrive.

Today, more than 34,000 customers from more than 150 countries rely on Jamf to help them succeed with Apple. We don’t say we are the best, but we strive to be the best. We are a group of curious, self-starters with a passion for making people’s lives easier, paving the way for a better Apple experience in government organizations, hospitals, businesses, and schools.

What you’ll do at Jamf:
At Jamf, we empower people to be their best selves and do their best work.The Technical Support Intern position is an opportunity for individuals to compliment school curriculum and gain additional knowledge and experience. The role is key for learning the areas of software product knowledge, contact resource management, company structure, the technologies in the IT process and developing excellent customer service skills. During your time with Jamf, you will sharpen your professional skill set in a fast-paced technology company experiencing outstanding growth.

Responsibilities

Aid in the Service Desk functions, answering the General Support phone line and creating support cases to provide solutions
Apply problem solving skills and knowledge of company software to perform client support to facilitate solutions
Aid in the active development of an internal facing Wiki
Support and troubleshoot issues relating to system configuration, application usage, and software implementation
Create different software configuration & infrastructure environments in a development lab to troubleshoot client issues

Bachelor Degree, in progress; pursuing a degree in of Information Technology, Quality Assurance, Technical Writing and/or Software Engineering preferred (required)
Great written and verbal communication skills
Ability to analyze issues and use judgment to make decisions
Strong customer service and interpersonal skills
Capacity to work well with groups and as an individual
Working knowledge of Apple platform is preferred
Possess positive attitude with an ability to learn new technologies
Creative problem solving skills
Flexible along with the ability to operate within a fast-moving environment
Demonstrate practical experiences

How we help you reach your best potential:
We are progressive, but laid back. You are free to be you and work how you work best. Here, you manage your own day and your own work style.
Be your own self-starter. We support each other no doubt, but we thrive taking initiative and are empowered to roll up our sleeves, dig in, and push forward.
Everyone has a voice, and everyone can make a difference, our more than 90% employee retention rate agrees!
Opportunity to make a real and meaningful impact for more than 34,000 global customers with the best Apple Device Management solution in the world
We put people over profits – which is why our customers keep coming back to us at a 96% customer retention rate
20 of the Top 25 Fortune 500 companies rely on Jamf to do their best work.
We are relentless, but we are selfless. You can create and be creative, dig in, break it down, and troubleshoot to help others make sense of technology.
Best – in – class training in professional growth and product knowledge.

You are the right kind of Jamf if:
You go above and beyond for others, genuine and willing to help, always. You support the team around you, you don’t point fingers or pass blame. You take responsibility for your actions, are open, and respect others. You value different perspectives, in how you work and how you learn. You are naturally inquisitive, like to create and be creative. You are a problem solver, curious and resourceful, self-driven and constantly improving. You roll up your sleeves and dig in. You are excited by not knowing what may lie ahead. You are willing to take risks, try new things, even fail just to do it better next time. You’re not a jerk. You put people first. You are a good person, someone who just wants to do the right thing.

Why Jamf?
Our mission is simple; we help organizations succeed with Apple. At Jamf, we put people first. We focus on the human before we focus on the technology. We are just good people that have it in their gut to do what’s right – for our customers, our employees, and our communities.

position: Software Engineering Intern - Circuit Simulation R&D (Graduate Level)
description:
Full Job Description
At Cadence, we hire and develop leaders and innovators who want to make an impact on the world of technology.

The Circuit Simulation Intern will assist R&D staff in developing new algorithms and software for the Spectre circuit simulator. Job duties may include hands-on experience in researching new algorithmic approaches, software engineering to implement new features, performing software validation and testing, and investigating performance/accuracy issues in the simulator.

Applicant should have previous exposure to the circuit simulation area and experience in EDA-relevant software development, particular C/C++ unix development.

We’re doing work that matters. Help us solve what others can’t.

position: SAP Fieldglass iXp Intern - Cloud Engineering Services
description:
Full Job Description
Requisition ID: 274912
Work Area: Software-Design and Development
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About the SAP Internship Experience Program

The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP
Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.
About the team

The SAP Cloud Engineering Services team is a diverse group of talented individuals working remotely with colleagues spread across the globe who get to come in to work every day in support of both SAP’s existing on premise Fieldglass software as a service solution working to help shape and support the broader SAP Global 4+1 strategy shift towards containerization and The Cloud.

Our 24x7 365 support team focuses on helping to keep our applications and services up and running for our customers as well as with key initiatives for the broader SAP business. This is to help our customers run simple and take their business evolution forward with a mixture of solutions onto hyperscalers as well as on premise data centers depending upon the unique goals of our clients.

Are you passionate about learning how to do Agile Dev/Ops support on a radically open, transparent, collaborative team and interested in helping to shape the future of our user-centric vendor management software? Is it your goal to be a part of a multifaceted and truly global support team in order to help align and define the future of SAP’s applications and services for our customers? If the answer is yes, you would find an engaging and rewarding home on the SAP Fieldglass Cloud Engineering Services team.

Feel free to add any videos of your team or office that are posted on Life at SAP YouTube channel (ex: Learn more about the SAP Digital Business Services at Asia-Pacific Japan by watching this video / Watch this video and get to know the LAC Talent Acquisition team! / Learn more about our SAP Labs India in this video).

What you’ll do:
Position title: Internship Global Cloud Services, Tech Ops –

Job Title – SAP Fieldglass iXp Intern – Cloud Engineering Services

Location: Chicago, IL - (With international colleagues in both London and Brisbane though the team remains fully remote at present.) – please note that roles will be remote until local guidelines ensure safe office reopenings

Expected start date to end date: June 7th, 2021 - August 13th, 2021 (Ideally converting to join SAP thereafter.)

In this role, you’ll:
Become part of an agile and global Dev/Ops team, supporting our applications and services for our customers and helping to shape the future of SAP.
Have the unique opportunity to touch on many different aspects of an Agile Information Technology role and to interact with multiple teams while gaining exposure to new and existing software and service offerings to help influence and support systems that enable best-in-class operation of our SAP applications and services for our customers.
Gain real world experience working with some of the latest and greatest technologies including Google Cloud Platform, Kubernetes, SAP Gardener and more.
Pick up and put new skills to the test helping to manage our extensive existing products and architecture and working on automation of existing process workloads.
Learn the skills needed to help drive real business impact and results by actively working in cohesion with a global team of colleagues on efforts and the process of helping to achieve business and platform transformation for on premise and cloud-based initiatives.
Experience evolution, challenge and growth at the speed of business as a part of an ever-changing technology landscape at a world class company.

Who you are:
We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.

The ideal candidate is someone who is energized to work both collaboratively and while working solo.
Educational requirements – Candidates currently enrolled in an undergraduate or master’s degree program applicable to the position (computer science based or equivalent proven experience.)
Desired skills / experience to be successful in this role Include –
Self-motivated, can do attitude - someone who is engaged and stays curious and who knows that mistakes are opportunities to learn and grow from.
Good communication skills. Including the ability to professionally and effectively articulate technical challenges/solutions to colleagues and customers alike.
Excellent troubleshooting, documentation and root cause analysis skills.
Someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment working and communicating both in person and remotely with multiple teams across various geographical-locations.
Familiarity with both Windows and Linux based server operating systems (Including remote troubleshooting and supporting related software.)
Basic understanding of key Dev/Ops support concepts such as Agile methodologies virtual machines, containerization, and hyperscalers.
Some prior experience with using a command line interface as well as some familiarity with scripting, virtualization, containerization, and knowledge of source control software such as GitHub is desired for this role.
Basic knowledge and familiarity with Hyperscalers – Google Cloud Platform, Amazon Web Services and Microsoft Azure desired.
Familiarity or some prior experience working with Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery/Deployment pipelines is also a plus.

Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!

Full Job Description
About Us

With electric vehicles (EVs) expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world’s leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.

Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on EV charging and established a business model that's been validated by more than a decade in business and thousands of customers. As now a public company, we remain focused on broadening our market leadership and building on years of innovation. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime chance to build our all-electric future and dominate a trillion-dollar market.

Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.

Discover what it’s like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.

Reports To

Director, Hardware Engineering

What You Will Be Doing

The Hardware Engineering Intern will participate in circuit analysis and design as well as troubleshooting hardware related issues in the lab and field environments. This person will work with the other members of the Hardware Engineering team to gain a level of understanding of electric vehicle charging stations that will enable the candidate to contribute to the development of the next generation of charging station products.

Depending on the project need specific tasks could range from theoretical Digital and/or Analog circuit design, bread-boarding prototype circuits, prototype circuit test and validation, schematic CAD circuit implementation, board layout supervision, test fixture and cable assembly, beta product electrical and mechanical assembly.

What You Will Bring to ChargePoint

Background in electrical/electronic design.
Desire to innovate and create new technologies in vehicle charging.
Must be hands-on, inventive, curious, and creative.

Requirements

Analog and digital circuit design exposure.
Coding experience a plus - C++ or assembly.
2+ years of college-level coursework.in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or related disciplines.

Location

Campbell, CA

We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.

If there is a match between your experiences/skills and the Company needs, we will contact you directly.

ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer.
Applicants only - Recruiting agencies do not contact.

Full Job Description
DZS (NSDQ: DZSI) is a global provider of leading-edge access, 5G transport, and enterprise communications platforms that enable the emerging hyper-connected, hyper-broadband world. A pioneer in disaggregated platforms, SDN, and virtualization, service providers and enterprises look to DZS for the innovation that leads to future-proof networks and outstanding performance. Over 1200 service providers, operators, and enterprises in over 120 countries have leveraged DZS innovation, open solutions, and agility to arm them with the network resources and deployment freedom they need to lead in their markets and deliver an unrivaled communications experience. With manufacturing, engineering, service and support centers of excellence spread across the globe, DZS is positioned to bring next-generation technologies and world-class solutions to service providers and enterprises who are poised to transform, compete and win.

Job Summary

Apply your academic knowledge of hardware or software engineering to real-world R&D team assignments with our DZS R&D team. Our growth-oriented company provides you with valuable learning opportunities assisting with various stages of the product development lifecycle. This is not a typical “busy work” type of internship. You will have ownership of your R&D projects with accountability for results, providing you the opportunity to develop practical, real-world experience.

Duties & Responsibilities

Complete assigned R&D projects on time
Demonstrate a quality-oriented mindset
Proactively collaborate with R&D team members
Participate in product development reviews

Qualifications:
Computer Science/Network Engineering, Engineering, or Mathematics major
Minimum 3.0 GPA
Excellent analytical and mathematics skills
Ability to work in teams
Experience in programming languages

Intern positions are available at our Corporate Headquarters’ Office in Plano, Texas, and in our regional offices in Pangyo, South Korea, Hanoi, Vietnam, and Seminole, Florida. We will structure your internship period to align with your school schedule.

At DZS, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Full Job Description
EnerSys is the global leader in stored energy solutions for industrial applications. We have over thirty manufacturing and assembly plants worldwide servicing over 10,000 customers in more than 100 countries. Worldwide headquarters are located in Reading, PA, USA with regional headquarters in Europe and Asia. We complement our extensive line of Motive Power and Energy Systems with a full range of integrated services and systems. With sales and service locations throughout the world, and over 100 years of battery experience, EnerSys is the power/full solution for stored DC power products. We continue to grow in our industry by ensuring all employees possess the following core competencies: customer focused, team player, engaged, ethical, strong communication skills, and works safely.

Job Purpose

Alpha Technologies Inc. is an established leader in the design and manufacture of powering solutions for the Telecom, CATV power supply, and Traffic, Security, Medical, Industrial and Renewable Energy industries. The company offers a broad portfolio of high quality, feature-rich solutions that can be customized to suit almost any application and environment offering the highest performance and best value in the industry. With a focus on being your power solutions partner, Alpha builds on over 35 years of experience to develop solutions that resolve customer’s unique powering challenges.

Test / Networking Intern; to provide engineering support in software verification and validation of our Power Supplies, Gateways and other embedded IP/networked products. Perform a variety of tasks including automation of DOCSIS, TCP/IP, Web UI, SNMP components of products under test. Position requires the ability to generate and execute comprehensive test plans, test procedures, test reports, and detailed bug entries.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Assist in creation of automated test suites to enhance existing automation protocols
Automate (using python, bash, perl, etc) various components such as DOCSIS, network throughput (TCP/IP) traffic, WebUI, SNMP, etc.
Automate cause and effect scenarios (example, an action on the web UI component results in the change in behavior on a different component)
With assistance from the engineering team, document and develop test applications for various components including DOCSIS, networking (TCP/IP), Web UI, SNMP.
Coordinate and document systems level or component level qualification testing of network based communication products (i.e. SNMP, DOCSIS, etc.) in both non-automated and automated test environments.
Write detailed test reports, document feature/requirement deficiencies (A.K.A. bugs) with bug tracking tool, and other related Engineering documents.
Qualifications

Basic Qualifications

Candidate should be a graduate student or enrolled in undergraduate program related to Computer Engineering, Computer Science or related field with an interest in networking programming with existing C language experience or coursework.
The candidate should have an outstanding academic record, excellent organizational, interpersonal communication and written skills, strong quantitative and computer skills.
General Job Requirements
This position will work in an office setting, expect minimal physical demands.

Full Job Description
The NVIDIA Math Libraries team is seeking interns in the area of quantum circuit simulation software development.

NVIDIA's accelerated computing platform has revolutionized HPC and AI, and we are now looking forward to building an exciting new product to enable researchers and framework builders in the area of Quantum Computing. During this internship you will work closely with engineering and research teams across NVIDIA to help design, develop, and optimize software to accelerate Quantum Circuit Simulators. Ideal candidates will have a knack for developing proof-of-concept implementations quickly and a willingness to iterate on those.

Are you passionate about groundbreaking technology? If so, we would love to learn more about you!

What you'll be doing:
Assist with software engineering activities around proof-of-concept development of creative and innovative algorithms for quantum circuit simulators.

Collaborate with team members and other engineers from other teams to understand software use cases and requirements.

Help productize new functionality through design, development, debugging, testing, and documentation under the mentorship of senior engineers in your team.

Analyze the performance of GPU or CPU implementations and find opportunities for algorithmic or implementations improvements.

Present your results and findings throughout your internship.

What we need to see:
Currently studying towards a M.Sc. or Ph.D. degree (preferred) in Computer Science, Applied Math, Physics, or other related science or engineering field.

Experience with Tensor Networks or State Vector methods for Quantum Circuit Simulations.

Strong software development skills with C++ and Python.

Strong fundamentals in algorithms and numerical methods.

Good collaboration, communication, and documentation skills.

Ways to stand out from the crowd:
Experience with quantum algorithms and programming systems, and hybrid classical/quantum computations.

Parallel programming experience using multi-threading or MPI.

Strong basis in linear algebra and math for quantum computing.

GPU programming experience (CUDA or OpenCL).

NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world's most desirable employers. We have some of the most forward-thinking and talented people in the world working for us. If you're creative, autonomous and love a challenge, we want to hear from you!

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

If you are looking for a challenging and exciting career in the world of technology, then look no further. Skyworks is an innovator of high performance analog semiconductors whose solutions are powering the wireless networking revolution. At Skyworks, you will find a fast-paced environment with a strong focus on global collaboration, minimal layers of management and the freedom to make meaningful contributions in a setting that encourages creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. Our work culture values diversity, social responsibility, open communication, mutual trust and respect. We are excited about the opportunity to work with you and glad you want to be part of a team of talented individuals who together can change the way the world communicates.

Requisition ID: 63702

Job Description

  • Must be available from June-November 2021
We are looking for a Business Systems Analyst Intern eager to learn about Skyworks application systems and business processes. As a member of the team you will be supporting the management of several business enterprise solutions, accounting for current ones utilized within wafer fabrication plus any additional that might acquire and implement. You will participate in the implementation, development, enhancement and usage of our Manufacturing Business Systems (SAP, Promis, FabTime, Advanced Planning System, Dashboards), working in partnership with Production Control, Manufacturing, Process Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Finance and IT.

Job Responsabilities

Primary responsibilities may include:
  • Participate in development and management of manufacturing & planning business systems.
  • Day-to-day operational systems analysis and validation, troubleshooting system failures, analyzing planning / capacity results, formulates and suggests system enhancements.
  • Support Prod building in PROMIS (MES) and updates in SAP.
  • Maintains master data integrity within systems like SAP, PROMIS (MES), FabTime, Advanced Planning System, and other Databases.
  • Support the end-user community by providing research, analysis and problem resolution to team members.
  • Using strong analytical, consultative and communication skills, gather and document business requirements.
  • Negotiate technical and non-technical solutions that both satisfy the business user and conform to the technical architecture.
  • Trains users in conversion and implementation of new systems.
  • Actively demonstrate a passion for continuous improvement focused on end user productivity.
Education

Working towards or has bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Industrial Engineering or related field.

Skills

Intermediate to Advanced Excel, preferably with VBA programming experience.

Basic PowerBI skills.

Basic Microsoft SQL skills

Must have ability to communicate, motivate and organize projects throughout the company

Experience in building reports and data analysis.

Full Job Description
Description

Ingram Micro is seeking a motivated and talented IoT R&D Engineer Intern to join our 10-week PAID Summer Internship Program! We are looking for ambitious college and university students who are ready to expand their skills and apply them to meaningful work with a global organization.

Who is Ingram Micro?

Ingram Micro is the world’s largest distributor of technology. We touch about 80% of the technology being used in the world today, which means YES, we’ve probably touched some part of that phone, tablet, or laptop you’re on way before you did! With operations in 56 countries and more than 33,000 associates worldwide, we generated $50 billion in revenue just last year! After over 40 years in the industry, we’re continuing to expand our footprint and we’d love to expand it with you!!

At Ingram Micro, you’ll be part of a team that’s passionate about innovation and excited to work together to make a difference. We’re looking for dynamic team players who are ready to push the limits of what’s possible. We offer a variety of across all IoT solutions and services throughout Ingram Micro. You will immediately work on real projects alongside industry experts. We empower you as a future leader to collaborate with our global teams, develop ideas, and then run with them.

Essential responsibilities of your role:
Assist in developing code for IoT (Internet of Things) sensors to capture data and build out a dashboard based on Azure IoT central or ThinkBoard based cloud platforms.
Collaborate with IoT Solution design team to develop project-specific implementation strategies. Act as an ongoing project consultant to ensure success.
Develop, debug, and maintain code for IoT sensors and Gateways.
Assist in the development of server-side sensor data capture and recording.
Develop and maintain the server-side reporting mechanisms to help visualize data from sensors.
Test and validate the Sensors and Gateways from various vendors.

Knowledge, skills, and/or abilities you need to have:
Actively enrolled in an accredited college/university program, or recently graduated (within the last semester or quarter) from an accredited college/university program
Strong academic record with a cumulative overall GPA of 3.0 or higher
Enrollment in a computer science or engineering degree program is required.
Proficiency in .net C# and Python programming language required.
Good to have a working knowledge of Raspberry Pi or Arduino development boards.
Experience with data transmission standards such as Bluetooth, BLE, Wi-Fi, LoRa and LoRaWAN preferred.
Experience with Azure cloud, Azure IoT central, ThinkBoard other cloud-hosted platforms preferred.
Local candidates preferred.

  • This is not a complete listing of the job duties. It’s a representation of the things you will be doing, and you may not perform all these duties.
  • Must be authorized to work in the U.S. without restrictions or future sponsorship.
Ingram Micro Inc. is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or any other protected category under applicable law.

position: SW Application Engineer Intern, Extreme Cloud IQ (XIQ)
description:
Full Job Description
There has never been a better time to join Extreme, after three acquisitions extending our portfolio and go to market strategy, we have seen enormous opportunity and growth within the regions. Aside from being a Technology Leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant, we also adamantly promote an internal culture that truly embraces diversity, inclusion and equality in the workplace. Having Diversity and Inclusion as part of our core values and beliefs, we’re proud to foster an environment where every Extreme employee can thrive because of their differences, not despite them.

Extreme Networks is searching for SW Application Engineer Intern to help develop Extreme Cloud IQ (XIQ) Network Management solution.

Extreme Cloud IQ is an industry-leading and visionary approach to cloud managed networking, built from the ground up to take full advantage of Extreme’s end-to-end networking solutions. Using innovative machine learning and artificial intelligence technologies, ExtremeCloud IQ Manages, analyzes and interprets millions of network devices, user data points from the network edge to the data center,

to power actionable business & IT insights, and deliver new levels of network automation and intelligence.

As a member of the team, you will have the opportunity to contribute across the XIQ product stack, ranging from cloud-based microservices to on-premises virtual appliances.

What You Will Do

You will be part of an high-performing agile scrum team that designs, implements, and tests new features and functionality Extreme Cloud IQ . Development will include innovative technologies in the fields of NMS Cloud Management, Cluster, Security, Machine Learning. You will take new features from concept to delivery, working closely with team members and cross-functional partners to design and develop high-quality solutions that take into consideration scalability, availability, and performance. You will also actively participate in design and code reviews for the team.

Qualifications

Solid computer science fundamentals (data structures, algorithms, etc.)
Strong knowledge in Object Oriented JavaScript programming
Hands on Programming experience in HTML, CSS, JavaScript (Dojo, AngularJS, JSON, XML, REST, Bootstrap, LESS)
Hands on programming experience in Java, REST APIs, Spring FrameworkXML, REST, JSON
Experience at writing efficient and reusable UI code
Experience with HTML5, Responsive design and Ajax
Exposure to web standards and cross-browser compatibility
Good written and verbal communication skills

Other Desired Qualifications

Familiarity with Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning as it relates to networking
Familiarity with service-oriented architecture and distributed computing

You Will Be a Great Fit If You Are

A quick learner with excellent communication skills
Tenacious in your approach to problem solving
Self-starter and takes ownership
Eager to learn about and adopt the latest technologies and best practices in your field

Education

Pursuing a BS or MS in Computer Science or related technical field

  • Position is located at our San Jose, CA office. Qualified local candidates are encouraged to apply.
Extreme Networks, Inc. (EXTR) creates effortless networking experiences that enable all of us to advance. We push the boundaries of technology leveraging the powers of machine learning, artificial intelligence, analytics, and automation. Over 50,000 customers globally trust our end-to-end, cloud-driven networking solutions and rely on our top-rated services and support to accelerate their digital transformation efforts and deliver progress like never before. For more information, visit Extreme's website or follow us on Twitter, LinkedIn, and Facebook.

We encourage people from underrepresented groups to apply. Come Advance with us! In keeping with our values, no employee or applicant will face discrimination/harassment based on: race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, gender, marital domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, or veteran status. Above and beyond discrimination/harassment based on “protected categories,” Extreme Networks also strives to prevent other, subtler forms of inappropriate behavior (e.g., stereotyping) from ever gaining a foothold in our organization. Whether blatant or hidden, barriers to success have no place at Extreme Networks.

Full Job Description
Acrisure Technology Group (ATG) is a fast paced, AI-driven team building innovative software to disrupt the $6T+ insurance industry. Our mission is to help the world share its risk more intelligently to power a more vibrant economy. To do this, we are transforming insurance distribution and underwriting into a science.

At the core of our operating model is our technology: we're building the premier AI Factory in the world for risk and applying it at the center of Acrisure, a privately held company recognized as one of the world's top 10 insurance brokerages and the fastest growing insurance brokerage globally. By using the latest technology and advances in AI to push the boundaries of understanding risk, we are systematically converting data into predictions, insights, and choices, and we believe we can remove the constraints associated with scale, scope, and learning that have existed in the insurance industry for centuries.

We are a small team of extremely high caliber engineers with a diverse background across industries and technologies. Our engineers have worked at large companies like Google and Amazon, high frequency trading companies like TwoSigma and Jump Trading, and a variety of smaller startups, including successful startup founders.

The Role

As an AI Engineer Intern, you'll help move artificial intelligence out of the labs and into production in a way that transforms the insurance industry. You'll help build cutting edge AI systems that aid our customers in ways they might not deem possible. As a successful candidate, you combine machine learning and deep learning experience with strong computer science fundamentals and software engineering experience. You will take full advantage of state-of-the-art algorithms and tools, conceiving of new ones when the right solution does not yet exist. You work with modern ML tools such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, Spark, Kubeflow, and MLFlow to create robust, scalable, state-of-the-art products. You are driven by a passion for improving the world through technology. Help us to turn vision into reality.

Our technology runs on Google Cloud and is configured with Kubernetes, leveraging various services in that environment. Our data storage layer includes BigQuery, BigTable, and Postgres. We code primarily in Kotlin, Python, Java, and JavaScript and make use of many frameworks, including Dataflow, Cloud AI Platform, KubeFlow, Spring, and React.

Here are some of the ways in which you'll achieve impact:
Build efficient and reliable technology with a customer-first mindset.
Develop and deploy production ML models to solve business problems
Participate in model reviews alongside a leading team of AI researchers and AI engineers, helping to grow a world-class center of excellence for applied AI
Assist in designing and maintaining our tech stack, building when it makes sense, inventing when necessary, and upgrading as tools evolve.
Identify, adopt, and evangelize best practices.
Measure the effectiveness of new features, find and address performance issues, and drive continuous improvement.
Work collegially and effectively as we grow a world-class, diverse engineering team.
Design and conduct experiments, solving complex measurement challenges.

You may be fit for this role if you:
Possess exceptional knowledge of machine learning, computer science fundamentals, and software engineering principles.
Possess theoretical understanding and practical experience with machine learning algorithms for regression, classification, clustering, and unsupervised learning.
Have experience putting quantitative models into production, including by using deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch, workflow tools such as Kubeflow, etc.
Take a scientific, data-driven approach to problems, with a solid understanding of statistics (Frequentist and Bayesian) and applied mathematics.
Have an ability to measure, understand, and debug complex integrated systems.
Are product and customer focused, with a passion for delighting the end user.
Possess empathy, kindness towards others, a positive attitude, and self-awareness.
Obtaining a Bachelor's/Master's degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent experience.
Are willing and able to work remote for Summer 2021.
Are excited to work for an early stage company to experiment, discover product-market fit and are focused on maximizing business impact.

It's not expected that any single candidate would have expertise across all of these areas. If you are a solid engineer and eager to work on data- or insurance-related platforms/products, we are eager to talk!

Full Job Description
Zola is looking for an innovative MBA Product Manager Intern to join our product team this summer. This is a 10-week internship, where you will rotate between the Vendor Marketplace team and Core Experience team. You'll be teamed up with 2 dedicated engineering interns for the duration of your internship, while partnering closely with a full-time product manager and designer on each respective team. This is an exciting and unique internship structure that will give you the opportunity to work cross-functionally to solve real business problems in two of Zola's key focus areas.

We're looking for someone who can both sweat the details and tie them back to the big picture. The successful candidate should be equally comfortable talking tech with developers and brand positioning with marketing. We are looking for someone with a strong product mind who is excited to roll their sleeves up and dive into user problems as well as handle the nitty gritty of developing a new feature in a very short amount of time.

RESPONSIBILITIES

● Drive end-to-end feature development, from cross-functional ideation and solutioning to execution
● Develop hypotheses and conduct user research to validate ideas and influence feature direction
● Define and communicate project requirements to working team and stakeholders
● Analyze business impact and present findings to business and product teams
● Deeply understand the customer journey across Zola's products and devices and think creatively about how to serve the customer better
● Evaluate competitors and the market for capability-oriented and emerging development/technology trends specific to your projects
● Develop understanding of technical constraints and knowing where to push the boundaries

QUALIFICATIONS

● Currently pursuing a full-time MBA degree
● Demonstrated ability to prioritize and manage competing tasks in a fast-paced, highly ambiguous environment
● Exceptional technical, business and customer experience judgment
● Creative, scrappy, and customer-obsessed
● Collaborative team player with ability to build business relationships across functional teams
● Strong written and verbal communication skills; presents effectively to audiences of all types (technical and non-technical)
● Excellent quantitative skills. Understanding of SQL, Google Analytics and Segment a major plus!
● Previous experience in a product or analytical role within a high-growth, consumer-focused startup is a plus
● BA/BS required. A degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Business is preferred

ABOUT ZOLA

We're Zola, the wedding company that will do anything for love. We're reinventing the wedding planning and registry experience to make the happiest moment in our couples' lives even happier. From engagement to wedding and decorating your first home, Zola is there, combining compassionate customer service with modern tools and technology… all in the service of love.
We built our entire platform from the ground-up in 2013, and quickly became the fastest-growing wedding company in the country. Our team has deep experience creating award-winning online and mobile products that are helpful, intuitive, and simply magical. We're proud to have investor partners including Female Founders Fund, Comcast Ventures, Goldman Sachs, Canvas Ventures, Thrive Capital and Lightspeed Venture Partners, among others.

We are passionate about supporting all forms of love, and we're proud of our thriving community of over 1 million couples. We strive to hire a team that is as beautifully diverse as the couples getting married today, and we encourage individuals from every race, gender identity, age, sexual orientation, ethnicity, marital status, religion and perspective to apply. Zola will always be a place where every employee, couple, wedding guest, wedding vendor, and partner will be respected and accepted and valued.

Our headquarters are in NYC, and we have offices in Charlottesville and Montreal. Come work with us!

Full Job Description
Since 1999, WIN has been transforming the telecommunications industry. Today we own and operate over 9,000 miles of fiber optic network and a world-class data center and serve over 100,000 end users with top tier network services and IT consulting. Since day one, we've built our company on the competitive advantage of stellar co-workers. We recruit and retain smart, driven, and kind people to join our team and help make the world a better place through advanced communications technology.

Position Summary:
Joining the WIN team as a System Analyst is an integral role within the System Administration Department, and as such, all ideas, input and constructive recommendations will be highly valued. This position will assist in managing and updating workstations and provide front line support for all customers using the company ticketing system while working directly with customers. This is a highly collaborative environment requiring the ability to manage multiple projects and activities simultaneously.

Primary Responsibilities:
Provide excellent customer service to all customers (internal and external) and member companies. Set up and deploy computers and phones for new or existing employees. Use ticketing system to promptly respond to customer requests in an efficient, timely manner. Work with internal and security team on security framework SOP’s. Check server log files daily and research any potential errors. Assist with the implementation of Network Management Center & Technical Service Desk support systems. Monitor backup server, research and report any errors. Verify workstations stay up-to-date in accordance with maintenance schedule. Create and update system documentation. Assist with supporting printers and ensure monitoring systems reflect current systems.

Perform any additional job-related duties needed to help drive our vision, fulfill our mission, and provide our Members with industry leading customer service.

Technical Skills:
Familiarity with DNS, SNMP, SMTP, Radius, NTP, and network security. Must possess excellent verbal and written communications skills.

Preferred Technical Skills:
Experience troubleshooting computers, printers, and phones.

Qualifications:
Graduated or currently pursuing Associates degree in Telecommunications, Engineering, Computer Science or related field or have one or more years of experience in desktop support

Internship consideration given for qualified candidate

Mechanical Engineer Intern-TUC01066

Description

BOMBARDIER

At Bombardier, our employees work together to evolve mobility worldwide - one good idea at a time. If you have a good idea, we’ll provide the environment where it will thrive and grow into a great product or customer experience. Your ideas are our fuel.

With an average of over 300 sunny days per year, Bombardier Business Aircraft’s Tucson Service Center is surrounded by stunning mountain ranges and desert landscapes. Celebrating over 40 years of operations in Tucson, Arizona, the service center occupies almost 1 million sq ft of total hangar space and is the largest of Bombardier’s nine aircraft service centers. The facility services both Bombardier commercial and business aircraft. Since its inauguration in 1976, the facility has been located at Tucson International Airport, a strategic location and a key local partner. The 247,000 sq ft Business Aircraft facility is equipped to perform scheduled and unscheduled maintenance, modifications, including interior modifications, avionics installations, customized exterior paint, and Aircraft on Ground (AOG) support for Bombardier Learjet, Challenger and Global aircraft. The Service Center has received certifications from CAAC, FAA, EASA, Argentina (Military), Bermuda, Canada, Cayman Islands, Hong Kong, India, Mexico, Qatar and South Africa.

Bombardier has an exciting opportunity available for a Mechanical Engineer Intern based in Tucson, AZ.

In your role, you will:
  • Assist with interpreting customer specifications, vendor requirements, company/industry standards, FAA/DOT and foreign regulations
  • Assist with determining mechanical equipment, hardware, antenna and system requirements in all types of Bombardier aircraft
  • Assist with investigating design build issues and help develop structural engineering solutions
  • Release temporary engineering to resolve build issues in a timely manner
  • Assist in dispositioning aircraft non-conformances including rework instructions
  • Perform aircraft and engineering drawing investigation and coordination with affected engineering disciplines, Quality assurance and operations manufacturing representatives
  • Coordinate with vendors to resolve installation interface and reliability problems
  • Author engineering to define structural special instructions or restrictions
Qualifications

As our ideal candidate,

  • You are currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Aerospace, Mechanical or Computer Science Engineering
Please note: Relocation or housing assistance is not available for this position. No visa sponsorship is available for this position,

Bombardier is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by Federal, National, or Local Laws.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those under consideration will be contacted. Please continue to monitor our website and apply for additional positions for which you are qualified and may be of interest to you.

Position Description

The Intern of Content & Marketing Insights will be working across the Content Insights and Marketing Analytics teams under the Insights & Analytics department to help guide Starz’s global OTT expansion in content and marketing strategy through data analytics and business intelligence initiatives.

The intern will work with the Content Insights team primarily to track and analyze the competitive landscape on linear, and streaming platforms. The role will include an introduction to Nielsen reporting as well as experience with data queries using SQL. The intern will also support the Content Insights team to create PowerPoint presentations that provide in-depth analysis on Starz content performance.

The intern will be working with the Marketing Analytics team to gather, analyze, and present insights to guide marketing positioning and media buying decisions. This role will work with multiple social and audience insights tools, have hands-on experience with data warehouse using SQL, work with Tableau to build business intelligence projects, and present the insights to the department leadership.

This role involves technical analytical skills, but also requires clear communication with non-technical colleagues.

Responsibilities
Support Content Insights team in tracking competitive brands and reporting findings and/or trends
Help track and identify content performance demographics
Support team in creation of PowerPoint presentations that provide a visual narrative and actionable insights for Starz programming and the broader content landscape
Support trailer release and premiere social insights from data gathering, QA, analyzing, to communicating insights
Work with external partners to ensure the required data is loaded and ready for analysis
Support audience research to identify key behavioral, demographic, and attitudinal traits to inform the development and targeting of future marketing campaigns
Required Skills
Basic analytical and modeling skills including proficiency in SQL and Excel
Proficiency in Microsoft PowerPoint
Basic data visualization skills with a strong preference towards Tableau
Strong communications skills, including the abilities to translate complex customer data into meaningful insights
Statistical background including model building experience a significant plus
Enrolled in B.A. or B.S. programs in relevant fields such as Communications/ Business Communications, Marketing, and/or technical fields such as Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, or Economics
A basic understanding of the TV/Film landscape and interest/passion for a variety of content
